column1: Selegiline - induced postural hypotension in Parkinson ' s disease : a longitudinal study on the effects of drug withdrawal .
column2: chem* Selegiline *chem - induced postural hypotension in Parkinson ' s disease : a longitudinal study on the effects of drug withdrawal .

column1: OBJECTIVES : The United Kingdom Parkinson ' s Disease Research Group ( UKPDRG ) trial found an increased mortality in patients with Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) randomized to receive 10 mg selegiline per day and L - dopa compared with those taking L - dopa alone .
column2: OBJECTIVES : The United Kingdom Parkinson ' s Disease Research Group ( UKPDRG ) trial found an increased mortality in patients with Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) randomized to receive 10 mg chem* selegiline *chem per day and chem* L - dopa *chem compared with those taking chem* L - dopa *chem alone .

column1: Recently , we found that therapy with selegiline and L - dopa was associated with selective systolic orthostatic hypotension which was abolished by withdrawal of selegiline .
column2: Recently , we found that therapy with chem* selegiline *chem and chem* L - dopa *chem was associated with selective systolic orthostatic hypotension which was abolished by withdrawal of chem* selegiline *chem .

column1: This unwanted effect on postural blood pressure was not the result of underlying autonomic failure .
column2: This unwanted effect on postural blood pressure was not the result of underlying autonomic failure .

column1: The aims of this study were to confirm our previous findings in a separate cohort of patients and to determine the time course of the cardiovascular consequences of stopping selegiline in the expectation that this might shed light on the mechanisms by which the drug causes orthostatic hypotension .
column2: The aims of this study were to confirm our previous findings in a separate cohort of patients and to determine the time course of the cardiovascular consequences of stopping chem* selegiline *chem in the expectation that this might shed light on the mechanisms by which the drug causes orthostatic hypotension .

column1: METHODS : The cardiovascular responses to standing and head - up tilt were studied repeatedly in PD patients receiving selegiline and as the drug was withdrawn .
column2: METHODS : The cardiovascular responses to standing and head - up tilt were studied repeatedly in PD patients receiving chem* selegiline *chem and as the drug was withdrawn .

column1: RESULTS : Head - up tilt caused systolic orthostatic hypotension which was marked in six of 20 PD patients on selegiline , one of whom lost consciousness with unrecordable blood pressures .
column2: RESULTS : Head - up tilt caused systolic orthostatic hypotension which was marked in six of 20 PD patients on chem* selegiline *chem , one of whom lost consciousness with unrecordable blood pressures .

column1: A lesser degree of orthostatic hypotension occurred with standing .
column2: A lesser degree of orthostatic hypotension occurred with standing .

column1: Orthostatic hypotension was ameliorated 4 days after withdrawal of selegiline and totally abolished 7 days after discontinuation of the drug .
column2: Orthostatic hypotension was ameliorated 4 days after withdrawal of chem* selegiline *chem and totally abolished 7 days after discontinuation of the drug .

column1: Stopping selegiline also significantly reduced the supine systolic and diastolic blood pressures consistent with a previously undescribed supine pressor action .
column2: Stopping chem* selegiline *chem also significantly reduced the supine systolic and diastolic blood pressures consistent with a previously undescribed supine pressor action .

column1: CONCLUSION : This study confirms our previous finding that selegiline in combination with L - dopa is associated with selective orthostatic hypotension .
column2: CONCLUSION : This study confirms our previous finding that chem* selegiline *chem in combination with chem* L - dopa *chem is associated with selective orthostatic hypotension .

column1: Tetrandrine ( TET ) and fangchinoline ( FAN ) are two naturally occurring analogues with a bisbenzylisoquinoline structure .
column2: chem* Tetrandrine *chem ( chem* TET *chem ) and chem* fangchinoline *chem ( chem* FAN *chem ) are two naturally occurring analogues with a chem* bisbenzylisoquinoline *chem structure .

column1: In the in vivo study , the administration ( 50 mg / kg , i . p . ) of TET and FAN in mice showed the inhibition of thrombosis by 55 % and 35 % , respectively , while acetylsalicylic acid ( ASA , 50 mg / kg , i . p . ) , a positive control , showed only 30 % inhibition .
column2: In the in vivo study , the administration ( 50 mg / kg , i . p . ) of chem* TET *chem and chem* FAN *chem in mice showed the inhibition of thrombosis by 55 % and 35 % , respectively , while chem* acetylsalicylic acid *chem ( chem* ASA *chem , 50 mg / kg , i . p . ) , a positive control , showed only 30 % inhibition .

column1: In addition , neither TET nor FAN showed any anticoagulation activities in the measurement of the activated partial thromboplastin time ( APTT ) , prothrombin time ( PT ) and thrombin time ( TT ) using human - citrated plasma .

column1: Warfarin - induced artery calcification is accelerated by growth and vitamin D .

column1: The first series of experiments examined the influence of age and growth status on artery calcification in Warfarin - treated rats .
column2: The first series of experiments examined the influence of age and growth status on artery calcification in chem* Warfarin *chem - treated rats .

column1: Treatment for 2 weeks with Warfarin caused massive focal calcification of the artery media in 20 - day - old rats and less extensive focal calcification in 42 - day - old rats .
column2: Treatment for 2 weeks with chem* Warfarin *chem caused massive focal calcification of the artery media in 20 - day - old rats and less extensive focal calcification in 42 - day - old rats .

column1: To directly examine the importance of growth to Warfarin - induced artery calcification in animals of the same age , 20 - day - old rats were fed for 2 weeks either an ad libitum diet or a 6 - g / d restricted diet that maintains weight but prevents growth .
column2: To directly examine the importance of growth to chem* Warfarin *chem - induced artery calcification in animals of the same age , 20 - day - old rats were fed for 2 weeks either an ad libitum diet or a 6 - g / d restricted diet that maintains weight but prevents growth .

column2: Concurrent treatment of both dietary groups with chem* Warfarin *chem produced massive focal calcification of the artery media in the ad libitum - fed rats but no detectable artery calcification in the restricted - diet , growth - inhibited group .

column1: Although the explanation for the association between artery calcification and growth status cannot be determined from the present study , there was a relationship between higher serum phosphate and susceptibility to artery calcification , with 30 % higher levels of serum phosphate in young , ad libitum - fed rats compared with either of the groups that was resistant to Warfarin - induced artery calcification , ie , the 10 - month - old rats and the restricted - diet , growth - inhibited young rats .

column1: The second set of experiments examined the possible synergy between vitamin D and Warfarin in artery calcification .

column1: High doses of vitamin D are known to cause calcification of the artery media in as little as 3 to 4 days .
column2: High doses of chem* vitamin D *chem are known to cause calcification of the artery media in as little as 3 to 4 days .

column1: High doses of the vitamin K antagonist Warfarin are also known to cause calcification of the artery media , but at treatment times of 2 weeks or longer yet not at 1 week .
column2: High doses of the chem* vitamin K *chem antagonist chem* Warfarin *chem are also known to cause calcification of the artery media , but at treatment times of 2 weeks or longer yet not at 1 week .

column1: In the current study , we investigated the synergy between these 2 treatments and found that concurrent Warfarin administration dramatically increased the extent of calcification in the media of vitamin D - treated rats at 3 and 4 days .
column2: In the current study , we investigated the synergy between these 2 treatments and found that concurrent chem* Warfarin *chem administration dramatically increased the extent of calcification in the media of chem* vitamin D *chem - treated rats at 3 and 4 days .

column1: There was a close parallel between the effect of vitamin D dose on artery calcification and the effect of vitamin D dose on the elevation of serum calcium , which suggests that vitamin D may induce artery calcification through its effect on serum calcium .

column1: Because Warfarin treatment had no effect on the elevation in serum calcium produced by vitamin D , the synergy between Warfarin and vitamin D is probably best explained by the hypothesis that Warfarin inhibits the activity of matrix Gla protein as a calcification inhibitor .
column2: Because chem* Warfarin *chem treatment had no effect on the elevation in serum chem* calcium *chem produced by chem* vitamin D *chem , the synergy between chem* Warfarin *chem and chem* vitamin D *chem is probably best explained by the hypothesis that chem* Warfarin *chem inhibits the activity of matrix Gla protein as a calcification inhibitor .

column1: High levels of matrix Gla protein are found at sites of artery calcification in rats treated with vitamin D plus Warfarin , and chemical analysis showed that the protein that accumulated was indeed not gamma - carboxylated .

column1: These observations indicate that although the gamma - carboxyglutamate residues of matrix Gla protein are apparently required for its function as a calcification inhibitor , they are not required for its accumulation at calcification sites .

column1: Hemolysis of human erythrocytes induced by tamoxifen is related to disruption of membrane structure .

column1: Tamoxifen ( TAM ) , the antiestrogenic drug most widely prescribed in the chemotherapy of breast cancer , induces changes in normal discoid shape of erythrocytes and hemolytic anemia .
column2: chem* Tamoxifen *chem ( chem* TAM *chem ) , the antiestrogenic drug most widely prescribed in the chemotherapy of breast cancer , induces changes in normal discoid shape of erythrocytes and hemolytic anemia .

column1: This work evaluates the effects of TAM on isolated human erythrocytes , attempting to identify the underlying mechanisms on TAM - induced hemolytic anemia and the involvement of biomembranes in its cytostatic action mechanisms .
column2: This work evaluates the effects of chem* TAM *chem on isolated human erythrocytes , attempting to identify the underlying mechanisms on chem* TAM *chem - induced hemolytic anemia and the involvement of biomembranes in its cytostatic action mechanisms .

column1: TAM induces hemolysis of erythrocytes as a function of concentration .
column2: chem* TAM *chem induces hemolysis of erythrocytes as a function of concentration .

column1: The extension of hemolysis is variable with erythrocyte samples , but 12 . 5 microM TAM induces total hemolysis of all tested suspensions .

column1: Despite inducing extensive erythrocyte lysis , TAM does not shift the osmotic fragility curves of erythrocytes .
column2: Despite inducing extensive erythrocyte lysis , chem* TAM *chem does not shift the osmotic fragility curves of erythrocytes .

column1: The hemolytic effect of TAM is prevented by low concentrations of alpha - tocopherol ( alpha - T ) and alpha - tocopherol acetate ( alpha - TAc ) ( inactivated functional hydroxyl ) indicating that TAM - induced hemolysis is not related to oxidative membrane damage .
column2: The hemolytic effect of chem* TAM *chem is prevented by low concentrations of chem* alpha - tocopherol *chem ( chem* alpha - T *chem ) and chem* alpha - tocopherol acetate *chem ( chem* alpha - TAc *chem ) ( inactivated functional chem* hydroxyl *chem ) indicating that chem* TAM *chem - induced hemolysis is not related to oxidative membrane damage .

column2: Hemolysis caused by chem* TAM *chem was not preceded by the leakage of chem* K *chem ( + ) from the cells , also excluding a colloid - osmotic type mechanism of hemolysis , according to the effects on osmotic fragility curves .

column1: These effects suggest that the protection from hemolysis by tocopherols is related to a decreased TAM incorporation in condensed membranes and the structural damage of the erythrocyte membrane is consequently avoided .
column2: These effects suggest that the protection from hemolysis by chem* tocopherols *chem is related to a decreased chem* TAM *chem incorporation in condensed membranes and the structural damage of the erythrocyte membrane is consequently avoided .

column2: Therefore , chem* TAM *chem - induced hemolysis results from a structural perturbation of red cell membrane , leading to changes in the framework of the erythrocyte membrane and its cytoskeleton caused by its high partition in the membrane .

column1: Effects of long - term pretreatment with isoproterenol on bromocriptine - induced tachycardia in conscious rats .

column1: It has been shown that bromocriptine - induced tachycardia , which persisted after adrenalectomy , is ( i ) mediated by central dopamine D2 receptor activation and ( ii ) reduced by 5 - day isoproterenol pretreatment , supporting therefore the hypothesis that this effect is dependent on sympathetic outflow to the heart .
column2: It has been shown that chem* bromocriptine *chem - induced tachycardia , which persisted after adrenalectomy , is ( i ) mediated by central chem* dopamine *chem D2 receptor activation and ( ii ) reduced by 5 - day chem* isoproterenol *chem pretreatment , supporting therefore the hypothesis that this effect is dependent on sympathetic outflow to the heart .

column2: This study was conducted to examine whether prolonged pretreatment with chem* isoproterenol *chem could abolish chem* bromocriptine *chem - induced tachycardia in conscious rats .

column1: Isoproterenol pretreatment for 15 days caused cardiac hypertrophy without affecting baseline blood pressure and heart rate .
column2: chem* Isoproterenol *chem pretreatment for 15 days caused cardiac hypertrophy without affecting baseline blood pressure and heart rate .

column1: In control rats , intravenous bromocriptine ( 150 microg / kg ) induced significant hypotension and tachycardia .

column2: chem* Bromocriptine *chem - induced hypotension was unaffected by chem* isoproterenol *chem pretreatment , while tachycardia was reversed to significant bradycardia , an effect that was partly reduced by i . v . chem* domperidone *chem ( 0 . 5 mg / kg ) .

column2: Neither cardiac vagal nor sympathetic tone was altered by chem* isoproterenol *chem pretreatment .

column1: In isolated perfused heart preparations from isoproterenol - pretreated rats , the isoproterenol - induced maximal increase in left ventricular systolic pressure was significantly reduced , compared with saline - pretreated rats ( the EC50 of the isoproterenol - induced increase in left ventricular systolic pressure was enhanced approximately 22 - fold ) .
column2: In isolated perfused heart preparations from chem* isoproterenol *chem - pretreated rats , the chem* isoproterenol *chem - induced maximal increase in left ventricular systolic pressure was significantly reduced , compared with saline - pretreated rats ( the EC50 of the chem* isoproterenol *chem - induced increase in left ventricular systolic pressure was enhanced approximately 22 - fold ) .

column1: These results show that 15 - day isoproterenol pretreatment not only abolished but reversed bromocriptine - induced tachycardia to bradycardia , an effect that is mainly related to further cardiac beta - adrenoceptor desensitization rather than to impairment of autonomic regulation of the heart .
column2: These results show that 15 - day chem* isoproterenol *chem pretreatment not only abolished but reversed chem* bromocriptine *chem - induced tachycardia to bradycardia , an effect that is mainly related to further cardiac beta - adrenoceptor desensitization rather than to impairment of autonomic regulation of the heart .

column1: Given that sympathetic neural dominance exhibits a similar developmental pattern , and given that clonidine induces sympathetic withdrawal and bradycardia , we hypothesized that clonidine ' s developmental effects on cardiac rate and ultrasound production would mirror each other .
column2: Given that sympathetic neural dominance exhibits a similar developmental pattern , and given that chem* clonidine *chem induces sympathetic withdrawal and bradycardia , we hypothesized that chem* clonidine *chem ' s developmental effects on cardiac rate and ultrasound production would mirror each other .

column2: Age - related changes in ultrasound production corresponded with changes in cardiovascular variables , including baseline cardiac rate and chem* clonidine *chem - induced bradycardia .

column1: Recurrent use of newer oral contraceptives and the risk of venous thromboembolism .
column2: Recurrent use of newer chem* oral contraceptives *chem and the risk of venous thromboembolism .

column1: The epidemiological studies that assessed the risk of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) associated with newer oral contraceptives ( OC ) did not distinguish between patterns of OC use , namely first - time users , repeaters and switchers .
column2: The epidemiological studies that assessed the risk of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) associated with newer chem* oral contraceptives *chem ( chem* OC *chem ) did not distinguish between patterns of chem* OC *chem use , namely first - time users , repeaters and switchers .

column1: Data from a Transnational case - control study were used to assess the risk of VTE for the latter patterns of use , while accounting for duration of use .
column2: Data from a Transnational case - control study were used to assess the risk of VTE for the latter patterns of use , while accounting for duration of use .

column1: Over the period 1993 - 1996 , 551 cases of VTE were identified in Germany and the UK along with 2066 controls .
column2: Over the period 1993 - 1996 , 551 cases of VTE were identified in Germany and the UK along with 2066 controls .

column1: Totals of 128 cases and 650 controls were analysed for repeat use and 135 cases and 622 controls for switching patterns .
column2: Totals of 128 cases and 650 controls were analysed for repeat use and 135 cases and 622 controls for switching patterns .

column1: The adjusted rate ratio of VTE for repeat users of third generation OC was 0 . 6 ( 95 % CI : 0 . 3 - 1 . 2 ) relative to repeat users of second generation pills , whereas it was 1 . 3 ( 95 % CI : 0 . 7 - 2 . 4 ) for switchers from second to third generation pills relative to switchers from third to second generation pills .
column2: The adjusted rate ratio of VTE for repeat users of third generation chem* OC *chem was 0 . 6 ( 95 % CI : 0 . 3 - 1 . 2 ) relative to repeat users of second generation pills , whereas it was 1 . 3 ( 95 % CI : 0 . 7 - 2 . 4 ) for switchers from second to third generation pills relative to switchers from third to second generation pills .

column1: We conclude that second and third generation agents are associated with equivalent risks of VTE when the same agent is used repeatedly after interruption periods or when users are switched between the two generations of pills .
column2: We conclude that second and third generation agents are associated with equivalent risks of VTE when the same agent is used repeatedly after interruption periods or when users are switched between the two generations of pills .

column1: These analyses suggest that the higher risk observed for the newer OC in other studies may be the result of inadequate comparisons of pill users with different patterns of pill use .
column2: These analyses suggest that the higher risk observed for the newer chem* OC *chem in other studies may be the result of inadequate comparisons of pill users with different patterns of pill use .

column1: Intracranial aneurysms and cocaine abuse : analysis of prognostic indicators .
column2: Intracranial aneurysms and cocaine abuse : analysis of prognostic indicators .

column1: OBJECTIVE : The outcome of subarachnoid hemorrhage associated with cocaine abuse is reportedly poor .
column2: OBJECTIVE : The outcome of subarachnoid hemorrhage associated with cocaine abuse is reportedly poor .

column1: However , no study in the literature has reported the use of a statistical model to analyze the variables that influence outcome .
column2: However , no study in the literature has reported the use of a statistical model to analyze the variables that influence outcome .

column1: METHODS : A review of admissions during a 6 - year period revealed 14 patients with cocaine - related aneurysms .
column2: METHODS : A review of admissions during a 6 - year period revealed 14 patients with chem* cocaine *chem - related aneurysms .

column1: This group was compared with a control group of 135 patients with ruptured aneurysms and no history of cocaine abuse .
column2: This group was compared with a control group of 135 patients with ruptured aneurysms and no history of cocaine abuse .

column2: Age at presentation , time of ictus after intoxication , Hunt and Hess grade of subarachnoid hemorrhage , size of the aneurysm , location of the aneurysm , and the Glasgow Outcome Scale score were assessed and compared .

column2: RESULTS : The patients in the study group were significantly younger than the patients in the control group ( P < 0 . 002 ) .

column1: In patients in the study group , all aneurysms were located in the anterior circulation .
column2: In patients in the study group , all aneurysms were located in the anterior circulation .

column2: The majority of these aneurysms were smaller than those of the control group ( 8 + / - 6 . 08 mm versus 11 + / - 5 . 4 mm ; P = 0 . 05 ) .

column1: The differences in mortality and morbidity between the two groups were not significant .
column2: The differences in mortality and morbidity between the two groups were not significant .

column2: CONCLUSION : chem* Cocaine *chem use predisposed aneurysmal rupture at a significantly earlier age and in much smaller aneurysms .

column1: Effect of intravenous nimodipine on blood pressure and outcome after acute stroke .

column1: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE : The Intravenous Nimodipine West European Stroke Trial ( INWEST ) found a correlation between nimodipine - induced reduction in blood pressure ( BP ) and an unfavorable outcome in acute stroke .
column2: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE : The Intravenous chem* Nimodipine *chem West European Stroke Trial ( INWEST ) found a correlation between chem* nimodipine *chem - induced reduction in blood pressure ( BP ) and an unfavorable outcome in acute stroke .

column1: We sought to confirm this correlation with and without adjustment for prognostic variables and to investigate outcome in subgroups with increasing levels of BP reduction .
column2: We sought to confirm this correlation with and without adjustment for prognostic variables and to investigate outcome in subgroups with increasing levels of BP reduction .

column1: METHODS : Patients with a clinical diagnosis of ischemic stroke ( within 24 hours ) were consecutively allocated to receive placebo ( n = 100 ) , 1 mg / h ( low - dose ) nimodipine ( n = 101 ) , or 2 mg / h ( high - dose ) nimodipine ( n = 94 ) .
column2: METHODS : Patients with a clinical diagnosis of ischemic stroke ( within 24 hours ) were consecutively allocated to receive placebo ( n = 100 ) , 1 mg / h ( low - dose ) chem* nimodipine *chem ( n = 101 ) , or 2 mg / h ( high - dose ) chem* nimodipine *chem ( n = 94 ) .

column1: The correlation between average BP change during the first 2 days and the outcome at day 21 was analyzed .
column2: The correlation between average BP change during the first 2 days and the outcome at day 21 was analyzed .

column2: RESULTS : Two hundred sixty - five patients were included in this analysis ( n = 92 , 93 , and 80 for placebo , low dose , and high dose , respectively ) .

column1: Nimodipine treatment resulted in a statistically significant reduction in systolic BP ( SBP ) and diastolic BP ( DBP ) from baseline compared with placebo during the first few days .
column2: chem* Nimodipine *chem treatment resulted in a statistically significant reduction in systolic BP ( SBP ) and diastolic BP ( DBP ) from baseline compared with placebo during the first few days .

column1: In multivariate analysis , a significant correlation between DBP reduction and worsening of the neurological score was found for the high - dose group ( beta = 0 . 49 , P = 0 . 048 ) .

column1: This study assessed the ability of IH636 grape seed proanthocyanidin extract ( GSPE ) to prevent acetaminophen ( AAP ) - induced nephrotoxicity , amiodarone ( AMI ) - induced lung toxicity , and doxorubicin ( DOX ) - induced cardiotoxicity in mice .

column2: Experimental design consisted of four groups : control ( vehicle alone ) , chem* GSPE *chem alone , drug alone and chem* GSPE *chem + drug .

column1: For the cytoprotection study , animals were orally gavaged 100 mg / Kg GSPE for 7 - 10 days followed by i . p . injections of organ specific three drugs ( AAP : 500 mg / Kg for 24 h ; AMI : 50 mg / Kg / day for four days ; DOX : 20 mg / Kg for 48 h ) .
column2: For the cytoprotection study , animals were orally gavaged 100 mg / Kg chem* GSPE *chem for 7 - 10 days followed by i . p . injections of organ specific three drugs ( chem* AAP *chem : 500 mg / Kg for 24 h ; chem* AMI *chem : 50 mg / Kg / day for four days ; chem* DOX *chem : 20 mg / Kg for 48 h ) .

column1: Parameters of study included analysis of serum chemistry ( ALT , BUN and CPK ) , and orderly fragmentation of genomic DNA ( both endonuclease - dependent and independent ) in addition to microscopic evaluation of damage and / or protection in corresponding PAS stained tissues .

column1: Results indicate that GSPE preexposure prior to AAP , AMI and DOX , provided near complete protection in terms of serum chemistry changes ( ALT , BUN and CPK ) , and significantly reduced DNA fragmentation .

column1: GSPE + drug exposed tissues exhibited minor residual damage or near total recovery .

column1: Additionally , histopathological alterations mirrored both serum chemistry changes and the pattern of DNA fragmentation .
column2: Additionally , histopathological alterations mirrored both serum chemistry changes and the pattern of DNA fragmentation .

column1: Interestingly , all the drugs , such as , AAP , AMI and DOX induced apoptotic death in addition to necrosis in the respective organs which was very effectively blocked by GSPE .

column1: Since AAP , AMI and DOX undergo biotransformation and are known to produce damaging radicals in vivo , the protection by GSPE may be linked to both inhibition of metabolism and / or detoxification of cytotoxic radicals .

column1: BACKGROUND : Concerns about possible risks of switching to mania associated with antidepressants continue to interfere with the establishment of an optimal treatment paradigm for bipolar depression .
column2: BACKGROUND : Concerns about possible risks of switching to mania associated with chem* antidepressants *chem continue to interfere with the establishment of an optimal treatment paradigm for bipolar depression .

column1: METHOD : The response of 44 patients meeting DSM - IV criteria for bipolar disorder to naturalistic treatment was assessed for at least 6 weeks using the Montgomery - Asberg Depression Rating Scale and the Bech - Rafaelson Mania Rating Scale .
column2: METHOD : The response of 44 patients meeting DSM - IV criteria for bipolar disorder to naturalistic treatment was assessed for at least 6 weeks using the Montgomery - Asberg Depression Rating Scale and the Bech - Rafaelson Mania Rating Scale .

column1: Patients who experienced a manic or hypomanic switch were compared with those who did not on several variables including age , sex , diagnosis ( DSM - IV bipolar I vs . bipolar II ) , number of previous manic episodes , type of antidepressant therapy used ( electroconvulsive therapy vs . antidepressant drugs and , more particularly , selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors [ SSRIs ] ) , use and type of mood stabilizers ( lithium vs . anticonvulsants ) , and temperament of the patient , assessed during a normothymic period using the hyperthymia component of the Semi - structured Affective Temperament Interview .
column2: Patients who experienced a manic or hypomanic switch were compared with those who did not on several variables including age , sex , diagnosis ( DSM - IV bipolar I vs . bipolar II ) , number of previous manic episodes , type of chem* antidepressant *chem therapy used ( electroconvulsive therapy vs . chem* antidepressant *chem drugs and , more particularly , selective chem* serotonin reuptake inhibitors *chem [ chem* SSRIs *chem ] ) , use and type of mood stabilizers ( chem* lithium *chem vs . anticonvulsants ) , and temperament of the patient , assessed during a normothymic period using the hyperthymia component of the Semi - structured Affective Temperament Interview .

column1: RESULTS : Switches to hypomania or mania occurred in 27 % of all patients ( N = 12 ) ( and in 24 % of the subgroup of patients treated with SSRIs [ 8 / 33 ] ) ; 16 % ( N = 7 ) experienced manic episodes , and 11 % ( N = 5 ) experienced hypomanic episodes .
column2: RESULTS : Switches to hypomania or mania occurred in 27 % of all patients ( N = 12 ) ( and in 24 % of the subgroup of patients treated with chem* SSRIs *chem [ 8 / 33 ] ) ; 16 % ( N = 7 ) experienced manic episodes , and 11 % ( N = 5 ) experienced hypomanic episodes .

column1: Sex , age , diagnosis ( bipolar I vs . bipolar II ) , and additional treatment did not affect the risk of switching .
column2: Sex , age , diagnosis ( bipolar I vs . bipolar II ) , and additional treatment did not affect the risk of switching .

column1: The incidence of mood switches seemed not to differ between patients receiving an anticonvulsant and those receiving no mood stabilizer .
column2: The incidence of mood switches seemed not to differ between patients receiving an anticonvulsant and those receiving no mood stabilizer .

column1: In contrast , mood switches were less frequent in patients receiving lithium ( 15 % , 4 / 26 ) than in patients not treated with lithium ( 44 % , 8 / 18 ; p = . 04 ) .
column2: In contrast , mood switches were less frequent in patients receiving chem* lithium *chem ( 15 % , 4 / 26 ) than in patients not treated with chem* lithium *chem ( 44 % , 8 / 18 ; p = . 04 ) .

column1: The number of previous manic episodes did not affect the probability of switching , whereas a high score on the hyperthymia component of the Semistructured Affective Temperament Interview was associated with a greater risk of switching ( p = . 008 ) .
column2: The number of previous manic episodes did not affect the probability of switching , whereas a high score on the hyperthymia component of the Semistructured Affective Temperament Interview was associated with a greater risk of switching ( p = . 008 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : The frequency of mood switching associated with acute antidepressant therapy may be reduced by lithium treatment .
column2: CONCLUSION : The frequency of mood switching associated with acute chem* antidepressant *chem therapy may be reduced by chem* lithium *chem treatment .

column1: Particular attention should be paid to patients with a hyperthymic temperament , who have a greater risk of mood switches .

column2: METHODS : We examined 278 consecutive renal specimens ( from 135 transplants and 143 native kidneys ) for ultrastructural evidence of PTCR .

column2: RESULTS : We found PTCR in 14 of 15 cases of TG , in 7 transplant biopsy specimens without TG , and in 13 of 143 native kidney biopsy specimens .

column1: Torsades de pointes ( TDP ) is a potentially fatal ventricular tachycardia associated with increases in QT interval and monophasic action potential duration ( MAPD ) .
column2: Torsades de pointes ( TDP ) is a potentially fatal ventricular tachycardia associated with increases in QT interval and monophasic action potential duration ( MAPD ) .

column1: TDP is a side - effect that has led to withdrawal of several drugs from the market ( e . g . terfenadine and terodiline ) .
column2: TDP is a side - effect that has led to withdrawal of several drugs from the market ( e . g . chem* terfenadine *chem and chem* terodiline *chem ) .

column1: The potential of compounds to cause TDP was evaluated by monitoring their effects on MAPD in dog .
column2: The potential of compounds to cause TDP was evaluated by monitoring their effects on MAPD in dog .

column1: Four compounds known to increase QT interval and cause TDP were investigated : terfenadine , terodiline , cisapride and E4031 .
column2: Four compounds known to increase QT interval and cause TDP were investigated : chem* terfenadine *chem , chem* terodiline *chem , chem* cisapride *chem and chem* E4031 *chem .

column1: On the basis that only free drug in the systemic circulation will elicit a pharmacological response target , free concentrations in plasma were selected to mimic the free drug exposures in man .
column2: On the basis that only free drug in the systemic circulation will elicit a pharmacological response target , free concentrations in plasma were selected to mimic the free drug exposures in man .

column1: Infusion regimens were designed that rapidly achieved and maintained target - free concentrations of these drugs in plasma and data on the relationship between free concentration and changes in MAPD were obtained for these compounds .
column2: Infusion regimens were designed that rapidly achieved and maintained target - free concentrations of these drugs in plasma and data on the relationship between free concentration and changes in MAPD were obtained for these compounds .

column1: These data indicate that the free ED50 in plasma for terfenadine ( 1 . 9 nM ) , terodiline ( 76 nM ) , cisapride ( 11 nM ) and E4031 ( 1 . 9 nM ) closely correlate with the free concentration in man causing QT effects .
column2: These data indicate that the free ED50 in plasma for chem* terfenadine *chem ( 1 . 9 nM ) , chem* terodiline *chem ( 76 nM ) , chem* cisapride *chem ( 11 nM ) and chem* E4031 *chem ( 1 . 9 nM ) closely correlate with the free concentration in man causing QT effects .

column1: For compounds that have shown TDP in the clinic ( terfenadine , terodiline , cisapride ) there is little differentiation between the dog ED50 and the efficacious free plasma concentrations in man ( < 10 - fold ) reflecting their limited safety margins .
column2: For compounds that have shown TDP in the clinic ( chem* terfenadine *chem , chem* terodiline *chem , chem* cisapride *chem ) there is little differentiation between the dog ED50 and the efficacious free plasma concentrations in man ( < 10 - fold ) reflecting their limited safety margins .

column1: These data underline the need to maximize the therapeutic ratio with respect to TDP in potential development candidates and the importance of using free drug concentrations in pharmacokinetic / pharmacodynamic studies .
column2: These data underline the need to maximize the therapeutic ratio with respect to TDP in potential development candidates and the importance of using free drug concentrations in pharmacokinetic / pharmacodynamic studies .

column1: Intravenous administration of prochlorperazine by 15 - minute infusion versus 2 - minute bolus does not affect the incidence of akathisia : a prospective , randomized , controlled trial .

column1: STUDY OBJECTIVE : We sought to compare the rate of akathisia after administration of intravenous prochlorperazine as a 2 - minute bolus or 15 - minute infusion .
column2: STUDY OBJECTIVE : We sought to compare the rate of akathisia after administration of intravenous chem* prochlorperazine *chem as a 2 - minute bolus or 15 - minute infusion .

column1: Patients aged 18 years or older treated with prochlorperazine for headache , nausea , or vomiting were eligible for inclusion .

column1: Study participants were randomized to receive 10 mg of prochlorperazine administered intravenously by means of 2 - minute push ( bolus group ) or 10 mg diluted in 50 mL of normal saline solution administered by means of intravenous infusion during a 15 - minute period ( infusion group ) .
column2: Study participants were randomized to receive 10 mg of chem* prochlorperazine *chem administered intravenously by means of 2 - minute push ( bolus group ) or 10 mg diluted in 50 mL of normal saline solution administered by means of intravenous infusion during a 15 - minute period ( infusion group ) .

column1: The main outcome was the number of study participants experiencing akathisia within 60 minutes of administration .
column2: The main outcome was the number of study participants experiencing akathisia within 60 minutes of administration .

column1: Akathisia was defined as either a spontaneous report of restlessness or agitation or a change of 2 or more in the patient - reported akathisia rating scale and a change of at least 1 in the investigator - observed akathisia rating scale .
column2: Akathisia was defined as either a spontaneous report of restlessness or agitation or a change of 2 or more in the patient - reported akathisia rating scale and a change of at least 1 in the investigator - observed akathisia rating scale .

column1: The intensity of headache and nausea was measured with a 100 - mm visual analog scale .
column2: The intensity of headache and nausea was measured with a 100 - mm visual analog scale .

column2: RESULTS : One hundred patients were enrolled .

column1: Seventy - three percent ( 73 / 99 ) of the study participants were treated for headache and 70 % ( 70 / 99 ) for nausea .
column2: Seventy - three percent ( 73 / 99 ) of the study participants were treated for headache and 70 % ( 70 / 99 ) for nausea .

column1: In the bolus group , 26 . 0 % ( 13 / 50 ) had akathisia compared with 32 . 7 % ( 16 / 49 ) in the infusion group ( Delta = - 6 . 7 % ; 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] - 24 . 6 % to 11 . 2 % ) .

column1: Epileptic seizures following cortical application of fibrin sealants containing tranexamic acid in rats .
column2: Epileptic seizures following cortical application of fibrin sealants containing chem* tranexamic acid *chem in rats .

column1: BACKGROUND : Fibrin sealants ( FS ) derived from human plasma are frequently used in neurosurgery .
column2: BACKGROUND : Fibrin sealants ( FS ) derived from human plasma are frequently used in neurosurgery .

column1: In order to increase clot stability , FS typically contain aprotinin , a natural fibrinolysis inhibitor .
column2: In order to increase clot stability , FS typically contain aprotinin , a natural fibrinolysis inhibitor .

column1: Recently , synthetic fibrinolysis inhibitors such as tranexamic acid ( tAMCA ) have been considered as substitutes for aprotinin .
column2: Recently , synthetic fibrinolysis inhibitors such as chem* tranexamic acid *chem ( chem* tAMCA *chem ) have been considered as substitutes for aprotinin .

column1: However , tAMCA has been shown to cause epileptic seizures .
column2: However , chem* tAMCA *chem has been shown to cause epileptic seizures .

column1: We wanted to study whether tAMCA retains its convulsive action if incorporated into a FS .
column2: We wanted to study whether chem* tAMCA *chem retains its convulsive action if incorporated into a FS .

column1: METHOD : FS containing aprotinin or different concentrations of tAMCA ( 0 . 5 - 47 . 5 mg / ml ) were applied to the pial surface of the cortex of anaesthetized rats .
column2: METHOD : FS containing aprotinin or different concentrations of chem* tAMCA *chem ( 0 . 5 - 47 . 5 mg / ml ) were applied to the pial surface of the cortex of anaesthetized rats .

column1: The response of the animals was evaluated using electroencephalography and by monitoring the clinical behaviour during and after recovery from anaesthesia .
column2: The response of the animals was evaluated using electroencephalography and by monitoring the clinical behaviour during and after recovery from anaesthesia .

column1: FINDINGS : FS containing tAMCA caused paroxysmal brain activity which was associated with distinct convulsive behaviours .
column2: FINDINGS : FS containing chem* tAMCA *chem caused paroxysmal brain activity which was associated with distinct convulsive behaviours .

column1: The degree of these seizures increased with increasing concentration of tAMCA .
column2: The degree of these seizures increased with increasing concentration of chem* tAMCA *chem .

column1: Thus , FS containing 47 . 5 mg / ml tAMCA evoked generalized seizures in all tested rats ( n = 6 ) while the lowest concentration of tAMCA ( 0 . 5 mg / ml ) only evoked brief episodes of jerk - correlated convulsive potentials in 1 of 6 rats .
column2: Thus , FS containing 47 . 5 mg / ml chem* tAMCA *chem evoked generalized seizures in all tested rats ( n = 6 ) while the lowest concentration of chem* tAMCA *chem ( 0 . 5 mg / ml ) only evoked brief episodes of jerk - correlated convulsive potentials in 1 of 6 rats .

column1: In contrast , FS containing aprotinin did not evoke any paroxysmal activity .
column2: In contrast , FS containing aprotinin did not evoke any paroxysmal activity .

column1: INTERPRETATION : Tranexamic acid retains its convulsive action within FS .
column2: INTERPRETATION : chem* Tranexamic acid *chem retains its convulsive action within FS .

column1: Thus , use of FS containing tAMCA for surgery within or close to the CNS may pose a substantial risk to the patient .
column2: Thus , use of FS containing chem* tAMCA *chem for surgery within or close to the CNS may pose a substantial risk to the patient .

column1: Capsaicin - induced muscle pain alters the excitability of the human jaw - stretch reflex .

column1: The pathophysiology of painful temporomandibular disorders is not fully understood , but evidence suggests that muscle pain modulates motor function in characteristic ways .
column2: The pathophysiology of painful temporomandibular disorders is not fully understood , but evidence suggests that muscle pain modulates motor function in characteristic ways .

column1: This study tested the hypothesis that activation of nociceptive muscle afferent fibers would be linked to an increased excitability of the human jaw - stretch reflex and whether this process would be sensitive to length and velocity of the stretch .
column2: This study tested the hypothesis that activation of nociceptive muscle afferent fibers would be linked to an increased excitability of the human jaw - stretch reflex and whether this process would be sensitive to length and velocity of the stretch .

column2: chem* Capsaicin *chem ( 10 micro g ) was injected into the masseter muscle to induce pain in 11 healthy volunteers .

column2: Short - latency reflex responses were evoked in the masseter and temporalis muscles by a stretch device with different velocities and displacements before , during , and after the pain .

column1: The normalized reflex amplitude increased with an increase in velocity at a given displacement , but remained constant with different displacements at a given velocity .

column1: Effects of 5 - HT1B receptor ligands microinjected into the accumbal shell or core on the cocaine - induced locomotor hyperactivity in rats .
column2: Effects of 5 - HT1B receptor ligands microinjected into the accumbal shell or core on the chem* cocaine *chem - induced locomotor hyperactivity in rats .

column1: The present study was designed to examine the effect of 5 - HT1B receptor ligands microinjected into the subregions of the nucleus accumbens ( the shell and the core ) on the locomotor hyperactivity induced by cocaine in rats .
column2: The present study was designed to examine the effect of 5 - HT1B receptor ligands microinjected into the subregions of the nucleus accumbens ( the shell and the core ) on the locomotor hyperactivity induced by chem* cocaine *chem in rats .

column1: Male Wistar rats were implanted bilaterally with cannulae into the accumbens shell or core , and then were locally injected with GR 55562 ( an antagonist of 5 - HT1B receptors ) or CP 93129 ( an agonist of 5 - HT1B receptors ) .
column2: Male Wistar rats were implanted bilaterally with cannulae into the accumbens shell or core , and then were locally injected with chem* GR 55562 *chem ( an antagonist of 5 - HT1B receptors ) or chem* CP 93129 *chem ( an agonist of 5 - HT1B receptors ) .

column1: Given alone to any accumbal subregion , GR 55562 ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) or CP 93129 ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) did not change basal locomotor activity .
column2: Given alone to any accumbal subregion , chem* GR 55562 *chem ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) or chem* CP 93129 *chem ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) did not change basal locomotor activity .

column1: Systemic cocaine ( 10 mg / kg ) significantly increased the locomotor activity of rats .
column2: Systemic chem* cocaine *chem ( 10 mg / kg ) significantly increased the locomotor activity of rats .

column1: GR 55562 ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) , administered intra - accumbens shell prior to cocaine , dose - dependently attenuated the psychostimulant - induced locomotor hyperactivity .
column2: chem* GR 55562 *chem ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) , administered intra - accumbens shell prior to chem* cocaine *chem , dose - dependently attenuated the psychostimulant - induced locomotor hyperactivity .

column1: Such attenuation was not found in animals which had been injected with GR 55562 into the accumbens core .
column2: Such attenuation was not found in animals which had been injected with chem* GR 55562 *chem into the accumbens core .

column1: When injected into the accumbens shell ( but not the core ) before cocaine , CP 93129 ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) enhanced the locomotor response to cocaine ; the maximum effect being observed after 10 microg / side of the agonist .
column2: When injected into the accumbens shell ( but not the core ) before chem* cocaine *chem , chem* CP 93129 *chem ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) enhanced the locomotor response to chem* cocaine *chem ; the maximum effect being observed after 10 microg / side of the agonist .

column1: The later enhancement was attenuated after intra - accumbens shell treatment with GR 55562 ( 1 microg / side ) .
column2: The later enhancement was attenuated after intra - accumbens shell treatment with chem* GR 55562 *chem ( 1 microg / side ) .

column1: Our findings indicate that cocaine induced hyperlocomotion is modified by 5 - HT1B receptor ligands microinjected into the accumbens shell , but not core , this modification consisting in inhibitory and facilitatory effects of the 5 - HT1B receptor antagonist ( GR 55562 ) and agonist ( CP 93129 ) , respectively .
column2: Our findings indicate that chem* cocaine *chem induced hyperlocomotion is modified by 5 - HT1B receptor ligands microinjected into the accumbens shell , but not core , this modification consisting in inhibitory and facilitatory effects of the 5 - HT1B receptor antagonist ( chem* GR 55562 *chem ) and agonist ( chem* CP 93129 *chem ) , respectively .

column1: In other words , the present results suggest that the accumbal shell 5 - HT1B receptors play a permissive role in the behavioural response to the psychostimulant .
column2: In other words , the present results suggest that the accumbal shell 5 - HT1B receptors play a permissive role in the behavioural response to the psychostimulant .

column1: Crossover comparison of efficacy and preference for rizatriptan 10 mg versus ergotamine / caffeine in migraine .
column2: Crossover comparison of efficacy and preference for chem* rizatriptan *chem 10 mg versus chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem in migraine .

column1: Rizatriptan is a selective 5 - HT ( 1B / 1D ) receptor agonist with rapid oral absorption and early onset of action in the acute treatment of migraine .
column2: chem* Rizatriptan *chem is a selective chem* 5 - HT *chem ( 1B / 1D ) receptor agonist with rapid oral absorption and early onset of action in the acute treatment of migraine .

column1: This randomized double - blind crossover outpatient study assessed the preference for 1 rizatriptan 10 mg tablet to 2 ergotamine 1 mg / caffeine 100 mg tablets in 439 patients treating a single migraine attack with each therapy .
column2: This randomized double - blind crossover outpatient study assessed the preference for 1 chem* rizatriptan *chem 10 mg tablet to 2 chem* ergotamine *chem 1 mg / chem* caffeine *chem 100 mg tablets in 439 patients treating a single migraine attack with each therapy .

column1: Of patients expressing a preference ( 89 . 1 % ) , more than twice as many preferred rizatriptan to ergotamine / caffeine ( 69 . 9 vs . 30 . 1 % , p < or = 0 . 001 ) .
column2: Of patients expressing a preference ( 89 . 1 % ) , more than twice as many preferred chem* rizatriptan *chem to chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem ( 69 . 9 vs . 30 . 1 % , p < or = 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Faster relief of headache was the most important reason for preference , cited by 67 . 3 % of patients preferring rizatriptan and 54 . 2 % of patients who preferred ergotamine / caffeine .
column2: Faster relief of headache was the most important reason for preference , cited by 67 . 3 % of patients preferring chem* rizatriptan *chem and 54 . 2 % of patients who preferred chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem .

column1: The co - primary endpoint of being pain free at 2 h was also in favor of rizatriptan .
column2: The co - primary endpoint of being pain free at 2 h was also in favor of chem* rizatriptan *chem .

column1: Forty - nine percent of patients were pain free 2 h after rizatriptan , compared with 24 . 3 % treated with ergotamine / caffeine ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) , rizatriptan being superior within 1 h of treatment .
column2: Forty - nine percent of patients were pain free 2 h after chem* rizatriptan *chem , compared with 24 . 3 % treated with chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) , chem* rizatriptan *chem being superior within 1 h of treatment .

column1: Headache relief at 2 h was 75 . 9 % for rizatriptan and 47 . 3 % for ergotamine / caffeine ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) , with rizatriptan being superior to ergotamine / caffeine within 30 min of dosing .
column2: Headache relief at 2 h was 75 . 9 % for chem* rizatriptan *chem and 47 . 3 % for chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) , with chem* rizatriptan *chem being superior to chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem within 30 min of dosing .

column1: Almost 36 % of patients taking rizatriptan were pain free at 2 h and had no recurrence or need for additional medication within 24 h , compared to 20 % of patients on ergotamine / caffeine ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) .
column2: Almost 36 % of patients taking chem* rizatriptan *chem were pain free at 2 h and had no recurrence or need for additional medication within 24 h , compared to 20 % of patients on chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Rizatriptan was also superior to ergotamine / caffeine in the proportions of patients with no nausea , vomiting , phonophobia or photophobia and for patients with normal function 2 h after drug intake ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) .
column2: chem* Rizatriptan *chem was also superior to chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem in the proportions of patients with no nausea , vomiting , phonophobia or photophobia and for patients with normal function 2 h after drug intake ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) .

column1: More patients were ( completely , very or somewhat ) satisfied 2 h after treatment with rizatriptan ( 69 . 8 % ) than at 2 h after treatment with ergotamine / caffeine ( 38 . 6 % , p < or = 0 . 001 ) .
column2: More patients were ( completely , very or somewhat ) satisfied 2 h after treatment with chem* rizatriptan *chem ( 69 . 8 % ) than at 2 h after treatment with chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem ( 38 . 6 % , p < or = 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Recurrence rates were 31 . 4 % with rizatriptan and 15 . 3 % with ergotamine / caffeine .
column2: Recurrence rates were 31 . 4 % with chem* rizatriptan *chem and 15 . 3 % with chem* ergotamine *chem / chem* caffeine *chem .

column1: Both active treatments were well tolerated .
column2: Both active treatments were well tolerated .

column1: The most common adverse events ( incidence > or = 5 % in one group ) after rizatriptan and ergotamine / caffeine , respectively , were dizziness ( 6 . 7 and 5 . 3 % ) , nausea ( 4 . 2 and 8 . 5 % ) and somnolence ( 5 . 5 and 2 . 3 % ) .

column1: Severe ocular and orbital toxicity after intracarotid injection of carboplatin for recurrent glioblastomas .
column2: Severe ocular and orbital toxicity after intracarotid injection of chem* carboplatin *chem for recurrent glioblastomas .

column1: BACKGROUND : Glioblastoma is a malignant tumor that occurs in the cerebrum during adulthood .
column2: BACKGROUND : Glioblastoma is a malignant tumor that occurs in the cerebrum during adulthood .

column1: With current treatment regimens including combined surgery , radiation and chemotherapy , the average life expectancy of the patients is limited to approximately 1 year .
column2: With current treatment regimens including combined surgery , radiation and chemotherapy , the average life expectancy of the patients is limited to approximately 1 year .

column1: Therefore , patients with glioblastoma sometimes have intracarotid injection of carcinostatics added to the treatment regimen .
column2: Therefore , patients with glioblastoma sometimes have intracarotid injection of carcinostatics added to the treatment regimen .

column1: Generally , carboplatin is said to have milder side effects than cisplatin , whose ocular and orbital toxicity are well known .
column2: Generally , chem* carboplatin *chem is said to have milder side effects than chem* cisplatin *chem , whose ocular and orbital toxicity are well known .

column1: However , we experienced a case of severe ocular and orbital toxicity after intracarotid injection of carboplatin , which is infrequently reported .
column2: However , we experienced a case of severe ocular and orbital toxicity after intracarotid injection of chem* carboplatin *chem , which is infrequently reported .

column1: CASE : A 58 - year - old man received an intracarotid injection of carboplatin for recurrent glioblastomas in his left temporal lobe .
column2: CASE : A 58 - year - old man received an intracarotid injection of chem* carboplatin *chem for recurrent glioblastomas in his left temporal lobe .

column1: He complained of pain and visual disturbance in the ipsilateral eye 30 h after the injection .
column2: He complained of pain and visual disturbance in the ipsilateral eye 30 h after the injection .

column1: Various ocular symptoms and findings caused by carboplatin toxicity were seen .
column2: Various ocular symptoms and findings caused by chem* carboplatin *chem toxicity were seen .

column1: RESULTS : He was treated with intravenous administration of corticosteroids and glycerin for 6 days after the injection .
column2: RESULTS : He was treated with intravenous administration of corticosteroids and chem* glycerin *chem for 6 days after the injection .

column1: Although the intraocular pressure elevation caused by secondary acute angle - closure glaucoma decreased and ocular pain diminished , inexorable papilledema and exudative retinal detachment continued for 3 weeks .
column2: Although the intraocular pressure elevation caused by secondary acute angle - closure glaucoma decreased and ocular pain diminished , inexorable papilledema and exudative retinal detachment continued for 3 weeks .

column1: Finally , 6 weeks later , diffuse chorioretinal atrophy with optic atrophy occurred and the vision in his left eye was lost .
column2: Finally , 6 weeks later , diffuse chorioretinal atrophy with optic atrophy occurred and the vision in his left eye was lost .

column1: CONCLUSION : When performing intracarotid injection of carboplatin , we must be aware of its potentially blinding ocular toxicity .
column2: CONCLUSION : When performing intracarotid injection of chem* carboplatin *chem , we must be aware of its potentially blinding ocular toxicity .

column1: It is recommended that further studies and investigations are undertaken in the effort to minimize such severe side effects .
column2: It is recommended that further studies and investigations are undertaken in the effort to minimize such severe side effects .

column1: Visual hallucinations associated with zonisamide .

column1: Zonisamide is a broad - spectrum antiepileptic drug used to treat various types of seizures .
column2: chem* Zonisamide *chem is a broad - spectrum antiepileptic drug used to treat various types of seizures .

column1: Although visual hallucinations have not been reported as an adverse effect of this agent , we describe three patients who experienced complex visual hallucinations and altered mental status after zonisamide treatment was begun or its dosage increased .
column2: Although visual hallucinations have not been reported as an adverse effect of this agent , we describe three patients who experienced complex visual hallucinations and altered mental status after chem* zonisamide *chem treatment was begun or its dosage increased .

column1: All three had been diagnosed earlier with epilepsy , and their electroencephalogram ( EEG ) findings were abnormal .
column2: All three had been diagnosed earlier with epilepsy , and their electroencephalogram ( EEG ) findings were abnormal .

column1: During monitoring , visual hallucinations did not correlate with EEG readings , nor did video recording capture any of the described events .
column2: During monitoring , visual hallucinations did not correlate with EEG readings , nor did video recording capture any of the described events .

column1: None of the patients had experienced visual hallucinations before this event .
column2: None of the patients had experienced visual hallucinations before this event .

column1: The only recent change in their treatment was the introduction or increased dosage of zonisamide .
column2: The only recent change in their treatment was the introduction or increased dosage of chem* zonisamide *chem .

column1: With either discontinuation or decreased dosage of the drug the symptoms disappeared and did not recur .
column2: With either discontinuation or decreased dosage of the drug the symptoms disappeared and did not recur .

column1: Further observations and reports will help clarify this adverse effect .
column2: Further observations and reports will help clarify this adverse effect .

column1: Until then , clinicians need to be aware of this possible complication associated with zonisamide .
column2: Until then , clinicians need to be aware of this possible complication associated with chem* zonisamide *chem .

column2: The authors present three patients with de novo absence epilepsy after administration of chem* carbamazepine *chem and chem* vigabatrin *chem .

column1: Despite the underlying diseases , the prognosis for drug - induced de novo absence seizure is good because it subsides rapidly after discontinuing the use of the offending drugs .
column2: Despite the underlying diseases , the prognosis for drug - induced de novo absence seizure is good because it subsides rapidly after discontinuing the use of the offending drugs .

column1: The gamma - aminobutyric acid - transmitted thalamocortical circuitry accounts for a major part of the underlying neurophysiology of the absence epilepsy .
column2: The chem* gamma - aminobutyric acid *chem - transmitted thalamocortical circuitry accounts for a major part of the underlying neurophysiology of the absence epilepsy .

column1: Because drug - induced de novo absence seizure is rare , pro - absence drugs can only be considered a promoting factor .
column2: Because drug - induced de novo absence seizure is rare , pro - absence drugs can only be considered a promoting factor .

column1: The underlying epileptogenecity of the patients or the synergistic effects of the accompanying drugs is required to trigger the de novo absence seizure .
column2: The underlying epileptogenecity of the patients or the synergistic effects of the accompanying drugs is required to trigger the de novo absence seizure .

column2: The possibility of drug - induced aggravation should be considered whenever an unexpected increase in seizure frequency and / or new seizure types appear following a change in drug treatment .

column1: Prenatal dexamethasone programs hypertension and renal injury in the rat .

column1: Dexamethasone is frequently administered to the developing fetus to accelerate pulmonary development .
column2: Dexamethasone is frequently administered to the developing fetus to accelerate pulmonary development .

column2: The purpose of the present study was to determine if prenatal chem* dexamethasone *chem programmed a progressive increase in blood pressure and renal injury in rats .

column1: Pregnant rats were given either vehicle or 2 daily intraperitoneal injections of dexamethasone ( 0 . 2 mg / kg body weight ) on gestational days 11 and 12 , 13 and 14 , 15 and 16 , 17 and 18 , or 19 and 20 .
column2: Pregnant rats were given either vehicle or 2 daily intraperitoneal injections of chem* dexamethasone *chem ( 0 . 2 mg / kg body weight ) on gestational days 11 and 12 , 13 and 14 , 15 and 16 , 17 and 18 , or 19 and 20 .

column1: Offspring of rats administered dexamethasone on days 15 and 16 gestation had a 20 % reduction in glomerular number compared with control at 6 to 9 months of age ( 22 527 + / - 509 versus 28 050 + / - 561 , P < 0 . 05 ) , which was comparable to the percent reduction in glomeruli measured at 3 weeks of age .
column2: Offspring of rats administered chem* dexamethasone *chem on days 15 and 16 gestation had a 20 % reduction in glomerular number compared with control at 6 to 9 months of age ( 22 527 + / - 509 versus 28 050 + / - 561 , P < 0 . 05 ) , which was comparable to the percent reduction in glomeruli measured at 3 weeks of age .

column2: Six - to 9 - month old rats receiving prenatal chem* dexamethasone *chem on days 17 and 18 of gestation had a 17 % reduction in glomeruli ( 23 380 + / - 587 ) compared with control rats ( P < 0 . 05 ) .

column2: Adult rats given chem* dexamethasone *chem on days 15 and 16 of gestation had more glomeruli with glomerulosclerosis than control rats .

column1: This study shows that prenatal dexamethasone in rats results in a reduction in glomerular number , glomerulosclerosis , and hypertension when administered at specific points during gestation .

column1: Hypertension was observed in animals that had a reduction in glomeruli as well as in a group that did not have a reduction in glomerular number , suggesting that a reduction in glomerular number is not the sole cause for the development of hypertension .
column2: Hypertension was observed in animals that had a reduction in glomeruli as well as in a group that did not have a reduction in glomerular number , suggesting that a reduction in glomerular number is not the sole cause for the development of hypertension .

column1: BACKGROUND : Sirolimus ( SRL ) may supplement calcineurin inhibitors in clinical organ transplantation .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Sirolimus *chem ( chem* SRL *chem ) may supplement calcineurin inhibitors in clinical organ transplantation .

column2: These are nephrotoxic , but chem* SRL *chem seems to act differently displaying only minor nephrotoxic effects , although this question is still open .

column1: The aim of this study was to examine further the renal function , including morphological analysis of the kidneys of male Sprague - Dawley rats treated with either cyclosporine A ( CsA ) , tacrolimus ( FK506 ) or SRL as monotherapies or in different combinations .
column2: The aim of this study was to examine further the renal function , including morphological analysis of the kidneys of male Sprague - Dawley rats treated with either chem* cyclosporine A *chem ( chem* CsA *chem ) , chem* tacrolimus *chem ( chem* FK506 *chem ) or chem* SRL *chem as monotherapies or in different combinations .

column1: METHODS : For a period of 2 weeks , CsA 15 mg / kg / day ( given orally ) , FK506 3 . 0 mg / kg / day ( given orally ) or SRL 0 . 4 mg / kg / day ( given intraperitoneally ) was administered once a day as these doses have earlier been found to achieve a significant immunosuppressive effect in Sprague - Dawley rats .
column2: METHODS : For a period of 2 weeks , chem* CsA *chem 15 mg / kg / day ( given orally ) , chem* FK506 *chem 3 . 0 mg / kg / day ( given orally ) or chem* SRL *chem 0 . 4 mg / kg / day ( given intraperitoneally ) was administered once a day as these doses have earlier been found to achieve a significant immunosuppressive effect in Sprague - Dawley rats .

column1: Evaluation of cardiac troponin I and T levels as markers of myocardial damage in doxorubicin - induced cardiomyopathy rats , and their relationship with echocardiographic and histological findings .

column1: BACKGROUND : Cardiac troponins I ( cTnI ) and T ( cTnT ) have been shown to be highly sensitive and specific markers of myocardial cell injury .
column2: BACKGROUND : Cardiac troponins I ( cTnI ) and T ( cTnT ) have been shown to be highly sensitive and specific markers of myocardial cell injury .

column1: We investigated the diagnostic value of cTnI and cTnT for the diagnosis of myocardial damage in a rat model of doxorubicin ( DOX ) - induced cardiomyopathy , and we examined the relationship between serial cTnI and cTnT with the development of cardiac disorders monitored by echocardiography and histological examinations in this model .
column2: We investigated the diagnostic value of cTnI and cTnT for the diagnosis of myocardial damage in a rat model of chem* doxorubicin *chem ( chem* DOX *chem ) - induced cardiomyopathy , and we examined the relationship between serial cTnI and cTnT with the development of cardiac disorders monitored by echocardiography and histological examinations in this model .

column1: METHODS : Thirty - five Wistar rats were given 1 . 5 mg / kg DOX , i . v . , weekly for up to 8 weeks for a total cumulative dose of 12 mg / kg BW .
column2: METHODS : Thirty - five Wistar rats were given 1 . 5 mg / kg chem* DOX *chem , i . v . , weekly for up to 8 weeks for a total cumulative dose of 12 mg / kg BW .

column1: Ten rats received saline as a control group .
column2: Ten rats received saline as a control group .

column1: RESULTS : Eighteen of the DOX rats died prematurely of general toxicity during the 9 - week period .
column2: RESULTS : Eighteen of the chem* DOX *chem rats died prematurely of general toxicity during the 9 - week period .

column1: End - diastolic ( ED ) and end - systolic ( ES ) LV diameters / BW significantly increased , whereas LV FS was decreased after 9 weeks in the DOX group ( p < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Histological evaluation of hearts from all rats given DOX revealed significant slight degrees of perivascular and interstitial fibrosis .

column1: In 7 of the 18 rats , degeneration and myocyte vacuolisation were found .
column2: In 7 of the 18 rats , degeneration and myocyte vacuolisation were found .

column2: Only five of the controls exhibited evidence of very slight perivascular fibrosis .

column2: A significant rise in cTnT was found in chem* DOX *chem rats after cumulative doses of 7 . 5 and 12 mg / kg in comparison with baseline ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column2: cTnT found in rats after 12 mg / kg were significantly greater than that found after 7 . 5 mg / kg chem* DOX *chem .

column2: Maximal cTnI ( pg / ml ) and cTnT levels were significantly increased in chem* DOX *chem rats compared with controls ( p = 0 . 006 , 0 . 007 ) .

column2: Analysis of data revealed a significant correlation between maximal cTnT and ED and ES LV diameters / BW ( r = 0 . 81 and 0 . 65 ; p < 0 . 0001 ) .

column2: A significant relationship was observed between maximal cTnT and the extent of myocardial morphological changes , and between LV diameters / BW and histological findings .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Among markers of ischemic injury after DOX in rats , cTnT showed the greatest ability to detect myocardial damage assessed by echocardiographic detection and histological changes .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Among markers of ischemic injury after chem* DOX *chem in rats , cTnT showed the greatest ability to detect myocardial damage assessed by echocardiographic detection and histological changes .

column1: Although there was a discrepancy between the amount of cTnI and cTnT after DOX , probably due to heterogeneity in cross - reactivities of mAbs to various cTnI and cTnT forms , it is likely that cTnT in rats after DOX indicates cell damage determined by the magnitude of injury induced and that cTnT should be a useful marker for the prediction of experimentally induced cardiotoxicity and possibly for cardioprotective experiments .
