column1: The risk of venous thromboembolism in women prescribed cyproterone acetate in combination with ethinyl estradiol : a nested cohort analysis and case - control study .
column2: The risk of venous thromboembolism in women prescribed chem* cyproterone acetate *chem in combination with chem* ethinyl estradiol *chem : a nested cohort analysis and case - control study .

column1: BACKGROUND : Cyproterone acetate combined with ethinyl estradiol ( CPA / EE ) is licensed in the UK for the treatment of women with acne and hirsutism and is also a treatment option for polycystic ovary syndrome ( PCOS ) .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Cyproterone acetate *chem combined with chem* ethinyl estradiol *chem ( chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem ) is licensed in the UK for the treatment of women with acne and hirsutism and is also a treatment option for polycystic ovary syndrome ( PCOS ) .

column1: Previous studies have demonstrated an increased risk of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) associated with CPA / EE compared with conventional combined oral contraceptives ( COCs ) .
column2: Previous studies have demonstrated an increased risk of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) associated with chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem compared with conventional combined chem* oral contraceptives *chem ( COCs ) .

column1: We believe the results of those studies may have been affected by residual confounding .
column2: We believe the results of those studies may have been affected by residual confounding .

column1: METHODS : Using the General Practice Research Database we conducted a cohort analysis and case - control study nested within a population of women aged between 15 and 39 years with acne , hirsutism or PCOS to estimate the risk of VTE associated with CPA / EE .
column2: METHODS : Using the General Practice Research Database we conducted a cohort analysis and case - control study nested within a population of women aged between 15 and 39 years with acne , hirsutism or PCOS to estimate the risk of VTE associated with chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem .

column1: RESULTS : The age - adjusted incidence rate ratio for CPA / EE versus conventional COCs was 2 . 20 [ 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 1 . 35 - 3 . 58 ] .
column2: RESULTS : The age - adjusted incidence rate ratio for chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem versus conventional COCs was 2 . 20 [ 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 1 . 35 - 3 . 58 ] .

column1: Using as the reference group women who were not using oral contraception , had no recent pregnancy or menopausal symptoms , the case - control analysis gave an adjusted odds ratio ( OR ( adj ) ) of 7 . 44 ( 95 % CI 3 . 67 - 15 . 08 ) for CPA / EE use compared with an OR ( adj ) of 2 . 58 ( 95 % CI 1 . 60 - 4 . 18 ) for use of conventional COCs .
column2: Using as the reference group women who were not using oral contraception , had no recent pregnancy or menopausal symptoms , the case - control analysis gave an adjusted odds ratio ( OR ( adj ) ) of 7 . 44 ( 95 % CI 3 . 67 - 15 . 08 ) for chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem use compared with an OR ( adj ) of 2 . 58 ( 95 % CI 1 . 60 - 4 . 18 ) for use of conventional COCs .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : We have demonstrated an increased risk of VTE associated with the use of CPA / EE in women with acne , hirsutism or PCOS although residual confounding by indication cannot be excluded .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : We have demonstrated an increased risk of VTE associated with the use of chem* CPA *chem / chem* EE *chem in women with acne , hirsutism or PCOS although residual confounding by indication cannot be excluded .

column1: The effect of treatment with gum Arabic on gentamicin nephrotoxicity in rats : a preliminary study .
column2: The effect of treatment with chem* gum Arabic *chem on chem* gentamicin *chem nephrotoxicity in rats : a preliminary study .

column1: In the present work we assessed the effect of treatment of rats with gum Arabic on acute renal failure induced by gentamicin ( GM ) nephrotoxicity .
column2: In the present work we assessed the effect of treatment of rats with chem* gum Arabic *chem on acute renal failure induced by chem* gentamicin *chem ( chem* GM *chem ) nephrotoxicity .

column1: Rats were treated with the vehicle ( 2 mL / kg of distilled water and 5 % w / v cellulose , 10 days ) , gum Arabic ( 2 mL / kg of a 10 % w / v aqueous suspension of gum Arabic powder , orally for 10 days ) , or gum Arabic concomitantly with GM ( 80mg / kg / day intramuscularly , during the last six days of the treatment period ) .
column2: Rats were treated with the vehicle ( 2 mL / kg of distilled water and 5 % w / v cellulose , 10 days ) , chem* gum Arabic *chem ( 2 mL / kg of a 10 % w / v aqueous suspension of chem* gum Arabic *chem powder , orally for 10 days ) , or chem* gum Arabic *chem concomitantly with chem* GM *chem ( 80mg / kg / day intramuscularly , during the last six days of the treatment period ) .

column1: Nephrotoxicity was assessed by measuring the concentrations of creatinine and urea in the plasma and reduced glutathione ( GSH ) in the kidney cortex , and by light microscopic examination of kidney sections .
column2: Nephrotoxicity was assessed by measuring the concentrations of chem* creatinine *chem and chem* urea *chem in the plasma and reduced chem* glutathione *chem ( chem* GSH *chem ) in the kidney cortex , and by light microscopic examination of kidney sections .

column1: The results indicated that concomitant treatment with gum Arabic and GM significantly increased creatinine and urea by about 183 and 239 % , respectively ( compared to 432 and 346 % , respectively , in rats treated with cellulose and GM ) , and decreased that of cortical GSH by 21 % ( compared to 27 % in the cellulose plus GM group ) The GM - induced proximal tubular necrosis appeared to be slightly less severe in rats given GM together with gum Arabic than in those given GM and cellulose .
column2: The results indicated that concomitant treatment with chem* gum Arabic *chem and chem* GM *chem significantly increased chem* creatinine *chem and chem* urea *chem by about 183 and 239 % , respectively ( compared to 432 and 346 % , respectively , in rats treated with cellulose and chem* GM *chem ) , and decreased that of cortical chem* GSH *chem by 21 % ( compared to 27 % in the cellulose plus chem* GM *chem group ) The chem* GM *chem - induced proximal tubular necrosis appeared to be slightly less severe in rats given chem* GM *chem together with chem* gum Arabic *chem than in those given chem* GM *chem and cellulose .

column1: It could be inferred that gum Arabic treatment has induced a modest amelioration of some of the histological and biochemical indices of GM nephrotoxicity .
column2: It could be inferred that chem* gum Arabic *chem treatment has induced a modest amelioration of some of the histological and biochemical indices of chem* GM *chem nephrotoxicity .

column1: Further work is warranted on the effect of the treatments on renal functional aspects in models of chronic renal failure , and on the mechanism ( s ) involved .
column2: Further work is warranted on the effect of the treatments on renal functional aspects in models of chronic renal failure , and on the mechanism ( s ) involved .

column1: Increased frequency of venous thromboembolism with the combination of docetaxel and thalidomide in patients with metastatic androgen - independent prostate cancer .
column2: Increased frequency of venous thromboembolism with the combination of chem* docetaxel *chem and chem* thalidomide *chem in patients with metastatic androgen - independent prostate cancer .

column1: STUDY OBJECTIVE : To evaluate the frequency of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) in patients with advanced androgen - independent prostate cancer who were treated with docetaxel alone or in combination with thalidomide .
column2: STUDY OBJECTIVE : To evaluate the frequency of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) in patients with advanced androgen - independent prostate cancer who were treated with chem* docetaxel *chem alone or in combination with chem* thalidomide *chem .

column1: DESIGN : Retrospective analysis of a randomized phase II trial .
column2: DESIGN : Retrospective analysis of a randomized phase II trial .

column1: SETTING : National Institutes of Health clinical research center .
column2: SETTING : National Institutes of Health clinical research center .

column1: PATIENTS : Seventy men , aged 50 - 80 years , with advanced androgen - independent prostate cancer .
column2: PATIENTS : Seventy men , aged 50 - 80 years , with advanced androgen - independent prostate cancer .

column1: INTERVENTION : Each patient received either intravenous docetaxel 30 mg / m2 / week for 3 consecutive weeks , followed by 1 week off , or the combination of continuous oral thalidomide 200 mg every evening plus the same docetaxel regimen .
column2: INTERVENTION : Each patient received either intravenous chem* docetaxel *chem 30 mg / m2 / week for 3 consecutive weeks , followed by 1 week off , or the combination of continuous oral chem* thalidomide *chem 200 mg every evening plus the same chem* docetaxel *chem regimen .

column1: This 4 - week cycle was repeated until there was evidence of excessive toxicity or disease progression .
column2: This 4 - week cycle was repeated until there was evidence of excessive toxicity or disease progression .

column1: MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS : None of 23 patients who received docetaxel alone developed VTE , whereas 9 of 47 patients ( 19 % ) who received docetaxel plus thalidomide developed VTE ( p = 0 . 025 ) .
column2: MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS : None of 23 patients who received chem* docetaxel *chem alone developed VTE , whereas 9 of 47 patients ( 19 % ) who received chem* docetaxel *chem plus chem* thalidomide *chem developed VTE ( p = 0 . 025 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : The addition of thalidomide to docetaxel in the treatment of prostate cancer significantly increases the frequency of VTE .
column2: CONCLUSION : The addition of chem* thalidomide *chem to chem* docetaxel *chem in the treatment of prostate cancer significantly increases the frequency of VTE .

column1: Clinicians should be aware of this potential complication when adding thalidomide to chemotherapeutic regimens .
column2: Clinicians should be aware of this potential complication when adding chem* thalidomide *chem to chemotherapeutic regimens .

column1: Ticlopidine - induced cholestatic hepatitis .
column2: chem* Ticlopidine *chem - induced cholestatic hepatitis .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To report 2 cases of ticlopidine - induced cholestatic hepatitis , investigate its mechanism , and compare the observed main characteristics with those of the published cases .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To report 2 cases of chem* ticlopidine *chem - induced cholestatic hepatitis , investigate its mechanism , and compare the observed main characteristics with those of the published cases .

column1: CASE SUMMARIES : Two patients developed prolonged cholestatic hepatitis after receiving ticlopidine following percutaneous coronary angioplasty , with complete remission during the follow - up period .
column2: CASE SUMMARIES : Two patients developed prolonged cholestatic hepatitis after receiving chem* ticlopidine *chem following percutaneous coronary angioplasty , with complete remission during the follow - up period .

column1: T - cell stimulation by therapeutic concentration of ticlopidine was demonstrated in vitro in the patients , but not in healthy controls .
column2: T - cell stimulation by therapeutic concentration of chem* ticlopidine *chem was demonstrated in vitro in the patients , but not in healthy controls .

column1: DISCUSSION : Cholestatic hepatitis is a rare complication of the antiplatelet agent ticlopidine ; several cases have been reported but few in the English literature .
column2: DISCUSSION : Cholestatic hepatitis is a rare complication of the antiplatelet agent chem* ticlopidine *chem ; several cases have been reported but few in the English literature .

column1: Our patients developed jaundice following treatment with ticlopidine and showed the clinical and laboratory characteristics of cholestatic hepatitis , which resolved after discontinuation of the drug .
column2: Our patients developed jaundice following treatment with chem* ticlopidine *chem and showed the clinical and laboratory characteristics of cholestatic hepatitis , which resolved after discontinuation of the drug .

column1: Hepatitis may develop weeks after discontinuation of the drug and may run a prolonged course , but complete remission was observed in all reported cases .
column2: Hepatitis may develop weeks after discontinuation of the drug and may run a prolonged course , but complete remission was observed in all reported cases .

column1: An objective causality assessment revealed that the adverse drug event was probably related to the use of ticlopidine .
column2: An objective causality assessment revealed that the adverse drug event was probably related to the use of chem* ticlopidine *chem .

column1: The mechanisms of this ticlopidine - induced cholestasis are unclear .
column2: The mechanisms of this chem* ticlopidine *chem - induced cholestasis are unclear .

column1: Immune mechanisms may be involved in the drug ' s hepatotoxicity , as suggested by the T - cell stimulation study reported here .
column2: Immune mechanisms may be involved in the drug ' s hepatotoxicity , as suggested by the T - cell stimulation study reported here .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Cholestatic hepatitis is a rare adverse effect of ticlopidine that may be immune mediated .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Cholestatic hepatitis is a rare adverse effect of chem* ticlopidine *chem that may be immune mediated .

column1: Patients receiving the drug should be monitored with liver function tests along with complete blood cell counts .
column2: Patients receiving the drug should be monitored with liver function tests along with complete blood cell counts .

column1: This complication will be observed even less often in the future as ticlopidine is being replaced by the newer antiplatelet agent clopidogrel .
column2: This complication will be observed even less often in the future as chem* ticlopidine *chem is being replaced by the newer antiplatelet agent chem* clopidogrel *chem .

column1: Epithelial sodium channel ( ENaC ) subunit mRNA and protein expression in rats with puromycin aminonucleoside - induced nephrotic syndrome .
column2: Epithelial chem* sodium *chem channel ( ENaC ) subunit mRNA and protein expression in rats with chem* puromycin aminonucleoside *chem - induced nephrotic syndrome .

column2: In experimental nephrotic syndrome , urinary chem* sodium *chem excretion is decreased during the early phase of the disease .

column1: The molecular mechanism ( s ) leading to salt retention has not been completely elucidated .
column2: The molecular mechanism ( s ) leading to salt retention has not been completely elucidated .

column1: The rate - limiting constituent of collecting duct sodium transport is the epithelial sodium channel ( ENaC ) .
column2: The rate - limiting constituent of collecting duct chem* sodium *chem transport is the epithelial chem* sodium *chem channel ( ENaC ) .

column1: We examined the abundance of ENaC subunit mRNAs and proteins in puromycin aminonucleoside ( PAN ) - induced nephrotic syndrome .
column2: We examined the abundance of ENaC subunit mRNAs and proteins in chem* puromycin aminonucleoside *chem ( chem* PAN *chem ) - induced nephrotic syndrome .

column1: The time courses of urinary sodium excretion , plasma aldosterone concentration and proteinuria were studied in male Sprague - Dawley rats treated with a single dose of either PAN or vehicle .
column2: The time courses of urinary chem* sodium *chem excretion , plasma chem* aldosterone *chem concentration and proteinuria were studied in male Sprague - Dawley rats treated with a single dose of either chem* PAN *chem or vehicle .

column1: The relative amounts of alphaENaC , betaENaC and gammaENaC mRNAs were determined in kidneys from these rats by real - time quantitative TaqMan PCR , and the amounts of proteins by Western blot .
column2: The relative amounts of alphaENaC , betaENaC and gammaENaC mRNAs were determined in kidneys from these rats by real - time quantitative TaqMan PCR , and the amounts of proteins by Western blot .

column1: The kinetics of urinary sodium excretion and the appearance of proteinuria were comparable with those reported previously .
column2: The kinetics of urinary chem* sodium *chem excretion and the appearance of proteinuria were comparable with those reported previously .

column1: Sodium retention occurred on days 2 , 3 and 6 after PAN injection .
column2: chem* Sodium *chem retention occurred on days 2 , 3 and 6 after chem* PAN *chem injection .

column1: A significant up - regulation of alphaENaC and betaENaC mRNA abundance on days 1 and 2 preceded sodium retention on days 2 and 3 .
column2: A significant up - regulation of alphaENaC and betaENaC mRNA abundance on days 1 and 2 preceded chem* sodium *chem retention on days 2 and 3 .

column1: Conversely , down - regulation of alphaENaC , betaENaC and gammaENaC mRNA expression on day 3 occurred in the presence of high aldosterone concentrations , and was followed by a return of sodium excretion to control values .
column2: Conversely , down - regulation of alphaENaC , betaENaC and gammaENaC mRNA expression on day 3 occurred in the presence of high chem* aldosterone *chem concentrations , and was followed by a return of chem* sodium *chem excretion to control values .

column1: The amounts of alphaENaC , betaENaC and gammaENaC proteins were not increased during PAN - induced sodium retention .
column2: The amounts of alphaENaC , betaENaC and gammaENaC proteins were not increased during chem* PAN *chem - induced chem* sodium *chem retention .

column1: In conclusion , ENaC mRNA expression , especially alphaENaC , is increased in the very early phase of the experimental model of PAN - induced nephrotic syndrome in rats , but appears to escape from the regulation by aldosterone after day 3 .
column2: In conclusion , ENaC mRNA expression , especially alphaENaC , is increased in the very early phase of the experimental model of chem* PAN *chem - induced nephrotic syndrome in rats , but appears to escape from the regulation by chem* aldosterone *chem after day 3 .

column1: Sub - chronic low dose gamma - vinyl GABA ( vigabatrin ) inhibits cocaine - induced increases in nucleus accumbens dopamine .
column2: Sub - chronic low dose chem* gamma - vinyl GABA *chem ( chem* vigabatrin *chem ) inhibits chem* cocaine *chem - induced increases in nucleus accumbens chem* dopamine *chem .

column1: RATIONALE : gamma - Vinyl GABA ( GVG ) irreversibly inhibits GABA - transaminase .
column2: RATIONALE : chem* gamma - Vinyl GABA *chem ( chem* GVG *chem ) irreversibly inhibits chem* GABA *chem - transaminase .

column1: This non - receptor mediated inhibition requires de novo synthesis for restoration of functional GABA catabolism .
column2: This non - receptor mediated inhibition requires de novo synthesis for restoration of functional chem* GABA *chem catabolism .

column1: OBJECTIVES : Given its preclinical success for treating substance abuse and the increased risk of visual field defects ( VFD ) associated with cumulative lifetime exposure , we explored the effects of sub - chronic low dose GVG on cocaine - induced increases in nucleus accumbens ( NAcc ) dopamine ( DA ) .
column2: OBJECTIVES : Given its preclinical success for treating substance abuse and the increased risk of visual field defects ( VFD ) associated with cumulative lifetime exposure , we explored the effects of sub - chronic low dose chem* GVG *chem on chem* cocaine *chem - induced increases in nucleus accumbens ( NAcc ) chem* dopamine *chem ( chem* DA *chem ) .

column1: METHODS : Using in vivo microdialysis , we compared acute exposure ( 450 mg / kg ) to an identical sub - chronic exposure ( 150 mg / kg per day for 3 days ) , followed by 1 - or 3 - day washout .
column2: METHODS : Using in vivo microdialysis , we compared acute exposure ( 450 mg / kg ) to an identical sub - chronic exposure ( 150 mg / kg per day for 3 days ) , followed by 1 - or 3 - day washout .

column1: Finally , we examined the low dose of 150 mg / kg ( 50 mg / kg per day ) using a similar washout period .
column2: Finally , we examined the low dose of 150 mg / kg ( 50 mg / kg per day ) using a similar washout period .

column1: RESULTS : Sub - chronic GVG exposure inhibited the effect of cocaine for 3 days , which exceeded in magnitude and duration the identical acute dose .
column2: RESULTS : Sub - chronic chem* GVG *chem exposure inhibited the effect of chem* cocaine *chem for 3 days , which exceeded in magnitude and duration the identical acute dose .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Sub - chronic low dose GVG potentiates and extends the inhibition of cocaine - induced increases in dopamine , effectively reducing cumulative exposures and the risk for VFDS .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Sub - chronic low dose chem* GVG *chem potentiates and extends the inhibition of chem* cocaine *chem - induced increases in chem* dopamine *chem , effectively reducing cumulative exposures and the risk for VFDS .

column2: Our objective was to investigate brain MR imaging findings and the utility of diffusion - weighted ( DW ) imaging in organ transplant patients who developed neurologic symptoms during chem* tacrolimus *chem therapy .

column2: Brain MR studies , including DW imaging , were prospectively performed in 14 organ transplant patients receiving chem* tacrolimus *chem who developed neurologic complications .

column1: In each patient who had abnormalities on the initial MR study , a follow - up MR study was performed 1 month later .
column2: In each patient who had abnormalities on the initial MR study , a follow - up MR study was performed 1 month later .

column1: Apparent diffusion coefficient ( ADC ) values on the initial MR study were correlated with reversibility of the lesions .
column2: Apparent diffusion coefficient ( ADC ) values on the initial MR study were correlated with reversibility of the lesions .

column1: Of the 14 patients , 5 ( 35 . 7 % ) had white matter abnormalities , 1 ( 7 . 1 % ) had putaminal hemorrhage , and 8 ( 57 . 1 % ) had normal findings on initial MR images .
column2: Of the 14 patients , 5 ( 35 . 7 % ) had white matter abnormalities , 1 ( 7 . 1 % ) had putaminal hemorrhage , and 8 ( 57 . 1 % ) had normal findings on initial MR images .

column1: Among the 5 patients with white matter abnormalities , 4 patients ( 80 . 0 % ) showed higher than normal ADC values on initial MR images , and all showed complete resolution on follow - up images .
column2: Among the 5 patients with white matter abnormalities , 4 patients ( 80 . 0 % ) showed higher than normal ADC values on initial MR images , and all showed complete resolution on follow - up images .

column1: The remaining 1 patient ( 20 . 0 % ) showed lower than normal ADC value and showed incomplete resolution with cortical laminar necrosis .
column2: The remaining 1 patient ( 20 . 0 % ) showed lower than normal ADC value and showed incomplete resolution with cortical laminar necrosis .

column1: Diffusion - weighted imaging may be useful in predicting the outcomes of the lesions of tacrolimus - induced neurotoxicity .
column2: Diffusion - weighted imaging may be useful in predicting the outcomes of the lesions of chem* tacrolimus *chem - induced neurotoxicity .

column1: Eight healthy men were recruited .

column1: Hydrocortisone acetate ( 50 mg ) was given orally every 6 hours for 24 hours after a 5 - day fixed - salt diet ( 150 mmol / d ) .
column2: chem* Hydrocortisone acetate *chem ( 50 mg ) was given orally every 6 hours for 24 hours after a 5 - day fixed - salt diet ( 150 mmol / d ) .

column2: Crossover studies were performed 2 weeks apart .

column2: Thirty milliliters of blood was obtained for isolation of peripheral blood mononuclear cells after each treatment period .

column1: L - arginine uptake was assessed in mononuclear cells incubated with L - arginine ( 1 to 300 micromol / L ) , incorporating 100 nmol / L [ 3H ] - l - arginine for a period of 5 minutes at 37 degrees C .

column1: Plasma cortisol concentrations were significantly raised during the active phase ( 323 + / - 43 to 1082 + / - 245 mmol / L , P < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To assess and characterise the risk of bladder cancer , and its relation to cyclophosphamide , in patients with Wegener ' s granulomatosis .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To assess and characterise the risk of bladder cancer , and its relation to chem* cyclophosphamide *chem , in patients with Wegener ' s granulomatosis .

column1: METHODS : In the population based , nationwide Swedish Inpatient Register a cohort of 1065 patients with Wegener ' s granulomatosis , 1969 - 95 , was identified .
column2: METHODS : In the population based , nationwide Swedish Inpatient Register a cohort of 1065 patients with Wegener ' s granulomatosis , 1969 - 95 , was identified .

column1: Through linkage with the Swedish Cancer Register , all subjects in this cohort diagnosed with bladder cancer were identified .
column2: Through linkage with the Swedish Cancer Register , all subjects in this cohort diagnosed with bladder cancer were identified .

column1: Nested within the cohort , a matched case - control study was performed to estimate the association between cyclophosphamide and bladder cancer using odds ratios ( ORs ) as relative risk .
column2: Nested within the cohort , a matched case - control study was performed to estimate the association between chem* cyclophosphamide *chem and bladder cancer using odds ratios ( ORs ) as relative risk .

column1: In the cohort the cumulative risk of bladder cancer after Wegener ' s granulomatosis , and the relative prevalence of a history of bladder cancer at the time of diagnosis of Wegener ' s granulomatosis , were also estimated .
column2: In the cohort the cumulative risk of bladder cancer after Wegener ' s granulomatosis , and the relative prevalence of a history of bladder cancer at the time of diagnosis of Wegener ' s granulomatosis , were also estimated .

column1: RESULTS : The median cumulative doses of cyclophosphamide among cases ( n = 11 ) and controls ( n = 25 ) were 113 g and 25 g , respectively .
column2: RESULTS : The median cumulative doses of chem* cyclophosphamide *chem among cases ( n = 11 ) and controls ( n = 25 ) were 113 g and 25 g , respectively .

column1: The risk of bladder cancer doubled for every 10 g increment in cyclophosphamide ( OR = 2 . 0 , 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 0 . 8 to 4 . 9 ) .
column2: The risk of bladder cancer doubled for every 10 g increment in chem* cyclophosphamide *chem ( OR = 2 . 0 , 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 0 . 8 to 4 . 9 ) .

column1: Treatment duration longer than 1 year was associated with an eightfold increased risk ( OR = 7 . 7 , 95 % CI 0 . 9 to 69 ) .
column2: Treatment duration longer than 1 year was associated with an eightfold increased risk ( OR = 7 . 7 , 95 % CI 0 . 9 to 69 ) .

column1: The absolute risk for bladder cancer in the cohort reached 10 % 16 years after diagnosis of Wegener ' s granulomatosis , and a history of bladder cancer was ( non - significantly ) twice as common as expected at the time of diagnosis of Wegener ' s granulomatosis .
column2: The absolute risk for bladder cancer in the cohort reached 10 % 16 years after diagnosis of Wegener ' s granulomatosis , and a history of bladder cancer was ( non - significantly ) twice as common as expected at the time of diagnosis of Wegener ' s granulomatosis .

column1: CONCLUSION : The results indicate a dose - response relationship between cyclophosphamide and the risk of bladder cancer , high cumulative risks in the entire cohort , and also the possibility of risk factors operating even before Wegener ' s granulomatosis .
column2: CONCLUSION : The results indicate a dose - response relationship between chem* cyclophosphamide *chem and the risk of bladder cancer , high cumulative risks in the entire cohort , and also the possibility of risk factors operating even before Wegener ' s granulomatosis .

column1: Raloxifene did not increase risk for cataracts ( RR 0 . 9 ; 95 % CI 0 . 8 - 1 . 1 ) , gallbladder disease ( RR 1 . 0 ; 95 % CI 0 . 7 - 1 . 3 ) , endometrial hyperplasia ( RR 1 . 3 ; 95 % CI 0 . 4 - 5 . 1 ) , or endometrial cancer ( RR 0 . 9 ; 95 % CI 0 . 3 - 2 . 7 ) .

column2: METHODS : One hundred and four ( 104 ) patients aged 6 - 35 years ( mean 17 , 2 years ) participated in the study .

column1: Subjects were receiving desferrioxamine ( DFO ) chelation treatment with a mean daily dose of 50 - 60 mg / kg , 5 - 6 days a week during the first six years of the study , which was then reduced to 40 - 50 mg / kg for the following eight years .

column2: RESULTS : Overall , 21 out of 104 patients ( 20 . 2 % ) presented with high frequency sensorineural hearing loss ( SNHL ) , either unilateral or bilateral .

column1: CONCLUSION : The findings are indicative of DFO ' s contributing role in the development of hearing impairment .
column2: CONCLUSION : The findings are indicative of chem* DFO *chem ' s contributing role in the development of hearing impairment .

column1: Causes of acute thrombotic microangiopathy in patients receiving kidney transplantation .
column2: Causes of acute thrombotic microangiopathy in patients receiving kidney transplantation .

column1: OBJECTIVES : Thrombotic microangiopathy is a well - known problem in patients following renal transplantation .
column2: OBJECTIVES : Thrombotic microangiopathy is a well - known problem in patients following renal transplantation .

column1: In postrenal transplantation , thrombotic microangiopathy is often a reflection of hemolytic uremic syndrome .
column2: In postrenal transplantation , thrombotic microangiopathy is often a reflection of hemolytic uremic syndrome .

column1: We aimed to determine the causes of thrombotic microangiopathy in a population of renal transplantation recipients and discuss the literature .
column2: We aimed to determine the causes of thrombotic microangiopathy in a population of renal transplantation recipients and discuss the literature .

column1: MATERIALS AND METHODS : We investigated the causes of thrombotic microangiopathy during a 1 - year period , from June 2003 to June 2004 , at the King Fahad National Guard Hospital in Riyadh , Saudi Arabia , by reviewing the slides of all transplant biopsies ( n = 25 ) performed during this interval .
column2: MATERIALS AND METHODS : We investigated the causes of thrombotic microangiopathy during a 1 - year period , from June 2003 to June 2004 , at the King Fahad National Guard Hospital in Riyadh , Saudi Arabia , by reviewing the slides of all transplant biopsies ( n = 25 ) performed during this interval .

column1: Pre - and posttransplant crossmatching was done when possible .
column2: Pre - and posttransplant crossmatching was done when possible .

column1: RESULTS : Five cases of thrombotic microangiopathy were found .
column2: RESULTS : Five cases of thrombotic microangiopathy were found .

column1: Three of these cases were from the 25 transplantations performed at King Fahad National Guard Hospital , while the other 2 transplantations had been performed abroad and were referred to us for follow - up .
column2: Three of these cases were from the 25 transplantations performed at King Fahad National Guard Hospital , while the other 2 transplantations had been performed abroad and were referred to us for follow - up .

column1: Three cases were related to cyclosporine , and 1 case was secondary to both cyclosporine and tacrolimus .
column2: Three cases were related to chem* cyclosporine *chem , and 1 case was secondary to both chem* cyclosporine *chem and chem* tacrolimus *chem .

column1: The fifth case had features of thrombotic microangiopathy related to an antiphospholipid syndrome in a patient with systemic lupus erythematosus .
column2: The fifth case had features of thrombotic microangiopathy related to an antiphospholipid syndrome in a patient with systemic lupus erythematosus .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : In the literature , the most - frequent cause of hemolytic uremic syndrome in patients following renal transplantation is recurrence of the hemolytic uremic syndrome .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : In the literature , the most - frequent cause of hemolytic uremic syndrome in patients following renal transplantation is recurrence of the hemolytic uremic syndrome .

column1: Other causes include drug - related ( cyclosporine , tacrolimus ) toxicity , procoagulant status , and antibody - mediated rejection .
column2: Other causes include drug - related ( chem* cyclosporine *chem , chem* tacrolimus *chem ) toxicity , procoagulant status , and antibody - mediated rejection .

column1: In conclusion , although Ro4368554 did not improve a time - related retention deficit , it reversed a cholinergic and a serotonergic memory deficit , suggesting that both mechanisms may be involved in the facilitation of object memory by Ro4368554 and , possibly , other 5 - HT ( 6 ) receptor antagonists .

column2: Abnormal processing of somatosensory inputs in the central nervous system ( central sensitization ) is the mechanism accounting for the enhanced pain sensitivity in the skin surrounding tissue injury ( secondary hyperalgesia ) .

column1: Secondary hyperalgesia shares clinical characteristics with neurogenic hyperalgesia in patients with neuropathic pain .
column2: Secondary hyperalgesia shares clinical characteristics with neurogenic hyperalgesia in patients with neuropathic pain .

column2: Abnormal brain responses to somatosensory stimuli have been found in patients with hyperalgesia as well as in normal subjects during experimental central sensitization .

column1: The aim of this study was to assess the effects of gabapentin , a drug effective in neuropathic pain patients , on brain processing of nociceptive information in normal and central sensitization states .
column2: The aim of this study was to assess the effects of chem* gabapentin *chem , a drug effective in neuropathic pain patients , on brain processing of nociceptive information in normal and central sensitization states .

column1: Using functional magnetic resonance imaging ( fMRI ) in normal volunteers , we studied the gabapentin - induced modulation of brain activity in response to nociceptive mechanical stimulation of normal skin and capsaicin - induced secondary hyperalgesia .
column2: Using functional magnetic resonance imaging ( fMRI ) in normal volunteers , we studied the chem* gabapentin *chem - induced modulation of brain activity in response to nociceptive mechanical stimulation of normal skin and chem* capsaicin *chem - induced secondary hyperalgesia .

column1: The dose of gabapentin was 1 , 800 mg per os , in a single administration .
column2: The dose of chem* gabapentin *chem was 1 , 800 mg per os , in a single administration .

column1: We found that ( i ) gabapentin reduced the activations in the bilateral operculoinsular cortex , independently of the presence of central sensitization ; ( ii ) gabapentin reduced the activation in the brainstem , only during central sensitization ; ( iii ) gabapentin suppressed stimulus - induced deactivations , only during central sensitization ; this effect was more robust than the effect on brain activation .
column2: We found that ( i ) chem* gabapentin *chem reduced the activations in the bilateral operculoinsular cortex , independently of the presence of central sensitization ; ( ii ) chem* gabapentin *chem reduced the activation in the brainstem , only during central sensitization ; ( iii ) chem* gabapentin *chem suppressed stimulus - induced deactivations , only during central sensitization ; this effect was more robust than the effect on brain activation .

column1: The observed drug - induced effects were not due to changes in the baseline fMRI signal .
column2: The observed drug - induced effects were not due to changes in the baseline fMRI signal .

column1: These findings indicate that gabapentin has a measurable antinociceptive effect and a stronger antihyperalgesic effect most evident in the brain areas undergoing deactivation , thus supporting the concept that gabapentin is more effective in modulating nociceptive transmission when central sensitization is present .
column2: These findings indicate that chem* gabapentin *chem has a measurable antinociceptive effect and a stronger antihyperalgesic effect most evident in the brain areas undergoing deactivation , thus supporting the concept that chem* gabapentin *chem is more effective in modulating nociceptive transmission when central sensitization is present .

column2: Increased production of FRs may cause mtDNA damage leading to decreased activities of oxidative phosphorylation complexes containing mtDNA - encoded subunits .

column2: METHODS : Seventeen subjects who were genotyped as CYP2D6 extensive metabolizers were enrolled in this randomized , open - label , crossover study to receive a single oral dose of chem* desipramine *chem ( 50 mg ) on two separate occasions , once alone and once after multiple doses of chem* cinacalcet *chem ( 90 mg for 7 days ) .

column1: Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder presenting before 3 years of age with deficits in communication and social skills and repetitive behaviors .
column2: Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder presenting before 3 years of age with deficits in communication and social skills and repetitive behaviors .

column1: In addition to genetic influences , recent studies suggest that prenatal drug or chemical exposures are risk factors for autism .
column2: In addition to genetic influences , recent studies suggest that prenatal drug or chemical exposures are risk factors for autism .

column1: Terbutaline , a beta2 - adrenoceptor agonist used to arrest preterm labor , has been associated with increased concordance for autism in dizygotic twins .
column2: chem* Terbutaline *chem , a beta2 - adrenoceptor agonist used to arrest preterm labor , has been associated with increased concordance for autism in dizygotic twins .

column1: We studied the effects of terbutaline on microglial activation in different brain regions and behavioral outcomes in developing rats .
column2: We studied the effects of chem* terbutaline *chem on microglial activation in different brain regions and behavioral outcomes in developing rats .

column1: Newborn rats were given terbutaline ( 10 mg / kg ) daily on postnatal days ( PN ) 2 to 5 or PN 11 to 14 and examined 24 h after the last dose and at PN 30 .
column2: Newborn rats were given chem* terbutaline *chem ( 10 mg / kg ) daily on postnatal days ( PN ) 2 to 5 or PN 11 to 14 and examined 24 h after the last dose and at PN 30 .

column1: Immunohistochemical studies showed that administration of terbutaline on PN 2 to 5 produced a robust increase in microglial activation on PN 30 in the cerebral cortex , as well as in cerebellar and cerebrocortical white matter .
column2: Immunohistochemical studies showed that administration of chem* terbutaline *chem on PN 2 to 5 produced a robust increase in microglial activation on PN 30 in the cerebral cortex , as well as in cerebellar and cerebrocortical white matter .

column1: None of these effects occurred in animals given terbutaline on PN 11 to 14 .
column2: None of these effects occurred in animals given chem* terbutaline *chem on PN 11 to 14 .

column1: In behavioral tests , animals treated with terbutaline on PN 2 to 5 showed consistent patterns of hyper - reactivity to novelty and aversive stimuli when assessed in a novel open field , as well as in the acoustic startle response test .
column2: In behavioral tests , animals treated with chem* terbutaline *chem on PN 2 to 5 showed consistent patterns of hyper - reactivity to novelty and aversive stimuli when assessed in a novel open field , as well as in the acoustic startle response test .

column1: Our findings indicate that beta2 - adrenoceptor overstimulation during an early critical period results in microglial activation associated with innate neuroinflammatory pathways and behavioral abnormalities , similar to those described in autism .
column2: Our findings indicate that beta2 - adrenoceptor overstimulation during an early critical period results in microglial activation associated with innate neuroinflammatory pathways and behavioral abnormalities , similar to those described in autism .

column1: Upregulation of brain expression of P - glycoprotein in MRP2 - deficient TR ( - ) rats resembles seizure - induced up - regulation of this drug efflux transporter in normal rats .

column1: PURPOSE : The multidrug resistance protein 2 ( MRP2 ) is a drug efflux transporter that is expressed predominantly at the apical domain of hepatocytes but seems also to be expressed at the apical membrane of brain capillary endothelial cells that form the blood - brain barrier ( BBB ) .
column2: PURPOSE : The multidrug resistance protein 2 ( MRP2 ) is a drug efflux transporter that is expressed predominantly at the apical domain of hepatocytes but seems also to be expressed at the apical membrane of brain capillary endothelial cells that form the blood - brain barrier ( BBB ) .

column1: MRP2 is absent in the transport - deficient ( TR ( - ) ) Wistar rat mutant , so that this rat strain was very helpful in defining substrates of MRP2 by comparing tissue concentrations or functional activities of compounds in MRP2 - deficient rats with those in transport - competent Wistar rats .
column2: MRP2 is absent in the transport - deficient ( TR ( - ) ) Wistar rat mutant , so that this rat strain was very helpful in defining substrates of MRP2 by comparing tissue concentrations or functional activities of compounds in MRP2 - deficient rats with those in transport - competent Wistar rats .

column1: By using this strategy to study the involvement of MRP2 in brain access of antiepileptic drugs ( AEDs ) , we recently reported that phenytoin is a substrate for MRP2 in the BBB .
column2: By using this strategy to study the involvement of MRP2 in brain access of antiepileptic drugs ( AEDs ) , we recently reported that chem* phenytoin *chem is a substrate for MRP2 in the BBB .

column1: However , one drawback of such studies in genetically deficient rats is the fact that compensatory changes with upregulation of other transporters can occur .
column2: However , one drawback of such studies in genetically deficient rats is the fact that compensatory changes with upregulation of other transporters can occur .

column1: This prompted us to study the brain expression of P - glycoprotein ( Pgp ) , a major drug efflux transporter in many tissues , including the BBB , in TR ( - ) rats compared with nonmutant ( wild - type ) Wistar rats .
column2: This prompted us to study the brain expression of P - glycoprotein ( Pgp ) , a major drug efflux transporter in many tissues , including the BBB , in TR ( - ) rats compared with nonmutant ( wild - type ) Wistar rats .

column1: METHODS : The expression of MRP2 and Pgp in brain and liver sections of TR ( - ) rats and normal Wistar rats was determined with immunohistochemistry , by using a novel , highly selective monoclonal MRP2 antibody and the monoclonal Pgp antibody C219 , respectively .
column2: METHODS : The expression of MRP2 and Pgp in brain and liver sections of TR ( - ) rats and normal Wistar rats was determined with immunohistochemistry , by using a novel , highly selective monoclonal MRP2 antibody and the monoclonal Pgp antibody C219 , respectively .

column1: RESULTS : Immunofluorescence staining with the MRP2 antibody was found to label a high number of microvessels throughout the brain in normal Wistar rats , whereas such labeling was absent in TR ( - ) rats .
column2: RESULTS : Immunofluorescence staining with the MRP2 antibody was found to label a high number of microvessels throughout the brain in normal Wistar rats , whereas such labeling was absent in TR ( - ) rats .

column1: TR ( - ) rats exhibited a significant up - regulation of Pgp in brain capillary endothelial cells compared with wild - type controls .
column2: TR ( - ) rats exhibited a significant up - regulation of Pgp in brain capillary endothelial cells compared with wild - type controls .

column1: No such obvious upregulation of Pgp was observed in liver sections .
column2: No such obvious upregulation of Pgp was observed in liver sections .

column1: A comparable overexpression of Pgp in the BBB was obtained after pilocarpine - induced seizures in wild - type Wistar rats .
column2: A comparable overexpression of Pgp in the BBB was obtained after chem* pilocarpine *chem - induced seizures in wild - type Wistar rats .

column1: Experiments with systemic administration of the Pgp substrate phenobarbital and the selective Pgp inhibitor tariquidar in TR ( - ) rats substantiated that Pgp is functional and compensates for the lack of MRP2 in the BBB .
column2: Experiments with systemic administration of the Pgp substrate chem* phenobarbital *chem and the selective Pgp inhibitor chem* tariquidar *chem in TR ( - ) rats substantiated that Pgp is functional and compensates for the lack of MRP2 in the BBB .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : The data on TR ( - ) rats indicate that Pgp plays an important role in the compensation of MRP2 deficiency in the BBB .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : The data on TR ( - ) rats indicate that Pgp plays an important role in the compensation of MRP2 deficiency in the BBB .

column1: Because such a compensatory mechanism most likely occurs to reduce injury to the brain from cytotoxic compounds , the present data substantiate the concept that MRP2 performs a protective role in the BBB .
column2: Because such a compensatory mechanism most likely occurs to reduce injury to the brain from cytotoxic compounds , the present data substantiate the concept that MRP2 performs a protective role in the BBB .

column1: Furthermore , our data suggest that TR ( - ) rats are an interesting tool to study consequences of overexpression of Pgp in the BBB on access of drugs in the brain , without the need of inducing seizures or other Pgp - enhancing events for this purpose .
column2: Furthermore , our data suggest that TR ( - ) rats are an interesting tool to study consequences of overexpression of Pgp in the BBB on access of drugs in the brain , without the need of inducing seizures or other Pgp - enhancing events for this purpose .

column1: Assessment of a new non - invasive index of cardiac performance for detection of dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia .

column1: BACKGROUND : Electrocardiography has a very low sensitivity in detecting dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia .
column2: BACKGROUND : Electrocardiography has a very low sensitivity in detecting chem* dobutamine *chem - induced myocardial ischemia .

column1: OBJECTIVES : To assess the added diagnostic value of a new cardiac performance index ( dP / dtejc ) measurement , based on brachial artery flow changes , as compared to standard 12 - lead ECG , for detecting dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia , using Tc99m - Sestamibi single - photon emission computed tomography as the gold standard of comparison to assess the presence or absence of ischemia .
column2: OBJECTIVES : To assess the added diagnostic value of a new cardiac performance index ( dP / dtejc ) measurement , based on brachial artery flow changes , as compared to standard 12 - lead ECG , for detecting chem* dobutamine *chem - induced myocardial ischemia , using chem* Tc99m - Sestamibi *chem single - photon emission computed tomography as the gold standard of comparison to assess the presence or absence of ischemia .

column2: METHODS : The study group comprised 40 patients undergoing chem* Sestamibi *chem - SPECT / chem* dobutamine *chem stress test .

column1: In 19 of the 40 patients perfusion defects compatible with ischemia were detected on SPECT .
column2: In 19 of the 40 patients perfusion defects compatible with ischemia were detected on SPECT .

column1: The increase in dP / dtejc during infusion of dobutamine in this group was severely impaired as compared to the non - ischemic group .
column2: The increase in dP / dtejc during infusion of chem* dobutamine *chem in this group was severely impaired as compared to the non - ischemic group .

column2: dP / dtejc outcome was combined with the ECG results , giving an ECG - enhanced value , and compared to ECG alone .

column1: RESULTS : The sensitivity improved dramatically from 16 % to 79 % , positive predictive value increased from 60 % to 68 % and negative predictive value from 54 % to 78 % , and specificity decreased from 90 % to 67 % .
column2: RESULTS : The sensitivity improved dramatically from 16 % to 79 % , positive predictive value increased from 60 % to 68 % and negative predictive value from 54 % to 78 % , and specificity decreased from 90 % to 67 % .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : If ECG alone is used for specificity , the combination with dP / dtejc improved the sensitivity of the test and could be a cost - savings alternative to cardiac imaging or perfusion studies to detect myocardial ischemia , especially in patients unable to exercise .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : If ECG alone is used for specificity , the combination with dP / dtejc improved the sensitivity of the test and could be a cost - savings alternative to cardiac imaging or perfusion studies to detect myocardial ischemia , especially in patients unable to exercise .

column1: Cocaine - induced myocardial infarction : clinical observations and pathogenetic considerations .

column1: Clinical and experimental data published to date suggest several possible mechanisms by which cocaine may result in acute myocardial infarction .
column2: Clinical and experimental data published to date suggest several possible mechanisms by which chem* cocaine *chem may result in acute myocardial infarction .

column1: In individuals with preexisting , high - grade coronary arterial narrowing , acute myocardial infarction may result from an increase in myocardial oxygen demand associated with cocaine - induced increase in rate - pressure product .
column2: In individuals with preexisting , high - grade coronary arterial narrowing , acute myocardial infarction may result from an increase in myocardial chem* oxygen *chem demand associated with chem* cocaine *chem - induced increase in rate - pressure product .

column1: In other individuals with no underlying atherosclerotic obstruction , coronary occlusion may be due to spasm , thrombus , or both .
column2: In other individuals with no underlying atherosclerotic obstruction , coronary occlusion may be due to spasm , thrombus , or both .

column1: With regard to spasm , the clinical findings are largely circumstantial , and the locus of cocaine - induced vasoconstriction remains speculative .
column2: With regard to spasm , the clinical findings are largely circumstantial , and the locus of chem* cocaine *chem - induced vasoconstriction remains speculative .

column1: Although certain clinical and experimental findings support the hypothesis that spasm involves the epicardial , medium - size vessels , other data suggest intramural vasoconstriction .
column2: Although certain clinical and experimental findings support the hypothesis that spasm involves the epicardial , medium - size vessels , other data suggest intramural vasoconstriction .

column1: Diffuse intramural vasoconstriction is not consistent with reports of segmental , discrete infarction .
column2: Diffuse intramural vasoconstriction is not consistent with reports of segmental , discrete infarction .

column1: Whereas certain in vivo data suggest that these effects are alpha - mediated , other in vitro data suggest the opposite .

column1: Finally , the contribution of a primary , thrombotic effect of cocaine has not been excluded .
column2: Finally , the contribution of a primary , thrombotic effect of chem* cocaine *chem has not been excluded .

column1: Norepinephrine signaling through beta - adrenergic receptors is critical for expression of cocaine - induced anxiety .

column1: BACKGROUND : Cocaine is a widely abused psychostimulant that has both rewarding and aversive properties .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Cocaine *chem is a widely abused psychostimulant that has both rewarding and aversive properties .

column1: While the mechanisms underlying cocaine ' s rewarding effects have been studied extensively , less attention has been paid to the unpleasant behavioral states induced by cocaine , such as anxiety .
column2: While the mechanisms underlying chem* cocaine *chem ' s rewarding effects have been studied extensively , less attention has been paid to the unpleasant behavioral states induced by chem* cocaine *chem , such as anxiety .

column1: METHODS : In this study , we evaluated the performance of dopamine beta - hydroxylase knockout ( Dbh - / - ) mice , which lack norepinephrine ( NE ) , in the elevated plus maze ( EPM ) to examine the contribution of noradrenergic signaling to cocaine - induced anxiety .
column2: METHODS : In this study , we evaluated the performance of chem* dopamine *chem beta - hydroxylase knockout ( Dbh - / - ) mice , which lack chem* norepinephrine *chem ( chem* NE *chem ) , in the elevated plus maze ( EPM ) to examine the contribution of noradrenergic signaling to chem* cocaine *chem - induced anxiety .

column1: RESULTS : We found that cocaine dose - dependently increased anxiety - like behavior in control ( Dbh + / - ) mice , as measured by a decrease in open arm exploration .
column2: RESULTS : We found that chem* cocaine *chem dose - dependently increased anxiety - like behavior in control ( Dbh + / - ) mice , as measured by a decrease in open arm exploration .

column1: The Dbh - / - mice had normal baseline performance in the EPM but were completely resistant to the anxiogenic effects of cocaine .
column2: The Dbh - / - mice had normal baseline performance in the EPM but were completely resistant to the anxiogenic effects of chem* cocaine *chem .

column1: Cocaine - induced anxiety was also attenuated in Dbh + / - mice following administration of disulfiram , a dopamine beta - hydroxylase ( DBH ) inhibitor .
column2: chem* Cocaine *chem - induced anxiety was also attenuated in Dbh + / - mice following administration of chem* disulfiram *chem , a chem* dopamine *chem beta - hydroxylase ( DBH ) inhibitor .

column1: In experiments using specific adrenergic antagonists , we found that pretreatment with the beta - adrenergic receptor antagonist propranolol blocked cocaine - induced anxiety - like behavior in Dbh + / - and wild - type C57BL6 / J mice , while the alpha ( 1 ) antagonist prazosin and the alpha ( 2 ) antagonist yohimbine had no effect .
column2: In experiments using specific adrenergic antagonists , we found that pretreatment with the beta - adrenergic receptor antagonist chem* propranolol *chem blocked chem* cocaine *chem - induced anxiety - like behavior in Dbh + / - and wild - type C57BL6 / J mice , while the alpha ( 1 ) antagonist chem* prazosin *chem and the alpha ( 2 ) antagonist chem* yohimbine *chem had no effect .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : These results indicate that noradrenergic signaling via beta - adrenergic receptors is required for cocaine - induced anxiety in mice .

column1: Omitting fentanyl reduces nausea and vomiting , without increasing pain , after sevoflurane for day surgery .

column1: BACKGROUND AND OBJECTIVE : Despite advantages of induction and maintenance of anaesthesia with sevoflurane , postoperative nausea and vomiting occurs frequently .
column2: BACKGROUND AND OBJECTIVE : Despite advantages of induction and maintenance of anaesthesia with chem* sevoflurane *chem , postoperative nausea and vomiting occurs frequently .

column2: chem* Fentanyl *chem is a commonly used supplement that may contribute to this , although it may also improve analgesia .

column1: METHODS : This double - blind study examined the incidence and severity of postoperative nausea and vomiting and pain in the first 24 h after sevoflurane anaesthesia in 216 adult day surgery patients .
column2: METHODS : This double - blind study examined the incidence and severity of postoperative nausea and vomiting and pain in the first 24 h after chem* sevoflurane *chem anaesthesia in 216 adult day surgery patients .

column1: Patients were randomly allocated to either receive or not receive 1 1 fentanyl , while a third group received dexamethasone in addition to fentanyl .

column1: RESULTS : Omission of fentanyl did not reduce the overall incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting , but did reduce the incidence of vomiting and / or moderate to severe nausea prior to discharge from 20 % and 17 % with fentanyl and fentanyl - dexamethasone , respectively , to 5 % ( P = 0 . 013 ) .
column2: RESULTS : Omission of chem* fentanyl *chem did not reduce the overall incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting , but did reduce the incidence of vomiting and / or moderate to severe nausea prior to discharge from 20 % and 17 % with chem* fentanyl *chem and chem* fentanyl *chem - chem* dexamethasone *chem , respectively , to 5 % ( P = 0 . 013 ) .

column1: Antiemetic requirements were reduced from 24 % and 31 % to 7 % ( P = 0 . 0012 ) .
column2: Antiemetic requirements were reduced from 24 % and 31 % to 7 % ( P = 0 . 0012 ) .

column1: Dexamethasone had no significant effect on the incidence or severity of postoperative nausea and vomiting .

column1: Combining the two fentanyl groups revealed further significant benefits from the avoidance of opioids , reducing postoperative nausea and vomiting and nausea prior to discharge from 35 % and 33 % to 22 % and 19 % ( P = 0 . 049 and P = 0 . 035 ) , respectively , while nausea in the first 24 h was decreased from 42 % to 27 % ( P = 0 . 034 ) .
column2: Combining the two chem* fentanyl *chem groups revealed further significant benefits from the avoidance of opioids , reducing postoperative nausea and vomiting and nausea prior to discharge from 35 % and 33 % to 22 % and 19 % ( P = 0 . 049 and P = 0 . 035 ) , respectively , while nausea in the first 24 h was decreased from 42 % to 27 % ( P = 0 . 034 ) .

column1: Pain severity and analgesic requirements were unaffected by the omission of fentanyl .

column1: Fentanyl did reduce minor intraoperative movement but had no sevoflurane - sparing effect and increased respiratory depression , hypotension and bradycardia .

column1: CONCLUSION : As fentanyl exacerbated postoperative nausea and vomiting without an improvement in postoperative pain and also had adverse cardiorespiratory effects , it appears to be an unnecessary and possibly detrimental supplement to sevoflurane in day surgery .
column2: CONCLUSION : As chem* fentanyl *chem exacerbated postoperative nausea and vomiting without an improvement in postoperative pain and also had adverse cardiorespiratory effects , it appears to be an unnecessary and possibly detrimental supplement to chem* sevoflurane *chem in day surgery .

column1: Alpha - lipoic acid prevents mitochondrial damage and neurotoxicity in experimental chemotherapy neuropathy .

column1: The study investigates if alpha - lipoic acid is neuroprotective against chemotherapy induced neurotoxicity , if mitochondrial damage plays a critical role in toxic neurodegenerative cascade , and if neuroprotective effects of alpha - lipoic acid depend on mitochondria protection .
column2: The study investigates if chem* alpha - lipoic acid *chem is neuroprotective against chemotherapy induced neurotoxicity , if mitochondrial damage plays a critical role in toxic neurodegenerative cascade , and if neuroprotective effects of chem* alpha - lipoic acid *chem depend on mitochondria protection .

column1: Our results demonstrate that both cisplatin and paclitaxel cause early mitochondrial impairment with loss of membrane potential and induction of autophagic vacuoles in neurons .

column1: Alpha - lipoic acid exerts neuroprotective effects against chemotherapy induced neurotoxicity in sensory neurons : it rescues the mitochondrial toxicity and induces the expression of frataxin , an essential mitochondrial protein with anti - oxidant and chaperone properties .

column1: INTRODUCTION : Many substances that form methemoglobin ( MHb ) effectively counter cyanide ( CN ) toxicity .
column2: INTRODUCTION : Many substances that form methemoglobin ( MHb ) effectively counter cyanide ( CN ) toxicity .

column1: Although MHb formers are generally applied as treatments for CN poisoning , it has been proposed that a stable , long - acting MHb former could serve as a CN pretreatment .
column2: Although MHb formers are generally applied as treatments for CN poisoning , it has been proposed that a stable , long - acting MHb former could serve as a CN pretreatment .

column1: Using this rationale , the 8 - aminoquinoline WR242511 , a potent long - lasting MHb former in rodents and beagle dogs , was studied in the rhesus monkey for advanced development as a potential CN pretreatment .
column2: Using this rationale , the chem* 8 - aminoquinoline chem* WR242511 *chem , a potent long - lasting MHb former in rodents and beagle dogs , was studied in the rhesus monkey for advanced development as a potential CN pretreatment .

column1: METHODS : In this study , WR242511 was administered intravenously ( IV ) in 2 female and 4 male rhesus monkeys in doses of 3 . 5 and / or 7 . 0 mg / kg ; a single male also received WR242511 orally ( PO ) at 7 . 0 mg / kg .
column2: METHODS : In this study , chem* WR242511 *chem was administered intravenously ( IV ) in 2 female and 4 male rhesus monkeys in doses of 3 . 5 and / or 7 . 0 mg / kg ; a single male also received chem* WR242511 *chem orally ( PO ) at 7 . 0 mg / kg .

column1: Health status and MHb levels were monitored following exposure .
column2: Health status and MHb levels were monitored following exposure .

column1: RESULTS : The selected doses of WR242511 , which produced significant methemoglobinemia in beagle dogs in earlier studies conducted elsewhere , produced very little MHb ( mean < 2 . 0 % ) in the rhesus monkey .
column2: RESULTS : The selected doses of chem* WR242511 *chem , which produced significant methemoglobinemia in beagle dogs in earlier studies conducted elsewhere , produced very little MHb ( mean < 2 . 0 % ) in the rhesus monkey .

column2: CONCLUSIONS : These data demonstrate direct and / or indirect drug - induced toxicity .

column1: Confusion , a rather serious adverse drug reaction with valproic acid : a review of the French Pharmacovigilance database .
column2: Confusion , a rather serious adverse drug reaction with chem* valproic acid *chem : a review of the French Pharmacovigilance database .

column1: INTRODUCTION : Confusion is an adverse drug reaction frequently observed with valproic acid .
column2: INTRODUCTION : Confusion is an adverse drug reaction frequently observed with chem* valproic acid *chem .

column1: Some case reports are published in the literature but no systematic study from a sample of patients has been published .
column2: Some case reports are published in the literature but no systematic study from a sample of patients has been published .

column1: We performed this study in order to describe the main characteristics of this adverse drug reaction .
column2: We performed this study in order to describe the main characteristics of this adverse drug reaction .

column1: METHODS : Using the French Pharmacovigilance database , we selected the cases of confusion reported since 1985 with valproic acid .
column2: METHODS : Using the French Pharmacovigilance database , we selected the cases of confusion reported since 1985 with chem* valproic acid *chem .

column1: RESULTS : 272 cases of confusion were reported with valproic acid : 153 women and 119 men .
column2: RESULTS : 272 cases of confusion were reported with chem* valproic acid *chem : 153 women and 119 men .

column1: Confusion mostly occurred during the two first weeks following valproic acid exposure ( 39 . 7 % ) .
column2: Confusion mostly occurred during the two first weeks following chem* valproic acid *chem exposure ( 39 . 7 % ) .

column1: It was " serious " for almost 2 / 3 of the patients ( 62 . 5 % ) and its outcome favourable in most of the cases ( 82 % ) .
column2: It was " serious " for almost 2 / 3 of the patients ( 62 . 5 % ) and its outcome favourable in most of the cases ( 82 % ) .

column1: The occurrence of this ADR was more frequent in patients aged between 61 and 80 years .
column2: The occurrence of this ADR was more frequent in patients aged between 61 and 80 years .

column1: CONCLUSION : This work shows that confusion with valproic acid is a serious , rather frequent but reversible adverse drug reaction .
column2: CONCLUSION : This work shows that confusion with chem* valproic acid *chem is a serious , rather frequent but reversible adverse drug reaction .

column1: It occurs especially in older patients and during the first two weeks of treatment .
column2: It occurs especially in older patients and during the first two weeks of treatment .

column1: Reversible inferior colliculus lesion in metronidazole - induced encephalopathy : magnetic resonance findings on diffusion - weighted and fluid attenuated inversion recovery imaging .
column2: Reversible inferior colliculus lesion in chem* metronidazole *chem - induced encephalopathy : magnetic resonance findings on diffusion - weighted and fluid attenuated inversion recovery imaging .

column1: OBJECTIVE : This is to present reversible inferior colliculus lesions in metronidazole - induced encephalopathy , to focus on the diffusion - weighted imaging ( DWI ) and fluid attenuated inversion recovery ( FLAIR ) imaging .
column2: OBJECTIVE : This is to present reversible inferior colliculus lesions in chem* metronidazole *chem - induced encephalopathy , to focus on the diffusion - weighted imaging ( DWI ) and fluid attenuated inversion recovery ( FLAIR ) imaging .

column1: MATERIALS AND METHODS : From November 2005 to September 2007 , 8 patients ( 5 men and 3 women ) were diagnosed as having metronidazole - induced encephalopathy ( age range ; 43 - 78 years ) .
column2: MATERIALS AND METHODS : From November 2005 to September 2007 , 8 patients ( 5 men and 3 women ) were diagnosed as having chem* metronidazole *chem - induced encephalopathy ( age range ; 43 - 78 years ) .

column1: They had been taking metronidazole ( total dosage , 45 - 120 g ; duration , 30 days to 2 months ) to treat the infection in various organs .
column2: They had been taking chem* metronidazole *chem ( total dosage , 45 - 120 g ; duration , 30 days to 2 months ) to treat the infection in various organs .

column1: Initial brain magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) were obtained after the hospitalization , including DWI ( 8 / 8 ) , apparent diffusion coefficient ( ADC ) map ( 4 / 8 ) , FLAIR ( 7 / 8 ) , and T2 - weighted image ( 8 / 8 ) .
column2: Initial brain magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) were obtained after the hospitalization , including DWI ( 8 / 8 ) , apparent diffusion coefficient ( ADC ) map ( 4 / 8 ) , FLAIR ( 7 / 8 ) , and T2 - weighted image ( 8 / 8 ) .

column1: Follow - up MRIs were performed on 5 patients from third to 14th days after discontinuation of metronidazole administration .
column2: Follow - up MRIs were performed on 5 patients from third to 14th days after discontinuation of chem* metronidazole *chem administration .

column1: Findings of initial and follow - up MRIs were retrospectively evaluated by 2 neuroradiologists by consensus , to analyze the presence of abnormal signal intensities , their locations , and signal changes on follow - up images .
column2: Findings of initial and follow - up MRIs were retrospectively evaluated by 2 neuroradiologists by consensus , to analyze the presence of abnormal signal intensities , their locations , and signal changes on follow - up images .

column1: RESULTS : Initial MRIs showed abnormal high signal intensities on DWI and FLAIR ( or T2 - weighted image ) at the dentate nucleus ( 8 / 8 ) , inferior colliculus ( 6 / 8 ) , corpus callosum ( 2 / 8 ) , pons ( 2 / 8 ) , medulla ( 1 / 8 ) , and bilateral cerebral white matter ( 1 / 8 ) .
column2: RESULTS : Initial MRIs showed abnormal high signal intensities on DWI and FLAIR ( or T2 - weighted image ) at the dentate nucleus ( 8 / 8 ) , inferior colliculus ( 6 / 8 ) , corpus callosum ( 2 / 8 ) , pons ( 2 / 8 ) , medulla ( 1 / 8 ) , and bilateral cerebral white matter ( 1 / 8 ) .

column1: High - signal intensity lesions on DWI tended to show low signal intensity on ADC map ( 3 / 4 ) , but in one patient , high signal intensity was shown at bilateral dentate nuclei on not only DWI but also ADC map .
column2: High - signal intensity lesions on DWI tended to show low signal intensity on ADC map ( 3 / 4 ) , but in one patient , high signal intensity was shown at bilateral dentate nuclei on not only DWI but also ADC map .

column1: All the lesions in dentate , inferior colliculus , pons , and medullas had been resolved completely on follow - up MRIs in 5 patients , but in 1 patient of them , corpus callosal lesion persisted .
column2: All the lesions in dentate , inferior colliculus , pons , and medullas had been resolved completely on follow - up MRIs in 5 patients , but in 1 patient of them , corpus callosal lesion persisted .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Reversible inferior colliculus lesions could be considered as the characteristic for metronidazole - induced encephalopathy , next to the dentate nucleus involvement .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Reversible inferior colliculus lesions could be considered as the characteristic for chem* metronidazole *chem - induced encephalopathy , next to the dentate nucleus involvement .

column1: Clinically significant proteinuria following the administration of sirolimus to renal transplant recipients .
column2: Clinically significant proteinuria following the administration of chem* sirolimus *chem to renal transplant recipients .

column1: BACKGROUND : Sirolimus is the latest immunosuppressive agent used to prevent rejection , and may have less nephrotoxicity than calcineurin inhibitor ( CNI ) - based regimens .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Sirolimus *chem is the latest immunosuppressive agent used to prevent rejection , and may have less nephrotoxicity than calcineurin inhibitor ( CNI ) - based regimens .

column1: To date there has been little documentation of clinically significant proteinuria linked with the use of sirolimus .
column2: To date there has been little documentation of clinically significant proteinuria linked with the use of chem* sirolimus *chem .

column1: We have encountered several patients who developed substantial proteinuria associated with sirolimus use .
column2: We have encountered several patients who developed substantial proteinuria associated with chem* sirolimus *chem use .

column1: In each patient , the close temporal association between the commencement of sirolimus therapy and proteinuria implicated sirolimus as the most likely etiology of the proteinuria .
column2: In each patient , the close temporal association between the commencement of chem* sirolimus *chem therapy and proteinuria implicated chem* sirolimus *chem as the most likely etiology of the proteinuria .

column1: METHODS : We analyzed the clinical and laboratory information available for all 119 patients transplanted at the Washington Hospital Center between 1999 - 2003 for whom sirolimus was a component of their immunosuppressant regimen .
column2: METHODS : We analyzed the clinical and laboratory information available for all 119 patients transplanted at the Washington Hospital Center between 1999 - 2003 for whom chem* sirolimus *chem was a component of their immunosuppressant regimen .

column1: In these patients , the magnitude of proteinuria was assessed on morning urine samples by turbidometric measurement or random urine protein : creatinine ratios , an estimate of grams of proteinuria / day .
column2: In these patients , the magnitude of proteinuria was assessed on morning urine samples by turbidometric measurement or random urine protein : chem* creatinine *chem ratios , an estimate of grams of proteinuria / day .

column1: Laboratory results were compared between prior , during and following sirolimus use .
column2: Laboratory results were compared between prior , during and following chem* sirolimus *chem use .

column1: RESULTS : Twenty - eight patients ( 24 % ) developed increased proteinuria from baseline during their post - transplantation course .
column2: RESULTS : Twenty - eight patients ( 24 % ) developed increased proteinuria from baseline during their post - transplantation course .

column1: In 21 patients an alternative cause of proteinuria was either obvious or insufficient data was available to be conclusive .
column2: In 21 patients an alternative cause of proteinuria was either obvious or insufficient data was available to be conclusive .

column1: In 7 of the 28 patients there was a striking temporal association between the initiation of sirolimus and the development of nephrotic - range proteinuria .
column2: In 7 of the 28 patients there was a striking temporal association between the initiation of chem* sirolimus *chem and the development of nephrotic - range proteinuria .

column1: Proteinuria correlated most strongly with sirolimus therapy when compared to other demographic and clinical variables .
column2: Proteinuria correlated most strongly with chem* sirolimus *chem therapy when compared to other demographic and clinical variables .

column1: In most patients , discontinuation of sirolimus resulted in a decrease , but not resolution , of proteinuria .
column2: In most patients , discontinuation of chem* sirolimus *chem resulted in a decrease , but not resolution , of proteinuria .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Sirolimus induces or aggravates pre - existing proteinuria in an unpredictable subset of renal allograft recipients .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* Sirolimus *chem induces or aggravates pre - existing proteinuria in an unpredictable subset of renal allograft recipients .

column1: We therefore systematically analyzed the functional impact of the most prevalent immune escape variants , the sG145R and sP120T mutants , on the viral replication efficacy and antiviral drug susceptibility of common treatment - associated mutants with resistance to lamivudine ( LAM ) and / or HBeAg negativity .
