column1: Replication - competent HBV strains with sG145R or sP120T and LAM resistance ( rtM204I or rtL180M / rtM204V ) were generated on an HBeAg - positive and an HBeAg - negative background with precore ( PC ) and basal core promoter ( BCP ) mutants .
column2: Replication - competent HBV strains with sG145R or sP120T and chem* LAM *chem resistance ( rtM204I or rtL180M / rtM204V ) were generated on an chem* HBeAg *chem - positive and an chem* HBeAg *chem - negative background with precore ( PC ) and basal core promoter ( BCP ) mutants .

column1: The sG145R mutation strongly reduced HBsAg levels and was able to fully restore the impaired replication of LAM - resistant HBV mutants to the levels of wild - type HBV , and PC or BCP mutations further enhanced viral replication .
column2: The sG145R mutation strongly reduced chem* HBsAg *chem levels and was able to fully restore the impaired replication of chem* LAM *chem - resistant HBV mutants to the levels of wild - type HBV , and PC or BCP mutations further enhanced viral replication .

column1: Although the sP120T substitution also impaired HBsAg secretion , it did not enhance the replication of LAM - resistant clones .
column2: Although the sP120T substitution also impaired chem* HBsAg *chem secretion , it did not enhance the replication of chem* LAM *chem - resistant clones .

column1: However , the concomitant occurrence of HBeAg negativity ( PC / BCP ) , sP120T , and LAM resistance resulted in the restoration of replication to levels of wild - type HBV .
column2: However , the concomitant occurrence of chem* HBeAg *chem negativity ( PC / BCP ) , sP120T , and chem* LAM *chem resistance resulted in the restoration of replication to levels of wild - type HBV .

column1: In all clones with combined immune escape and LAM resistance mutations , the nucleotide analogues adefovir and tenofovir remained effective in suppressing viral replication in vitro .
column2: In all clones with combined immune escape and chem* LAM *chem resistance mutations , the chem* nucleotide *chem analogues chem* adefovir *chem and chem* tenofovir *chem remained effective in suppressing viral replication in vitro .

column1: These findings reveal the differential impact of immune escape variants on the replication and drug susceptibility of complex HBV mutants , supporting the need of close surveillance and treatment adjustment in response to the selection of distinct mutational patterns .
column2: These findings reveal the differential impact of immune escape variants on the replication and drug susceptibility of complex HBV mutants , supporting the need of close surveillance and treatment adjustment in response to the selection of distinct mutational patterns .

column1: Hemolytic anemia associated with the use of omeprazole .
column2: Hemolytic anemia associated with the use of chem* omeprazole *chem .

column1: Omeprazole is the first drug designed to block the final step in the acid secretory process within the parietal cell .
column2: chem* Omeprazole *chem is the first drug designed to block the final step in the acid secretory process within the parietal cell .

column1: It has been shown to be extremely effective in the treatment of peptic ulcer disease , reflux esophagitis , and the Zollinger - Ellison syndrome .
column2: It has been shown to be extremely effective in the treatment of peptic ulcer disease , reflux esophagitis , and the Zollinger - Ellison syndrome .

column1: Although clinical experience with omeprazole is still limited , many controlled studies have established the short - term safety of this drug .
column2: Although clinical experience with chem* omeprazole *chem is still limited , many controlled studies have established the short - term safety of this drug .

column1: We report the first case of a serious short - term adverse reaction with the use of omeprazole : hemolytic anemia .
column2: We report the first case of a serious short - term adverse reaction with the use of chem* omeprazole *chem : hemolytic anemia .

column1: The patient developed weakness , lethargy , and shortness of breath 2 days after starting therapy with omeprazole .
column2: The patient developed weakness , lethargy , and shortness of breath 2 days after starting therapy with chem* omeprazole *chem .

column1: Two weeks after the initiation of therapy , her hematocrit had decreased from 44 . 1 % to 20 . 4 % , and she had a positive direct Coombs antiglobulin test and an elevated indirect bilirubin .
column2: Two weeks after the initiation of therapy , her hematocrit had decreased from 44 . 1 % to 20 . 4 % , and she had a positive direct Coombs antiglobulin test and an elevated indirect chem* bilirubin *chem .

column1: After she discontinued the omeprazole , her hemoglobin and hematocrit gradually returned to normal .
column2: After she discontinued the chem* omeprazole *chem , her hemoglobin and hematocrit gradually returned to normal .

column1: The mechanism by which omeprazole caused the patient ' s hemolytic anemia is uncertain , but physicians should be alerted to this possible adverse effect .
column2: The mechanism by which chem* omeprazole *chem caused the patient ' s hemolytic anemia is uncertain , but physicians should be alerted to this possible adverse effect .

column1: Phenylephrine but not ephedrine reduces frontal lobe oxygenation following anesthesia - induced hypotension .
column2: chem* Phenylephrine *chem but not chem* ephedrine *chem reduces frontal lobe oxygenation following anesthesia - induced hypotension .

column1: BACKGROUND : Vasopressor agents are used to correct anesthesia - induced hypotension .
column2: BACKGROUND : Vasopressor agents are used to correct anesthesia - induced hypotension .

column1: We describe the effect of phenylephrine and ephedrine on frontal lobe oxygenation ( S ( c ) O ( 2 ) ) following anesthesia - induced hypotension .
column2: We describe the effect of chem* phenylephrine *chem and chem* ephedrine *chem on frontal lobe oxygenation ( S ( c ) O ( 2 ) ) following anesthesia - induced hypotension .

column1: METHODS : Following induction of anesthesia by fentanyl ( 0 . 15 mg kg ( - 1 ) ) and propofol ( 2 . 0 mg kg ( - 1 ) ) , 13 patients received phenylephrine ( 0 . 1 mg iv ) and 12 patients received ephedrine ( 10 mg iv ) to restore mean arterial pressure ( MAP ) .
column2: METHODS : Following induction of anesthesia by chem* fentanyl *chem ( 0 . 15 mg kg ( - 1 ) ) and chem* propofol *chem ( 2 . 0 mg kg ( - 1 ) ) , 13 patients received chem* phenylephrine *chem ( 0 . 1 mg iv ) and 12 patients received chem* ephedrine *chem ( 10 mg iv ) to restore mean arterial pressure ( MAP ) .

column1: Heart rate ( HR ) , MAP , stroke volume ( SV ) , cardiac output ( CO ) , and frontal lobe oxygenation ( S ( c ) O ( 2 ) ) were registered .
column2: Heart rate ( HR ) , MAP , stroke volume ( SV ) , cardiac output ( CO ) , and frontal lobe oxygenation ( S ( c ) O ( 2 ) ) were registered .

column1: RESULTS : Induction of anesthesia was followed by a decrease in MAP , HR , SV , and CO concomitant with an elevation in S ( c ) O ( 2 ) .
column2: RESULTS : Induction of anesthesia was followed by a decrease in MAP , HR , SV , and CO concomitant with an elevation in S ( c ) O ( 2 ) .

column1: After administration of phenylephrine , MAP increased ( 51 + / - 12 to 81 + / - 13 mmHg ; P < 0 . 001 ; mean + / - SD ) .
column2: After administration of chem* phenylephrine *chem , MAP increased ( 51 + / - 12 to 81 + / - 13 mmHg ; P < 0 . 001 ; mean + / - SD ) .

column1: However , a 14 % ( from 70 + / - 8 % to 60 + / - 7 % ) reduction in S ( c ) O ( 2 ) ( P < 0 . 05 ) followed with no change in CO ( 3 . 7 + / - 1 . 1 to 3 . 4 + / - 0 . 9 l min ( - 1 ) ) .
column2: However , a 14 % ( from 70 + / - 8 % to 60 + / - 7 % ) reduction in S ( c ) O ( 2 ) ( P < 0 . 05 ) followed with no change in CO ( 3 . 7 + / - 1 . 1 to 3 . 4 + / - 0 . 9 l min ( - 1 ) ) .

column1: The administration of ephedrine led to a similar increase in MAP ( 53 + / - 9 to 79 + / - 8 mmHg ; P < 0 . 001 ) , restored CO ( 3 . 2 + / - 1 . 2 to 5 . 0 + / - 1 . 3 l min ( - 1 ) ) , and preserved S ( c ) O ( 2 ) .
column2: The administration of chem* ephedrine *chem led to a similar increase in MAP ( 53 + / - 9 to 79 + / - 8 mmHg ; P < 0 . 001 ) , restored CO ( 3 . 2 + / - 1 . 2 to 5 . 0 + / - 1 . 3 l min ( - 1 ) ) , and preserved S ( c ) O ( 2 ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : The utilization of phenylephrine to correct hypotension induced by anesthesia has a negative impact on S ( c ) O ( 2 ) while ephedrine maintains frontal lobe oxygenation potentially related to an increase in CO .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : The utilization of chem* phenylephrine *chem to correct hypotension induced by anesthesia has a negative impact on S ( c ) O ( 2 ) while chem* ephedrine *chem maintains frontal lobe oxygenation potentially related to an increase in CO .

column1: Prolonged elevation of plasma argatroban in a cardiac transplant patient with a suspected history of heparin - induced thrombocytopenia with thrombosis .
column2: Prolonged elevation of plasma chem* argatroban *chem in a cardiac transplant patient with a suspected history of chem* heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia with thrombosis .

column1: BACKGROUND : Direct thrombin inhibitors ( DTIs ) provide an alternative method of anticoagulation for patients with a history of heparin - induced thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) or HIT with thrombosis ( HITT ) undergoing cardiopulmonary bypass ( CPB ) .
column2: BACKGROUND : Direct thrombin inhibitors ( DTIs ) provide an alternative method of anticoagulation for patients with a history of chem* heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) or HIT with thrombosis ( HITT ) undergoing cardiopulmonary bypass ( CPB ) .

column1: In the following report , a 65 - year - old critically ill patient with a suspected history of HITT was administered argatroban for anticoagulation on bypass during heart transplantation .
column2: In the following report , a 65 - year - old critically ill patient with a suspected history of HITT was administered chem* argatroban *chem for anticoagulation on bypass during heart transplantation .

column1: The patient required massive transfusion support ( 55 units of red blood cells , 42 units of fresh - frozen plasma , 40 units of cryoprecipitate , 40 units of platelets , and three doses of recombinant Factor VIIa ) for severe intraoperative and postoperative bleeding .
column2: The patient required massive transfusion support ( 55 units of red blood cells , 42 units of fresh - frozen plasma , 40 units of cryoprecipitate , 40 units of platelets , and three doses of recombinant Factor VIIa ) for severe intraoperative and postoperative bleeding .

column1: STUDY DESIGN AND METHODS : Plasma samples from before and after CPB were analyzed postoperatively for argatroban concentration using a modified ecarin clotting time ( ECT ) assay .
column2: STUDY DESIGN AND METHODS : Plasma samples from before and after CPB were analyzed postoperatively for chem* argatroban *chem concentration using a modified ecarin clotting time ( ECT ) assay .

column1: RESULTS : Unexpectedly high concentrations of argatroban were measured in these samples ( range , 0 - 32 microg / mL ) , and a prolonged plasma argatroban half life ( t ( 1 / 2 ) ) of 514 minutes was observed ( published elimination t ( 1 / 2 ) is 39 - 51 minutes [ < or = 181 minutes with hepatic impairment ] ) .
column2: RESULTS : Unexpectedly high concentrations of chem* argatroban *chem were measured in these samples ( range , 0 - 32 microg / mL ) , and a prolonged plasma chem* argatroban *chem half life ( t ( 1 / 2 ) ) of 514 minutes was observed ( published elimination t ( 1 / 2 ) is 39 - 51 minutes [ < or = 181 minutes with hepatic impairment ] ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Correlation of plasma argatroban concentration versus the patient ' s coagulation variables and clinical course suggest that prolonged elevated levels of plasma argatroban may have contributed to the patient ' s extended coagulopathy .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Correlation of plasma chem* argatroban *chem concentration versus the patient ' s coagulation variables and clinical course suggest that prolonged elevated levels of plasma chem* argatroban *chem may have contributed to the patient ' s extended coagulopathy .

column1: Because DTIs do not have reversal agents , surgical teams and transfusion services should remain aware of the possibility of massive transfusion events during anticoagulation with these agents .
column2: Because DTIs do not have reversal agents , surgical teams and transfusion services should remain aware of the possibility of massive transfusion events during anticoagulation with these agents .

column1: This is the first report to measure plasma argatroban concentration in the context of CPB and extended coagulopathy .
column2: This is the first report to measure plasma chem* argatroban *chem concentration in the context of CPB and extended coagulopathy .

column1: The effects of the adjunctive bupropion on male sexual dysfunction induced by a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor : a double - blind placebo - controlled and randomized study .
column2: The effects of the adjunctive chem* bupropion *chem on male sexual dysfunction induced by a chem* selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor *chem : a double - blind placebo - controlled and randomized study .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To determine the safety and efficacy of adjunctive bupropion sustained - release ( SR ) on male sexual dysfunction ( SD ) induced by a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( SSRI ) , as SD is a common side - effect of SSRIs and the most effective treatments have yet to be determined .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To determine the safety and efficacy of adjunctive chem* bupropion *chem sustained - release ( SR ) on male sexual dysfunction ( SD ) induced by a chem* selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor *chem ( chem* SSRI *chem ) , as SD is a common side - effect of chem* SSRIs *chem and the most effective treatments have yet to be determined .

column1: PATIENTS AND METHODS : The randomized sample consisted of 234 euthymic men who were receiving some type of SSRI .
column2: PATIENTS AND METHODS : The randomized sample consisted of 234 euthymic men who were receiving some type of chem* SSRI *chem .

column1: The men were randomly assigned to bupropion SR ( 150 mg twice daily , 117 ) or placebo ( twice daily , 117 ) for 12 weeks .
column2: The men were randomly assigned to chem* bupropion *chem SR ( 150 mg twice daily , 117 ) or placebo ( twice daily , 117 ) for 12 weeks .

column1: Efficacy was evaluated using the Clinical Global Impression - Sexual Function ( CGI - SF ; the primary outcome measure ) , the International Index of Erectile Function ( IIEF ) , Arizona Sexual Experience Scale ( ASEX ) , and Erectile Dysfunction Inventory of Treatment Satisfaction ( EDITS ) ( secondary outcome measures ) .
column2: Efficacy was evaluated using the Clinical Global Impression - Sexual Function ( CGI - SF ; the primary outcome measure ) , the International Index of Erectile Function ( IIEF ) , Arizona Sexual Experience Scale ( ASEX ) , and Erectile Dysfunction Inventory of Treatment Satisfaction ( EDITS ) ( secondary outcome measures ) .

column1: Participants were followed biweekly during study period .
column2: Participants were followed biweekly during study period .

column1: RESULTS : After 12 weeks of treatment , the mean ( sd ) scores for CGI - SF were significantly lower , i . e . better , in patients on bupropion SR , at 2 . 4 ( 1 . 2 ) , than in the placebo group , at 3 . 9 ( 1 . 1 ) ( P = 0 . 01 ) .
column2: RESULTS : After 12 weeks of treatment , the mean ( sd ) scores for CGI - SF were significantly lower , i . e . better , in patients on chem* bupropion *chem SR , at 2 . 4 ( 1 . 2 ) , than in the placebo group , at 3 . 9 ( 1 . 1 ) ( P = 0 . 01 ) .

column1: Men who received bupropion had a significant increase in the total IIEF score ( 54 . 4 % vs 1 . 2 % ; P = 0 . 003 ) , and in the five different domains of the IIEF .
column2: Men who received chem* bupropion *chem had a significant increase in the total IIEF score ( 54 . 4 % vs 1 . 2 % ; P = 0 . 003 ) , and in the five different domains of the IIEF .

column1: Total ASEX scores were significantly lower , i . e . better , among men who received bupropion than placebo , at 15 . 5 ( 4 . 3 ) vs 21 . 5 ( 4 . 7 ) ( P = 0 . 002 ) .
column2: Total ASEX scores were significantly lower , i . e . better , among men who received chem* bupropion *chem than placebo , at 15 . 5 ( 4 . 3 ) vs 21 . 5 ( 4 . 7 ) ( P = 0 . 002 ) .

column1: The EDITS scores were 67 . 4 ( 10 . 2 ) for the bupropion and 36 . 3 ( 11 . 7 ) for the placebo group ( P = 0 . 001 ) .
column2: The EDITS scores were 67 . 4 ( 10 . 2 ) for the chem* bupropion *chem and 36 . 3 ( 11 . 7 ) for the placebo group ( P = 0 . 001 ) .

column1: The ASEX score and CGI - SF score were correlated ( P = 0 . 003 ) .
column2: The ASEX score and CGI - SF score were correlated ( P = 0 . 003 ) .

column1: In linear regression analyses the CGI - SF score was not affected significantly by the duration of SD , type of SSRI used and age .
column2: In linear regression analyses the CGI - SF score was not affected significantly by the duration of SD , type of chem* SSRI *chem used and age .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Bupropion is an effective treatment for male SD induced by SSRIs .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* Bupropion *chem is an effective treatment for male SD induced by chem* SSRIs *chem .

column1: These results provide empirical support for conducting a further study of bupropion .
column2: These results provide empirical support for conducting a further study of chem* bupropion *chem .

column1: Prevention of seizures and reorganization of hippocampal functions by transplantation of bone marrow cells in the acute phase of experimental epilepsy .
column2: Prevention of seizures and reorganization of hippocampal functions by transplantation of bone marrow cells in the acute phase of experimental epilepsy .

column1: In this study , we investigated the therapeutic potential of bone marrow mononuclear cells ( BMCs ) in a model of epilepsy induced by pilocarpine in rats .
column2: In this study , we investigated the therapeutic potential of bone marrow mononuclear cells ( BMCs ) in a model of epilepsy induced by chem* pilocarpine *chem in rats .

column1: BMCs obtained from green fluorescent protein ( GFP ) transgenic mice or rats were transplanted intravenously after induction of status epilepticus ( SE ) .
column2: BMCs obtained from green fluorescent protein ( GFP ) transgenic mice or rats were transplanted intravenously after induction of status epilepticus ( SE ) .

column1: Spontaneous recurrent seizures ( SRS ) were monitored using Racine ' s seizure severity scale .
column2: Spontaneous recurrent seizures ( SRS ) were monitored using Racine ' s seizure severity scale .

column1: All of the rats in the saline - treated epileptic control group developed SRS , whereas none of the BMC - treated epileptic animals had seizures in the short term ( 15 days after transplantation ) , regardless of the BMC source .
column2: All of the rats in the saline - treated epileptic control group developed SRS , whereas none of the BMC - treated epileptic animals had seizures in the short term ( 15 days after transplantation ) , regardless of the BMC source .

column1: Over the long - term chronic phase ( 120 days after transplantation ) , only 25 % of BMC - treated epileptic animals had seizures , but with a lower frequency and duration compared to the epileptic control group .
column2: Over the long - term chronic phase ( 120 days after transplantation ) , only 25 % of BMC - treated epileptic animals had seizures , but with a lower frequency and duration compared to the epileptic control group .

column1: The density of hippocampal neurons in the brains of animals treated with BMCs was markedly preserved .
column2: The density of hippocampal neurons in the brains of animals treated with BMCs was markedly preserved .

column1: At hippocampal Schaeffer collateral - CA1 synapses , long - term potentiation was preserved in BMC - transplanted rats compared to epileptic controls .
column2: At hippocampal Schaeffer collateral - CA1 synapses , long - term potentiation was preserved in BMC - transplanted rats compared to epileptic controls .

column1: The donor - derived GFP ( + ) cells were rarely found in the brains of transplanted epileptic rats .
column2: The donor - derived GFP ( + ) cells were rarely found in the brains of transplanted epileptic rats .

column1: In conclusion , treatment with BMCs can prevent the development of chronic seizures , reduce neuronal loss , and influence the reorganization of the hippocampal neuronal network .
column2: In conclusion , treatment with BMCs can prevent the development of chronic seizures , reduce neuronal loss , and influence the reorganization of the hippocampal neuronal network .

column1: Normalizing effects of modafinil on sleep in chronic cocaine users .
column2: Normalizing effects of chem* modafinil *chem on sleep in chronic chem* cocaine *chem users .

column1: OBJECTIVE : The purpose of the present study was to determine the effect of morning - dosed modafinil on sleep and daytime sleepiness in chronic cocaine users .
column2: OBJECTIVE : The purpose of the present study was to determine the effect of morning - dosed chem* modafinil *chem on sleep and daytime sleepiness in chronic chem* cocaine *chem users .

column1: METHOD : Twenty cocaine - dependent participants were randomly assigned to receive modafinil , 400 mg ( N = 10 ) , or placebo ( N = 10 ) every morning at 7 : 30 a . m . for 16 days in an inpatient , double - blind randomized trial .
column2: METHOD : Twenty chem* cocaine *chem - dependent participants were randomly assigned to receive chem* modafinil *chem , 400 mg ( N = 10 ) , or placebo ( N = 10 ) every morning at 7 : 30 a . m . for 16 days in an inpatient , double - blind randomized trial .

column1: Participants underwent polysomnographic sleep recordings on days 1 to 3 , 7 to 9 , and 14 to 16 ( first , second , and third weeks of abstinence ) .
column2: Participants underwent polysomnographic sleep recordings on days 1 to 3 , 7 to 9 , and 14 to 16 ( first , second , and third weeks of abstinence ) .

column1: The Multiple Sleep Latency Test was performed at 11 : 30 a . m . , 2 : 00 p . m . , and 4 : 30 p . m . on days 2 , 8 , and 15 .
column2: The Multiple Sleep Latency Test was performed at 11 : 30 a . m . , 2 : 00 p . m . , and 4 : 30 p . m . on days 2 , 8 , and 15 .

column1: For comparison of sleep architecture variables , 12 healthy comparison participants underwent a single night of experimental polysomnography that followed 1 night of accommodation polysomnography .
column2: For comparison of sleep architecture variables , 12 healthy comparison participants underwent a single night of experimental polysomnography that followed 1 night of accommodation polysomnography .

column1: RESULTS : Progressive abstinence from cocaine was associated with worsening of all measured polysomnographic sleep outcomes .
column2: RESULTS : Progressive abstinence from chem* cocaine *chem was associated with worsening of all measured polysomnographic sleep outcomes .

column1: Compared with placebo , modafinil decreased nighttime sleep latency and increased slow - wave sleep time in cocaine - dependent participants .
column2: Compared with placebo , chem* modafinil *chem decreased nighttime sleep latency and increased slow - wave sleep time in chem* cocaine *chem - dependent participants .

column1: The effect of modafinil interacted with the abstinence week and was associated with longer total sleep time and shorter REM sleep latency in the third week of abstinence .
column2: The effect of chem* modafinil *chem interacted with the abstinence week and was associated with longer total sleep time and shorter REM sleep latency in the third week of abstinence .

column1: Comparison of slow - wave sleep time , total sleep time , and sleep latency in cocaine - dependent and healthy participants revealed a normalizing effect of modafinil in cocaine - dependent participants .
column2: Comparison of slow - wave sleep time , total sleep time , and sleep latency in chem* cocaine *chem - dependent and healthy participants revealed a normalizing effect of chem* modafinil *chem in chem* cocaine *chem - dependent participants .

column1: Modafinil was associated with increased daytime sleep latency , as measured by the Multiple Sleep Latency Test , and a nearly significant decrease in subjective daytime sleepiness .
column2: chem* Modafinil *chem was associated with increased daytime sleep latency , as measured by the Multiple Sleep Latency Test , and a nearly significant decrease in subjective daytime sleepiness .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Morning - dosed modafinil promotes nocturnal sleep , normalizes sleep architecture , and decreases daytime sleepiness in abstinent cocaine users .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Morning - dosed chem* modafinil *chem promotes nocturnal sleep , normalizes sleep architecture , and decreases daytime sleepiness in abstinent chem* cocaine *chem users .

column1: These effects may be relevant in the treatment of cocaine dependence .
column2: These effects may be relevant in the treatment of chem* cocaine *chem dependence .

column1: Safety of transesophageal echocardiography in adults : study in a multidisciplinary hospital .

column2: BACKGROUND : TEE is a semi - invasive tool broadly used and its utilization associated to sedatives drugs might to affect the procedure safety .

column1: Oral manifestations of " meth mouth " : a case report .
column2: Oral manifestations of " meth mouth " : a case report .

column1: AIM : The aim of the documentation of this clinical case is to make clinicians aware of " meth mouth " and the medical risks associated with this serious condition .
column2: AIM : The aim of the documentation of this clinical case is to make clinicians aware of " meth mouth " and the medical risks associated with this serious condition .

column1: BACKGROUND : Methamphetamine is a very addictive , powerful stimulant that increases wakefulness and physical activity and can produce other effects such as cardiac dysrhythmias , hypertension , hallucinations , and violent behavior .

column1: Cocaine causes memory and learning impairments in rats : involvement of nuclear factor kappa B and oxidative stress , and prevention by topiramate .
column2: chem* Cocaine *chem causes memory and learning impairments in rats : involvement of nuclear factor kappa B and oxidative stress , and prevention by chem* topiramate *chem .

column1: Different mechanisms have been suggested for cocaine toxicity including an increase in oxidative stress but the association between oxidative status in the brain and cocaine induced - behaviour is poorly understood .
column2: Different mechanisms have been suggested for chem* cocaine *chem toxicity including an increase in oxidative stress but the association between oxidative status in the brain and chem* cocaine *chem induced - behaviour is poorly understood .

column1: Nuclear factor kappa B ( NFkappaB ) is a sensor of oxidative stress and participates in memory formation that could be involved in drug toxicity and addiction mechanisms .
column2: Nuclear factor kappa B ( NFkappaB ) is a sensor of oxidative stress and participates in memory formation that could be involved in drug toxicity and addiction mechanisms .

column1: Therefore NFkappaB activity , oxidative stress , neuronal nitric oxide synthase ( nNOS ) activity , spatial learning and memory as well as the effect of topiramate , a previously proposed therapy for cocaine addiction , were evaluated in an experimental model of cocaine administration in rats .
column2: Therefore NFkappaB activity , oxidative stress , neuronal chem* nitric oxide *chem synthase ( nNOS ) activity , spatial learning and memory as well as the effect of chem* topiramate *chem , a previously proposed therapy for cocaine addiction , were evaluated in an experimental model of chem* cocaine *chem administration in rats .

column1: NFkappaB activity was decreased in the frontal cortex of cocaine treated rats , as well as GSH concentration and glutathione peroxidase activity in the hippocampus , whereas nNOS activity in the hippocampus was increased .
column2: NFkappaB activity was decreased in the frontal cortex of chem* cocaine *chem treated rats , as well as chem* GSH *chem concentration and chem* glutathione *chem peroxidase activity in the hippocampus , whereas nNOS activity in the hippocampus was increased .

column1: Memory retrieval of experiences acquired prior to cocaine administration was impaired and negatively correlated with NFkappaB activity in the frontal cortex .
column2: Memory retrieval of experiences acquired prior to chem* cocaine *chem administration was impaired and negatively correlated with NFkappaB activity in the frontal cortex .

column1: In contrast , learning of new tasks was enhanced and correlated with the increase of nNOS activity and the decrease of glutathione peroxidase .
column2: In contrast , learning of new tasks was enhanced and correlated with the increase of nNOS activity and the decrease of chem* glutathione *chem peroxidase .

column1: These results provide evidence for a possible mechanistic role of oxidative and nitrosative stress and NFkappaB in the alterations induced by cocaine .

column1: Topiramate prevented all the alterations observed , showing novel neuroprotective properties .

column1: Gamma - hexachlorocyclohexane ( gamma - HCH ) , the active ingredient of the insecticide lindane , has been shown to decrease seizure threshold to pentylenetrazol ( PTZ ) 3 h after exposure to gamma - HCH and conversely increase threshold to PTZ - induced seizures 24 h after exposure to gamma - HCH ( Vohland et al . 1981 ) .
column2: chem* Gamma - hexachlorocyclohexane *chem ( chem* gamma - HCH *chem ) , the active ingredient of the insecticide chem* lindane *chem , has been shown to decrease seizure threshold to pentylenetrazol ( chem* PTZ *chem ) 3 h after exposure to chem* gamma - HCH *chem and conversely increase threshold to chem* PTZ *chem - induced seizures 24 h after exposure to chem* gamma - HCH *chem ( Vohland et al . 1981 ) .

column1: In this study , the severity of response to other seizure - inducing agents was tested in mice 1 and 24 h after intraperitoneal administration of 80 mg / kg gamma - HCH .
column2: In this study , the severity of response to other seizure - inducing agents was tested in mice 1 and 24 h after intraperitoneal administration of 80 mg / kg chem* gamma - HCH *chem .

column1: One hour after the administration of gamma - HCH , the activity of seizure - inducing agents was increased , regardless of their mechanism , while 24 h after gamma - HCH a differential response was observed .
column2: One hour after the administration of chem* gamma - HCH *chem , the activity of seizure - inducing agents was increased , regardless of their mechanism , while 24 h after chem* gamma - HCH *chem a differential response was observed .

column1: Seizure activity due to PTZ and picrotoxin ( PTX ) was significantly decreased ; however , seizure activity due to 3 - mercaptopropionic acid ( MPA ) , bicuculline ( BCC ) , methyl 6 , 7 - dimethoxy - 4 - ethyl - B - carboline - 3 - carboxylate ( DMCM ) , or strychnine ( STR ) was not different from control .
column2: Seizure activity due to chem* PTZ *chem and chem* picrotoxin *chem ( chem* PTX *chem ) was significantly decreased ; however , seizure activity due to chem* 3 - mercaptopropionic acid *chem ( chem* MPA *chem ) , chem* bicuculline *chem ( chem* BCC *chem ) , chem* methyl 6 , 7 - dimethoxy - 4 - ethyl - B - carboline - 3 - carboxylate *chem ( chem* DMCM *chem ) , or chem* strychnine *chem ( chem* STR *chem ) was not different from control .

column1: In vitro , gamma - HCH , pentylenetetrazol and picrotoxin were shown to inhibit 3H - TBOB binding in mouse whole brain , with IC50 values of 4 . 6 , 404 and 9 . 4 microM , respectively .
column2: In vitro , chem* gamma - HCH *chem , chem* pentylenetetrazol *chem and chem* picrotoxin *chem were shown to inhibit chem* 3H - TBOB *chem binding in mouse whole brain , with IC50 values of 4 . 6 , 404 and 9 . 4 microM , respectively .

column1: MPA , BCC , DMCM , and STR showed no inhibition of 3H - TBOB ( t - butyl bicyclo - orthobenzoate ) binding at concentrations of 100 micron .
column2: chem* MPA *chem , chem* BCC *chem , chem* DMCM *chem , and chem* STR *chem showed no inhibition of chem* 3H - TBOB *chem ( chem* t - butyl bicyclo - orthobenzoate *chem ) binding at concentrations of 100 micron .

column1: The pharmacological challenge data suggest that tolerance may occur to seizure activity induced by PTZ and PTX 24 h after gamma - HCH , since the response to only these two seizure - inducing agents is decreased .
column2: The pharmacological challenge data suggest that tolerance may occur to seizure activity induced by chem* PTZ *chem and chem* PTX *chem 24 h after chem* gamma - HCH *chem , since the response to only these two seizure - inducing agents is decreased .

column1: The in vitro data suggest that the site responsible for the decrease in seizure activity 24 h after gamma - HCH may be the GABA - A receptor - linked chloride channel .
column2: The in vitro data suggest that the site responsible for the decrease in seizure activity 24 h after chem* gamma - HCH *chem may be the chem* GABA *chem - A receptor - linked chloride channel .

column1: Tolerance and antiviral effect of ribavirin in patients with Argentine hemorrhagic fever .
column2: Tolerance and antiviral effect of chem* ribavirin *chem in patients with Argentine hemorrhagic fever .

column1: Tolerance and antiviral effect of ribavirin was studied in 6 patients with Argentine hemorrhagic fever ( AHF ) of more than 8 days of evolution .
column2: Tolerance and antiviral effect of chem* ribavirin *chem was studied in 6 patients with Argentine hemorrhagic fever ( AHF ) of more than 8 days of evolution .

column1: Administration of ribavirin resulted in a neutralization of viremia and a drop of endogenous interferon titers .
column2: Administration of chem* ribavirin *chem resulted in a neutralization of viremia and a drop of endogenous interferon titers .

column1: The average time of death was delayed .
column2: The average time of death was delayed .

column1: A reversible anemia was the only adverse effect observed .
column2: A reversible anemia was the only adverse effect observed .

column1: From these results , we conclude that ribavirin has an antiviral effect in advanced cases of AHF , and that anemia , the only secondary reaction observed , can be easily managed .
column2: From these results , we conclude that chem* ribavirin *chem has an antiviral effect in advanced cases of AHF , and that anemia , the only secondary reaction observed , can be easily managed .

column1: The possible beneficial effect of ribavirin during the initial days of AHF is discussed .
column2: The possible beneficial effect of chem* ribavirin *chem during the initial days of AHF is discussed .

column1: Is the treatment of scabies hazardous ?
column2: Is the treatment of scabies hazardous ?

column1: Treatment for scabies is usually initiated by general practitioners ; most consider lindane ( gamma benzene hexachloride ) the treatment of choice .
column2: Treatment for scabies is usually initiated by general practitioners ; most consider chem* lindane *chem ( chem* gamma benzene hexachloride *chem ) the treatment of choice .

column1: Lindane is also widely used as an agricultural and industrial pesticide , and as a result the toxic profile of this insecticide is well understood .
column2: chem* Lindane *chem is also widely used as an agricultural and industrial pesticide , and as a result the toxic profile of this insecticide is well understood .

column1: Evidence is accumulating that lindane can be toxic to the central nervous system and may be associated with aplastic anaemia .
column2: Evidence is accumulating that chem* lindane *chem can be toxic to the central nervous system and may be associated with aplastic anaemia .

column1: Preparations containing lindane continue to be sold over the counter and may represent a hazard to poorly informed patients .
column2: Preparations containing chem* lindane *chem continue to be sold over the counter and may represent a hazard to poorly informed patients .

column1: This literature review suggests that general practitioners should prescribe scabicides with increased caution for certain at - risk groups , and give adequate warnings regarding potential toxicity .
column2: This literature review suggests that general practitioners should prescribe scabicides with increased caution for certain at - risk groups , and give adequate warnings regarding potential toxicity .

column1: Mouse strain - dependent effect of amantadine on motility and brain biogenic amines .
column2: Mouse strain - dependent effect of chem* amantadine *chem on motility and brain biogenic chem* amines *chem .

column1: The effect of amantadine hydrochloride , injected i . p . in 6 increments of 100 mg / kg each over 30 hr , on mouse motility and whole brain content of selected biogenic amines and major metabolites was studied in 4 strains of mice .
column2: The effect of chem* amantadine hydrochloride *chem , injected i . p . in 6 increments of 100 mg / kg each over 30 hr , on mouse motility and whole brain content of selected biogenic chem* amines *chem and major metabolites was studied in 4 strains of mice .

column1: These were the albino Sprague - Dawley ICR and BALB / C , the black C57BL / 6 and the brown CDF - I mouse strains .
column2: These were the albino Sprague - Dawley ICR and BALB / C , the black C57BL / 6 and the brown CDF - I mouse strains .

column1: Amantadine treatment produced a biphasic effect on mouse motility .
column2: chem* Amantadine *chem treatment produced a biphasic effect on mouse motility .

column1: The initial dose of amantadine depressed locomotor activity in all mouse strains studied with the BALB / C mice being the most sensitive .
column2: The initial dose of chem* amantadine *chem depressed locomotor activity in all mouse strains studied with the BALB / C mice being the most sensitive .

column1: Subsequent amantadine treatments produced enhancement of motility from corresponding control in all mouse strains with the BALB / C mice being the least sensitive .
column2: Subsequent chem* amantadine *chem treatments produced enhancement of motility from corresponding control in all mouse strains with the BALB / C mice being the least sensitive .

column1: The locomotor activity was decreased from corresponding controls in all strains studied , except for the ICR mice , during an overnight drug - free period following the fourth amantadine treatment .
column2: The locomotor activity was decreased from corresponding controls in all strains studied , except for the ICR mice , during an overnight drug - free period following the fourth chem* amantadine *chem treatment .

column1: Readministration of amantadine , after a drug - free overnight period , increased motility from respective saline control in all strains with exception of the BALB / C mice where suppression of motility occurred .
column2: Readministration of chem* amantadine *chem , after a drug - free overnight period , increased motility from respective saline control in all strains with exception of the BALB / C mice where suppression of motility occurred .

column1: Treatment with amantadine did not alter whole brain dopamine levels but decreased the amounts of 3 , 4 - dihydroxyphenylacetic acid in the BALB / C mice compared to saline control .
column2: Treatment with chem* amantadine *chem did not alter whole brain chem* dopamine *chem levels but decreased the amounts of chem* 3 , 4 - dihydroxyphenylacetic acid *chem in the BALB / C mice compared to saline control .

column1: Conversely , brain normetanephrine concentration was increased from saline control by amantadine in the BALB / C mice .
column2: Conversely , brain chem* normetanephrine *chem concentration was increased from saline control by chem* amantadine *chem in the BALB / C mice .

column1: The results suggest a strain - dependent effect of amantadine on motility and indicate a differential response to the acute and multiple dose regimens used .
column2: The results suggest a strain - dependent effect of chem* amantadine *chem on motility and indicate a differential response to the acute and multiple dose regimens used .

column1: The BALB / C mouse was the most sensitive strain and could serve as the strain of choice for evaluating the side effects of amantadine .
column2: The BALB / C mouse was the most sensitive strain and could serve as the strain of choice for evaluating the side effects of chem* amantadine *chem .

column1: The biochemical results of brain biogenic amines of BALB / C mouse strain suggest a probable decrease of catecholamine turnover rate and / or metabolism by monoamine oxidase and a resulting increase in O - methylation of norepinephrine which may account for a behavioral depression caused by amantadine in the BALB / C mice .
column2: The biochemical results of brain biogenic chem* amines *chem of BALB / C mouse strain suggest a probable decrease of chem* catecholamine *chem turnover rate and / or metabolism by monoamine oxidase and a resulting increase in O - methylation of chem* norepinephrine *chem which may account for a behavioral depression caused by chem* amantadine *chem in the BALB / C mice .

column1: Chloroacetaldehyde and its contribution to urotoxicity during treatment with cyclophosphamide or ifosfamide .
column2: chem* Chloroacetaldehyde *chem and its contribution to urotoxicity during treatment with chem* cyclophosphamide *chem or chem* ifosfamide *chem .

column1: An experimental study / short communication .
column2: An experimental study / short communication .

column1: Based on clinical data , indicating that chloroacetaldehyde ( CAA ) is an important metabolite of oxazaphosphorine cytostatics , an experimental study was carried out in order to elucidate the role of CAA in the development of hemorrhagic cystitis .
column2: Based on clinical data , indicating that chem* chloroacetaldehyde *chem ( chem* CAA *chem ) is an important metabolite of oxazaphosphorine cytostatics , an experimental study was carried out in order to elucidate the role of chem* CAA *chem in the development of hemorrhagic cystitis .

column1: The data demonstrate that CAA after i . v . administration does not contribute to bladder damage .
column2: The data demonstrate that chem* CAA *chem after i . v . administration does not contribute to bladder damage .

column1: Source of pain and primitive dysfunction in migraine : an identical site ?
column2: Source of pain and primitive dysfunction in migraine : an identical site ?

column1: Twenty common migraine patients received a one sided frontotemporal application of nitroglycerin ( 10 patients ) or placebo ointment ( 10 patients ) in a double blind study .
column2: Twenty common migraine patients received a one sided frontotemporal application of chem* nitroglycerin *chem ( 10 patients ) or placebo ointment ( 10 patients ) in a double blind study .

column1: Early onset migraine attacks were induced by nitroglycerin in seven out of 10 patients versus no patient in the placebo group .
column2: Early onset migraine attacks were induced by chem* nitroglycerin *chem in seven out of 10 patients versus no patient in the placebo group .

column1: Subsequently 20 migraine patients , who developed an early onset attack with frontotemporal nitroglycerin , received the drug in a second induction test at other body areas .
column2: Subsequently 20 migraine patients , who developed an early onset attack with frontotemporal chem* nitroglycerin *chem , received the drug in a second induction test at other body areas .

column1: No early onset migraine was observed .
column2: No early onset migraine was observed .

column1: Thus the migraine - inducing effect of nitroglycerin seems to depend on direct stimulation of the habitual site of pain , suggesting that the frontotemporal region is of crucial importance in the development of a migraine crisis .
column2: Thus the migraine - inducing effect of chem* nitroglycerin *chem seems to depend on direct stimulation of the habitual site of pain , suggesting that the frontotemporal region is of crucial importance in the development of a migraine crisis .

column1: This is not consistent with a CNS origin of migraine attack .
column2: This is not consistent with a CNS origin of migraine attack .

column1: Hypersensitivity to carbamazepine presenting with a leukemoid reaction , eosinophilia , erythroderma , and renal failure .
column2: Hypersensitivity to chem* carbamazepine *chem presenting with a leukemoid reaction , eosinophilia , erythroderma , and renal failure .

column1: We report a patient in whom hypersensitivity to carbamazepine presented with generalized erythroderma , a severe leukemoid reaction , eosinophilia , hyponatremia , and renal failure .
column2: We report a patient in whom hypersensitivity to chem* carbamazepine *chem presented with generalized erythroderma , a severe leukemoid reaction , eosinophilia , hyponatremia , and renal failure .

column1: This is the first report of such an unusual reaction to carbamazepine .
column2: This is the first report of such an unusual reaction to chem* carbamazepine *chem .

column1: Fluoxetine - induced akathisia : clinical and theoretical implications .
column2: chem* Fluoxetine *chem - induced akathisia : clinical and theoretical implications .

column1: Five patients receiving fluoxetine for the treatment of obsessive compulsive disorder or major depression developed akathisia .
column2: Five patients receiving chem* fluoxetine *chem for the treatment of obsessive compulsive disorder or major depression developed akathisia .

column1: The typical fluoxetine - induced symptoms of restlessness , constant pacing , purposeless movements of the feet and legs , and marked anxiety were indistinguishable from those of neuroleptic - induced akathisia .
column2: The typical chem* fluoxetine *chem - induced symptoms of restlessness , constant pacing , purposeless movements of the feet and legs , and marked anxiety were indistinguishable from those of neuroleptic - induced akathisia .

column1: Three patients who had experienced neuroleptic - induced akathisia in the past reported that the symptoms of fluoxetine - induced akathisia were identical , although somewhat milder .
column2: Three patients who had experienced neuroleptic - induced akathisia in the past reported that the symptoms of chem* fluoxetine *chem - induced akathisia were identical , although somewhat milder .

column1: Akathisia appeared to be a common side effect of fluoxetine and generally responded well to treatment with the beta - adrenergic antagonist propranolol , dose reduction , or both .
column2: Akathisia appeared to be a common side effect of chem* fluoxetine *chem and generally responded well to treatment with the beta - adrenergic antagonist chem* propranolol *chem , dose reduction , or both .

column1: The authors suggest that fluoxetine - induced akathisia may be caused by serotonergically mediated inhibition of dopaminergic neurotransmission and that the pathophysiology of fluoxetine - induced akathisia and tricyclic antidepressant - induced " jitteriness " may be identical .
column2: The authors suggest that chem* fluoxetine *chem - induced akathisia may be caused by serotonergically mediated inhibition of dopaminergic neurotransmission and that the pathophysiology of chem* fluoxetine *chem - induced akathisia and tricyclic chem* antidepressant *chem - induced " jitteriness " may be identical .

column1: Effect of converting enzyme inhibition on the course of adriamycin - induced nephropathy .
column2: Effect of converting enzyme inhibition on the course of chem* adriamycin *chem - induced nephropathy .

column1: The effect of the converting enzyme inhibitor ( CEI ) enalapril was assessed in Munich - Wistar rats with established adriamycin nephrosis .
column2: The effect of the converting enzyme inhibitor ( CEI ) chem* enalapril *chem was assessed in Munich - Wistar rats with established chem* adriamycin *chem nephrosis .

column1: Rats were given a single dose of adriamycin and one month later divided into four groups matched for albuminuria , blood pressure , and plasma albumin concentration .
column2: Rats were given a single dose of chem* adriamycin *chem and one month later divided into four groups matched for albuminuria , blood pressure , and plasma albumin concentration .

column1: Groups 1 and 3 remained untreated while groups 2 and 4 received enalapril .
column2: Groups 1 and 3 remained untreated while groups 2 and 4 received chem* enalapril *chem .

column1: Groups 1 and 2 underwent micropuncture studies after 10 days .
column2: Groups 1 and 2 underwent micropuncture studies after 10 days .

column1: These short - term studies showed that enalapril reduced arterial blood pressure ( 101 + / - 2 vs . 124 + / - 3 mm Hg , group 2 vs . 1 , P less than 0 . 05 ) and glomerular capillary pressure ( 54 + / - 1 vs . 61 + / - 2 mm Hg , P less than 0 . 05 ) without reducing albuminuria ( 617 + / - 50 vs . 570 + / - 47 mg / day ) or GFR ( 1 . 03 + / - 0 . 04 vs . 1 . 04 + / - 0 . 11 ml / min ) .
column2: These short - term studies showed that chem* enalapril *chem reduced arterial blood pressure ( 101 + / - 2 vs . 124 + / - 3 mm Hg , group 2 vs . 1 , P less than 0 . 05 ) and glomerular capillary pressure ( 54 + / - 1 vs . 61 + / - 2 mm Hg , P less than 0 . 05 ) without reducing albuminuria ( 617 + / - 50 vs . 570 + / - 47 mg / day ) or GFR ( 1 . 03 + / - 0 . 04 vs . 1 . 04 + / - 0 . 11 ml / min ) .

column1: Groups 3 and 4 were studied at four and at six months to assess the effect of enalapril on progression of renal injury in adriamycin nephrosis .
column2: Groups 3 and 4 were studied at four and at six months to assess the effect of chem* enalapril *chem on progression of renal injury in chem* adriamycin *chem nephrosis .

column1: Chronic enalapril treatment reduced blood pressure without reducing albuminuria in group 4 .
column2: Chronic chem* enalapril *chem treatment reduced blood pressure without reducing albuminuria in group 4 .

column1: Untreated group 3 rats exhibited a progressive reduction in GFR ( 0 . 35 + / - 0 . 08 ml / min at 4 months , 0 . 27 + / - 0 . 07 ml / min at 6 months ) .
column2: Untreated group 3 rats exhibited a progressive reduction in GFR ( 0 . 35 + / - 0 . 08 ml / min at 4 months , 0 . 27 + / - 0 . 07 ml / min at 6 months ) .

column1: Enalapril treatment blunted but did not prevent reduction in GFR in group 4 ( 0 . 86 + / - 0 . 15 ml / min at 4 months , 0 . 69 + / - 0 . 13 ml / min at 6 months , both P less than 0 . 05 vs . group 3 ) .
column2: chem* Enalapril *chem treatment blunted but did not prevent reduction in GFR in group 4 ( 0 . 86 + / - 0 . 15 ml / min at 4 months , 0 . 69 + / - 0 . 13 ml / min at 6 months , both P less than 0 . 05 vs . group 3 ) .

column1: Reduction in GFR was associated with the development of glomerular sclerosis in both treated and untreated rats . ( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )
column2: Reduction in GFR was associated with the development of glomerular sclerosis in both treated and untreated rats . ( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )

column1: Clotiazepam - induced acute hepatitis .
column2: chem* Clotiazepam *chem - induced acute hepatitis .

column1: We report the case of a patient who developed acute hepatitis with extensive hepatocellular necrosis , 7 months after the onset of administration of clotiazepam , a thienodiazepine derivative .
column2: We report the case of a patient who developed acute hepatitis with extensive hepatocellular necrosis , 7 months after the onset of administration of chem* clotiazepam *chem , a chem* thienodiazepine *chem derivative .

column1: Clotiazepam withdrawal was followed by prompt recovery .
column2: chem* Clotiazepam *chem withdrawal was followed by prompt recovery .

column1: The administration of several benzodiazepines , chemically related to clotiazepam , did not interfere with recovery and did not induce any relapse of hepatitis .
column2: The administration of several chem* benzodiazepines *chem , chemically related to chem* clotiazepam *chem , did not interfere with recovery and did not induce any relapse of hepatitis .

column1: This observation shows that clotiazepam can induce acute hepatitis and suggests that there is no cross hepatotoxicity between clotiazepam and several benzodiazepines .
column2: This observation shows that chem* clotiazepam *chem can induce acute hepatitis and suggests that there is no cross hepatotoxicity between chem* clotiazepam *chem and several chem* benzodiazepines *chem .

column1: 5 - azacytidine potentiates initiation induced by carcinogens in rat liver .
column2: chem* 5 - azacytidine *chem potentiates initiation induced by carcinogens in rat liver .

column1: To test the validity of the hypothesis that hypomethylation of DNA plays an important role in the initiation of carcinogenic process , 5 - azacytidine ( 5 - AzC ) ( 10 mg / kg ) , an inhibitor of DNA methylation , was given to rats during the phase of repair synthesis induced by the three carcinogens , benzo [ a ] - pyrene ( 200 mg / kg ) , N - methyl - N - nitrosourea ( 60 mg / kg ) and 1 , 2 - dimethylhydrazine ( 1 , 2 - DMH ) ( 100 mg / kg ) .
column2: To test the validity of the hypothesis that hypomethylation of DNA plays an important role in the initiation of carcinogenic process , chem* 5 - azacytidine *chem ( chem* 5 - AzC *chem ) ( 10 mg / kg ) , an inhibitor of DNA methylation , was given to rats during the phase of repair synthesis induced by the three carcinogens , chem* benzo [ a ] - pyrene *chem ( 200 mg / kg ) , chem* N - methyl - N - nitrosourea *chem ( 60 mg / kg ) and chem* 1 , 2 - dimethylhydrazine *chem ( chem* 1 , 2 - DMH *chem ) ( 100 mg / kg ) .

column1: The initiated hepatocytes in the liver were assayed as the gamma - glutamyltransferase ( gamma - GT ) positive foci formed following a 2 - week selection regimen consisting of dietary 0 . 02 % 2 - acetylaminofluorene coupled with a necrogenic dose of CCl4 .
column2: The initiated hepatocytes in the liver were assayed as the gamma - glutamyltransferase ( gamma - GT ) positive foci formed following a 2 - week selection regimen consisting of dietary 0 . 02 % chem* 2 - acetylaminofluorene *chem coupled with a necrogenic dose of chem* CCl4 *chem .

column1: The results obtained indicate that with all three carcinogens , administration of 5 - AzC during repair synthesis increased the incidence of initiated hepatocytes , for example 10 - 20 foci / cm2 in 5 - AzC and carcinogen - treated rats compared with 3 - 5 foci / cm2 in rats treated with carcinogen only .
column2: The results obtained indicate that with all three carcinogens , administration of chem* 5 - AzC *chem during repair synthesis increased the incidence of initiated hepatocytes , for example 10 - 20 foci / cm2 in chem* 5 - AzC *chem and carcinogen - treated rats compared with 3 - 5 foci / cm2 in rats treated with carcinogen only .

column1: Administration of [ 3H ] - 5 - azadeoxycytidine during the repair synthesis induced by 1 , 2 - DMH further showed that 0 . 019 mol % of cytosine residues in DNA were substituted by the analogue , indicating that incorporation of 5 - AzC occurs during repair synthesis .
column2: Administration of chem* [ 3H ] - 5 - azadeoxycytidine *chem during the repair synthesis induced by chem* 1 , 2 - DMH *chem further showed that 0 . 019 mol % of chem* cytosine *chem residues in DNA were substituted by the analogue , indicating that incorporation of chem* 5 - AzC *chem occurs during repair synthesis .

column1: In the absence of the carcinogen , 5 - AzC given after a two thirds partial hepatectomy , when its incorporation should be maximum , failed to induce any gamma - GT positive foci .
column2: In the absence of the carcinogen , chem* 5 - AzC *chem given after a two thirds partial hepatectomy , when its incorporation should be maximum , failed to induce any gamma - GT positive foci .

column1: The results suggest that hypomethylation of DNA per se may not be sufficient for initiation .
column2: The results suggest that hypomethylation of DNA per se may not be sufficient for initiation .

column1: Perhaps two events might be necessary for initiation , the first caused by the carcinogen and a second involving hypomethylation of DNA .
column2: Perhaps two events might be necessary for initiation , the first caused by the carcinogen and a second involving hypomethylation of DNA .

column1: Antihypertensive drugs and depression : a reappraisal .
column2: Antihypertensive drugs and depression : a reappraisal .

column2: Eighty - nine new referral hypertensive out - patients and 46 new referral non - hypertensive chronically physically ill out - patients completed a mood rating scale at regular intervals for one year .

column1: The results showed a high prevalence of depression in both groups of patients , with no preponderance in the hypertensive group .
column2: The results showed a high prevalence of depression in both groups of patients , with no preponderance in the hypertensive group .

column1: Hypertensive patients with psychiatric histories had a higher prevalence of depression than the comparison patients .
column2: Hypertensive patients with psychiatric histories had a higher prevalence of depression than the comparison patients .

column1: This was accounted for by a significant number of depressions occurring in methyl dopa treated patients with psychiatric histories .
column2: This was accounted for by a significant number of depressions occurring in chem* methyl dopa *chem treated patients with psychiatric histories .

column2: chem* Diclofenac sodium *chem ( chem* Voltarol *chem , Geigy Pharmaceuticals ) is a non - steroidal anti - inflammatory derivative of chem* phenylacetic acid *chem .

column1: Arterial hypertension as a complication of prolonged ketoconazole treatment .

column1: The amount of fibrin in the kidneys was also considerably lower than in animals which received thrombin and AMCA alone .
column2: The amount of fibrin in the kidneys was also considerably lower than in animals which received thrombin and chem* AMCA *chem alone .

column1: It is suggested that the effects of Captopril on the lungs may be attributable to a vasodilatory effect due to a reduction in the circulating level of Angiotension II and an increase in prostacyclin ( secondary to an increase in bradykinin ) .

column1: Captopril may , by the same mechanism , reduce the increase in glomerular filtration that is known to occur after an injection of thrombin , thereby diminishing the aggregation of fibrin monomers in the glomeruli , with the result that less fibrin will be deposited and thus less kidney damage will be produced .

column1: Stroke associated with cocaine use .
column2: Stroke associated with chem* cocaine *chem use .

column1: We describe eight patients in whom cocaine use was related to stroke and review 39 cases from the literature .
column2: We describe eight patients in whom chem* cocaine *chem use was related to stroke and review 39 cases from the literature .

column1: Among these 47 patients the mean ( + / - SD ) age was 32 . 5 + / - 12 . 1 years ; 76 % ( 34 / 45 ) were men .
column2: Among these 47 patients the mean ( + / - SD ) age was 32 . 5 + / - 12 . 1 years ; 76 % ( 34 / 45 ) were men .

column1: Stroke followed cocaine use by inhalation , intranasal , intravenous , and intramuscular routes .
column2: Stroke followed chem* cocaine *chem use by inhalation , intranasal , intravenous , and intramuscular routes .

column1: Intracranial aneurysms or arteriovenous malformations were present in 17 of 32 patients studied angiographically or at autopsy ; cerebral vasculitis was present in two patients .
column2: Intracranial aneurysms or arteriovenous malformations were present in 17 of 32 patients studied angiographically or at autopsy ; cerebral vasculitis was present in two patients .

column1: Cerebral infarction occurred in 10 patients ( 22 % ) , intracerebral hemorrhage in 22 ( 49 % ) , and subarachnoid hemorrhage in 13 ( 29 % ) .
column2: Cerebral infarction occurred in 10 patients ( 22 % ) , intracerebral hemorrhage in 22 ( 49 % ) , and subarachnoid hemorrhage in 13 ( 29 % ) .

column1: These data indicate that ( 1 ) the apparent incidence of stroke related to cocaine use is increasing ; ( 2 ) cocaine - associated stroke occurs primarily in young adults ; ( 3 ) stroke may follow any route of cocaine administration ; ( 4 ) stroke after cocaine use is frequently associated with intracranial aneurysms and arteriovenous malformations ; and ( 5 ) in cocaine - associated stroke , the frequency of intracranial hemorrhage exceeds that of cerebral infarction .
column2: These data indicate that ( 1 ) the apparent incidence of stroke related to chem* cocaine *chem use is increasing ; ( 2 ) chem* cocaine *chem - associated stroke occurs primarily in young adults ; ( 3 ) stroke may follow any route of chem* cocaine *chem administration ; ( 4 ) stroke after chem* cocaine *chem use is frequently associated with intracranial aneurysms and arteriovenous malformations ; and ( 5 ) in chem* cocaine *chem - associated stroke , the frequency of intracranial hemorrhage exceeds that of cerebral infarction .

column1: A randomized comparison of labetalol and nitroprusside for induced hypotension .
column2: A randomized comparison of chem* labetalol *chem and chem* nitroprusside *chem for induced hypotension .

column2: In a randomized study , chem* labetalol *chem - induced hypotension and chem* nitroprusside *chem - induced hypotension were compared in 20 patients ( 10 in each group ) scheduled for major orthopedic procedures .

column2: Each patient was subjected to an identical anesthetic protocol and similar drug - induced reductions in mean arterial blood pressure ( BP ) ( 50 to 55 mmHg ) .

column1: Nitroprusside infusion was associated with a significant ( p less than 0 . 05 ) increase in heart rate and cardiac output ; rebound hypertension was observed in three patients after discontinuation of nitroprusside .
column2: Nitroprusside infusion was associated with a significant ( p less than 0 . 05 ) increase in heart rate and cardiac output ; rebound hypertension was observed in three patients after discontinuation of chem* nitroprusside *chem .

column1: Labetalol administration was not associated with any of these findings .
column2: chem* Labetalol *chem administration was not associated with any of these findings .

column1: Arterial PO2 decreased in both groups .

column2: It was concluded that chem* labetalol *chem offers advantages over chem* nitroprusside *chem .

column1: Sodium status influences chronic amphotericin B nephrotoxicity in rats .
column2: chem* Sodium *chem status influences chronic chem* amphotericin B *chem nephrotoxicity in rats .

column1: The nephrotoxic potential of amphotericin B ( 5 mg / kg per day intraperitoneally for 3 weeks ) has been investigated in salt - depleted , normal - salt , and salt - loaded rats .
column2: The nephrotoxic potential of chem* amphotericin B *chem ( 5 mg / kg per day intraperitoneally for 3 weeks ) has been investigated in salt - depleted , normal - salt , and salt - loaded rats .

column1: In salt - depleted rats , amphotericin B decreased creatinine clearance linearly with time , with an 85 % reduction by week 3 .
column2: In salt - depleted rats , chem* amphotericin B *chem decreased chem* creatinine *chem clearance linearly with time , with an 85 % reduction by week 3 .

column1: In contrast , in normal - salt rats creatinine clearance was decreased but to a lesser extent at week 2 and 3 , and in salt - loaded rats creatinine clearance did not change for 2 weeks and was decreased by 43 % at week 3 .
column2: In contrast , in normal - salt rats chem* creatinine *chem clearance was decreased but to a lesser extent at week 2 and 3 , and in salt - loaded rats chem* creatinine *chem clearance did not change for 2 weeks and was decreased by 43 % at week 3 .

column1: All rats in the sodium - depleted group had histopathological evidence of patchy tubular cytoplasmic degeneration in tubules that was not observed in any normal - salt or salt - loaded rat .
column2: All rats in the chem* sodium *chem - depleted group had histopathological evidence of patchy tubular cytoplasmic degeneration in tubules that was not observed in any normal - salt or salt - loaded rat .

column1: Concentrations of amphotericin B in plasma were not significantly different among the three groups at any time during the study .
column2: Concentrations of chem* amphotericin B *chem in plasma were not significantly different among the three groups at any time during the study .

column1: However , at the end of 3 weeks , amphotericin B levels in the kidneys and liver were significantly higher in salt - depleted and normal - salt rats than those in salt - loaded rats , with plasma / kidney ratios of 21 , 14 , and 8 in salt - depleted , normal - salt , and salt - loaded rats , respectively .
column2: However , at the end of 3 weeks , chem* amphotericin B *chem levels in the kidneys and liver were significantly higher in salt - depleted and normal - salt rats than those in salt - loaded rats , with plasma / kidney ratios of 21 , 14 , and 8 in salt - depleted , normal - salt , and salt - loaded rats , respectively .

column1: In conclusion , reductions in creatinine clearance and renal amphotericin B accumulation after chronic amphotericin B administration were enhanced by salt depletion and attenuated by sodium loading in rats .
column2: In conclusion , reductions in chem* creatinine *chem clearance and renal chem* amphotericin B *chem accumulation after chronic chem* amphotericin B *chem administration were enhanced by salt depletion and attenuated by chem* sodium *chem loading in rats .

column1: Flestolol ( ACC - 9089 ) is a nonselective , competitive , ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent , without any intrinsic sympathomimetic activity .
column2: chem* Flestolol *chem ( chem* ACC - 9089 *chem ) is a nonselective , competitive , ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent , without any intrinsic sympathomimetic activity .

column1: Flestolol is metabolized by plasma esterases and has an elimination half - life of approximately 6 . 5 minutes .
column2: chem* Flestolol *chem is metabolized by plasma esterases and has an elimination half - life of approximately 6 . 5 minutes .

column1: This agent was well tolerated in healthy volunteers at doses up to 100 micrograms / kg / min .
column2: This agent was well tolerated in healthy volunteers at doses up to 100 micrograms / kg / min .

column1: In long - term infusion studies , flestolol was well tolerated at the effective beta - blocking dose ( 5 micrograms / kg / min ) for up to seven days .
column2: In long - term infusion studies , chem* flestolol *chem was well tolerated at the effective beta - blocking dose ( 5 micrograms / kg / min ) for up to seven days .

column2: chem* Flestolol *chem blood concentrations increased linearly with increasing dose and good correlation exists between blood concentrations of chem* flestolol *chem and beta - adrenergic blockade .

column1: Flestolol produced a dose - dependent attenuation of isoproterenol - induced tachycardia .
column2: chem* Flestolol *chem produced a dose - dependent attenuation of chem* isoproterenol *chem - induced tachycardia .

column1: Electrophysiologic and hemodynamic effects of flestolol are similar to those of other beta blockers .
column2: Electrophysiologic and hemodynamic effects of chem* flestolol *chem are similar to those of other beta blockers .

column1: In contrast with other beta blockers , flestolol - induced effects reverse rapidly ( within 30 minutes ) following discontinuation because of its short half - life .
column2: In contrast with other beta blockers , chem* flestolol *chem - induced effects reverse rapidly ( within 30 minutes ) following discontinuation because of its short half - life .

column1: Flestolol effectively reduced heart rate in patients with supraventricular tachyarrhythmia .
column2: chem* Flestolol *chem effectively reduced heart rate in patients with supraventricular tachyarrhythmia .

column1: In patients with unstable angina , flestolol infusion was found to be safe and effective in controlling chest pain .
column2: In patients with unstable angina , chem* flestolol *chem infusion was found to be safe and effective in controlling chest pain .

column1: It is concluded that flestolol is a potent , well - tolerated , ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent .
column2: It is concluded that chem* flestolol *chem is a potent , well - tolerated , ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent .

column1: Use of flestolol in the critical care setting is currently undergoing investigation .
column2: Use of chem* flestolol *chem in the critical care setting is currently undergoing investigation .

column1: Immunohistochemical , electron microscopic and morphometric studies of estrogen - induced rat prolactinomas after bromocriptine treatment .
column2: Immunohistochemical , electron microscopic and morphometric studies of chem* estrogen *chem - induced rat prolactinomas after chem* bromocriptine *chem treatment .

column1: To clarify the effects of bromocriptine on prolactinoma cells in vivo , immunohistochemical , ultrastructural and morphometrical analyses were applied to estrogen - induced rat prolactinoma cells 1 h and 6 h after injection of bromocriptine ( 3 mg / kg of body weight ) .
column2: To clarify the effects of chem* bromocriptine *chem on prolactinoma cells in vivo , immunohistochemical , ultrastructural and morphometrical analyses were applied to chem* estrogen *chem - induced rat prolactinoma cells 1 h and 6 h after injection of chem* bromocriptine *chem ( 3 mg / kg of body weight ) .

column1: One h after treatment , serum prolactin levels decreased markedly .
column2: One h after treatment , serum prolactin levels decreased markedly .

column1: Electron microscopy disclosed many secretory granules , slightly distorted rough endoplasmic reticulum , and partially dilated Golgi cisternae in the prolactinoma cells .
column2: Electron microscopy disclosed many secretory granules , slightly distorted rough endoplasmic reticulum , and partially dilated Golgi cisternae in the prolactinoma cells .

column1: Morphometric analysis revealed that the volume density of secretory granules increased , while the volume density of cytoplasmic microtubules decreased .
column2: Morphometric analysis revealed that the volume density of secretory granules increased , while the volume density of cytoplasmic microtubules decreased .

column1: These findings suggest that lowered serum prolactin levels in the early phase of bromocriptine treatment may result from an impaired secretion of prolactin due to decreasing numbers of cytoplasmic microtubules .
column2: These findings suggest that lowered serum prolactin levels in the early phase of chem* bromocriptine *chem treatment may result from an impaired secretion of prolactin due to decreasing numbers of cytoplasmic microtubules .

column1: At 6 h after injection , serum prolactin levels were still considerably lower than in controls .
column2: At 6 h after injection , serum prolactin levels were still considerably lower than in controls .

column1: The prolactinoma cells at this time were well granulated , with vesiculated rough endoplasmic reticulum and markedly dilated Golgi cisternae .
column2: The prolactinoma cells at this time were well granulated , with vesiculated rough endoplasmic reticulum and markedly dilated Golgi cisternae .

column1: Electron microscopical immunohistochemistry revealed positive reaction products noted on the secretory granules , Golgi cisternae , and endoplasmic reticulum of the untreated rat prolactinoma cells .
column2: Electron microscopical immunohistochemistry revealed positive reaction products noted on the secretory granules , Golgi cisternae , and endoplasmic reticulum of the untreated rat prolactinoma cells .

column1: However , only secretory granules showed the positive reaction products for prolactin 6 h after bromocriptine treatment of the adenoma cells .
column2: However , only secretory granules showed the positive reaction products for prolactin 6 h after chem* bromocriptine *chem treatment of the adenoma cells .

column1: An increase in the volume density of secretory granules and a decrease in the volume densities of rough endoplasmic reticulum and microtubules was determined by morphometric analysis , suggesting that bromocriptine inhibits protein synthesis as well as bringing about a disturbance of the prolactin secretion .
column2: An increase in the volume density of secretory granules and a decrease in the volume densities of rough endoplasmic reticulum and microtubules was determined by morphometric analysis , suggesting that chem* bromocriptine *chem inhibits protein synthesis as well as bringing about a disturbance of the prolactin secretion .

column1: Sulfasalazine - induced lupus erythematosus .

column1: Pneumonitis , bilateral pleural effusions , echocardiographic evidence of cardiac tamponade , and positive autoantibodies developed in a 43 - year - old man , who was receiving long - term sulfasalazine therapy for chronic ulcerative colitis .
column2: Pneumonitis , bilateral pleural effusions , echocardiographic evidence of cardiac tamponade , and positive autoantibodies developed in a 43 - year - old man , who was receiving long - term chem* sulfasalazine *chem therapy for chronic ulcerative colitis .

column1: After cessation of the sulfasalazine and completion of a six - week course of corticosteroids , these problems resolved over a period of four to six months .
column2: After cessation of the chem* sulfasalazine *chem and completion of a six - week course of corticosteroids , these problems resolved over a period of four to six months .

column2: The chem* CBZ *chem levels measured in plasma and brain of these animals , however , were below those normally considered protective .

column1: Inhibition of immunoreactive corticotropin - releasing factor secretion into the hypophysial - portal circulation by delayed glucocorticoid feedback .
column2: Inhibition of immunoreactive corticotropin - releasing factor secretion into the hypophysial - portal circulation by delayed glucocorticoid feedback .

column2: chem* Nitroprusside *chem - induced hypotension evokes ACTH secretion which is primarily mediated by enhanced secretion of immunoreactive corticotropin - releasing factor ( irCRF ) into the hypophysial - portal circulation .

column2: Portal plasma concentrations of neither chem* arginine vasopressin *chem nor chem* oxytocin *chem are significantly altered in this paradigm .

column1: Application of a delayed feedback signal , in the form of a 2 - h systemic corticosterone infusion in urethane - anesthetized rats with pharmacological blockade of glucocorticoid synthesis , is without effect on the resting secretion of arginine vasopressin and oxytocin at any corticosterone feedback dose tested .

column1: Noradrenergic involvement in catalepsy induced by delta 9 - tetrahydrocannabinol .
column2: Noradrenergic involvement in catalepsy induced by chem* delta 9 - tetrahydrocannabinol *chem .

column1: In order to elucidate the role of the catecholaminergic system in the cataleptogenic effect of delta 9 - tetrahydrocannabinol ( THC ) , the effect of pretreatment with 6 - hydroxydopamine ( 6 - OHDA ) or with desipramine and 6 - OHDA and lesions of the locus coeruleus were investigated in rats .
column2: In order to elucidate the role of the catecholaminergic system in the cataleptogenic effect of chem* delta 9 - tetrahydrocannabinol *chem ( chem* THC *chem ) , the effect of pretreatment with chem* 6 - hydroxydopamine *chem ( chem* 6 - OHDA *chem ) or with chem* desipramine *chem and chem* 6 - OHDA *chem and lesions of the locus coeruleus were investigated in rats .

column1: The cataleptogenic effect of THC was significantly reduced in rats treated with 6 - OHDA and in rats with lesions of the locus coeruleus but not in rats treated with desipramine and 6 - OHDA , as compared with control rats .
column2: The cataleptogenic effect of chem* THC *chem was significantly reduced in rats treated with chem* 6 - OHDA *chem and in rats with lesions of the locus coeruleus but not in rats treated with chem* desipramine *chem and chem* 6 - OHDA *chem , as compared with control rats .

column1: On the contrary , the cataleptogenic effect of haloperidol was significantly reduced in rats treated with desipramine and 6 - OHDA but not in rats treated with 6 - OHDA or in rats with lesions of the locus coeruleus .
column2: On the contrary , the cataleptogenic effect of chem* haloperidol *chem was significantly reduced in rats treated with chem* desipramine *chem and chem* 6 - OHDA *chem but not in rats treated with chem* 6 - OHDA *chem or in rats with lesions of the locus coeruleus .

column1: These results indicate that noradrenergic neurons have an important role in the manifestation of catalepsy induced by THC , whereas dopaminergic neurons are important in catalepsy induced by haloperidol .
column2: These results indicate that noradrenergic neurons have an important role in the manifestation of catalepsy induced by chem* THC *chem , whereas dopaminergic neurons are important in catalepsy induced by chem* haloperidol *chem .

column1: Reversibility of captopril - induced renal insufficiency after prolonged use in an unusual case of renovascular hypertension .
column2: Reversibility of chem* captopril *chem - induced renal insufficiency after prolonged use in an unusual case of renovascular hypertension .

column1: We report a case of severe hypertension with an occluded renal artery to a solitary kidney , who developed sudden deterioration of renal function following treatment with captopril .
column2: We report a case of severe hypertension with an occluded renal artery to a solitary kidney , who developed sudden deterioration of renal function following treatment with chem* captopril *chem .

column1: His renal function remained impaired but stable during 2 years ' treatment with captopril but returned to pre - treatment levels soon after cessation of the drug .
column2: His renal function remained impaired but stable during 2 years ' treatment with chem* captopril *chem but returned to pre - treatment levels soon after cessation of the drug .

column1: This indicates reversibility in captopril - induced renal failure even after its prolonged use and suggests that no organic damage occurs to glomerular arterioles following chronic ACE inhibition .
column2: This indicates reversibility in chem* captopril *chem - induced renal failure even after its prolonged use and suggests that no organic damage occurs to glomerular arterioles following chronic ACE inhibition .
