column1: The magnitude and time course of the increase in heart rate and the decrease in systolic blood pressure after nitroglycerin were similar in the normal and diabetic subjects without autonomic neuropathy , whereas a lesser increase in heart rate and a greater decrease in systolic blood pressure occurred in the diabetic subjects with autonomic neuropathy .

column1: In each group , SNP infusion resulted in an initial decrease in blood pressure from 86 torr and 83 torr , respectively , to 48 torr .

column2: During the chem* SNP *chem infusion the control animals demonstrated a progressive increase in blood pressure to 61 torr , whereas the chem* saralasin *chem - treated animals showed no change .

column2: Following discontinuation of chem* SNP *chem , blood pressure in the control animals rebounded to 94 torr , as compared with 78 torr in the chem* saralasin *chem - treated rats .

column1: In this study , 62 patients with confirmed initial normal renal function and treated with 2 to 5 mg / kg / day of gentamicin sulfate or tobramycin sulfate for a minimum of seven days were followed up prospectively for the development of aminoglycoside - related renal failure , defined as at least a one - third reduction in renal function .

column1: In these 62 patients , no other causes for renal failure could be identified .

column1: Thus , gentamicin was associated with renal failure more than three times as often as was tobramycin .

column1: Toxic hepatitis induced by antithyroid drugs : four cases including one with cross - reactivity between carbimazole and benzylthiouracil .

column1: OBJECTIVE : This study was conducted to assess the occurrence of hepatic adverse effects encountered with antithyroid drugs .
column2: OBJECTIVE : This study was conducted to assess the occurrence of hepatic adverse effects encountered with antithyroid drugs .

column1: METHODS : Retrospective review of medical records of 236 patients with hyperthyroidism admitted in our department ( in - or out - patients ) from 1986 to 1992 .
column2: METHODS : Retrospective review of medical records of 236 patients with hyperthyroidism admitted in our department ( in - or out - patients ) from 1986 to 1992 .

column1: RESULTS : Four patients ( 1 . 7 % ) were identified with toxic hepatitis which could reasonably be attributed to the use of antithyroid agent .
column2: RESULTS : Four patients ( 1 . 7 % ) were identified with toxic hepatitis which could reasonably be attributed to the use of antithyroid agent .

column2: Biological features of hepatitis disappeared in all cases after cessation of the incriminated drug , while biliary , viral and immunological searches were negative .

column2: Only 2 patients of our retrospective study experienced a mild or severe neutropenia .

column1: CONCLUSION : Toxic hepatitis is a potential adverse effect of antithyroid drugs which warrants , as for haematological disturbances , a pre - therapeutic determination and a careful follow - up of relevant biological markers .
column2: CONCLUSION : Toxic hepatitis is a potential adverse effect of antithyroid drugs which warrants , as for haematological disturbances , a pre - therapeutic determination and a careful follow - up of relevant biological markers .

column1: Moreover , hepatotoxicity may not be restricted to one class of antithyroid agents .
column2: Moreover , hepatotoxicity may not be restricted to one class of antithyroid agents .

column2: A few minutes after administration of the drugs , they presented urticaria ( patients 1 and 2 ) and conjunctivitis ( patient 1 ) .

column2: The purpose of our study was to determine the cause of the patients ' reactions , the immunological mechanisms involved and whether these patients would be able to tolerate any kind of corticoid .

column1: Habitual use of acetaminophen as a risk factor for chronic renal failure : a comparison with phenacetin .
column2: Habitual use of chem* acetaminophen *chem as a risk factor for chronic renal failure : a comparison with chem* phenacetin *chem .

column1: Six epidemiologic studies in the United States and Europe indicate that habitual use of phenacetin is associated with the development of chronic renal failure and end - stage renal disease ( ESRD ) , with a relative risk in the range of 4 to 19 .
column2: Six epidemiologic studies in the United States and Europe indicate that habitual use of chem* phenacetin *chem is associated with the development of chronic renal failure and end - stage renal disease ( ESRD ) , with a relative risk in the range of 4 to 19 .

column1: As a result of these and other studies , phenacetin has now been withdrawn from the market in most countries .
column2: As a result of these and other studies , chem* phenacetin *chem has now been withdrawn from the market in most countries .

column1: However , three case control studies , one each in North Carolina , northern Maryland , and West Berlin , Germany , showed that habitual use of acetaminophen is also associated with chronic renal failure and ESRD , with a relative risk in the range of 2 to 4 .
column2: However , three case control studies , one each in North Carolina , northern Maryland , and West Berlin , Germany , showed that habitual use of chem* acetaminophen *chem is also associated with chronic renal failure and ESRD , with a relative risk in the range of 2 to 4 .

column1: These studies suggest that both phenacetin and acetaminophen may contribute to the burden of ESRD , with the risk of the latter being somewhat less than that of the former .
column2: These studies suggest that both chem* phenacetin *chem and chem* acetaminophen *chem may contribute to the burden of ESRD , with the risk of the latter being somewhat less than that of the former .

column1: This apparent difference in risk may not be due to differences in nephrotoxic potential of the drugs themselves .
column2: This apparent difference in risk may not be due to differences in nephrotoxic potential of the drugs themselves .

column1: A lower relative risk would be expected for acetaminophen if the risk of both drugs in combination with other analgesics was higher than the risk of either agent alone .
column2: A lower relative risk would be expected for chem* acetaminophen *chem if the risk of both drugs in combination with other analgesics was higher than the risk of either agent alone .

column1: Thus , acetaminophen has been used both as a single agent and in combination with other analgesics , whereas phenacetin was available only in combinations .
column2: Thus , chem* acetaminophen *chem has been used both as a single agent and in combination with other analgesics , whereas chem* phenacetin *chem was available only in combinations .

column1: The possibility that habitual use of acetaminophen alone increases the risk of ESRD has not been clearly demonstrated , but cannot be dismissed .
column2: The possibility that habitual use of chem* acetaminophen *chem alone increases the risk of ESRD has not been clearly demonstrated , but cannot be dismissed .

column1: The nephrotoxic action of anticancer drugs such as nitrogranulogen ( NG ) , methotrexate ( MTX ) , 5 - fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) and cyclophosphamide ( CY ) administered alone or in combination [ MTX + 5 - FU + CY ( CMF ) ] was evaluated in experiments on Wistar rats .

column1: After MTX administration a significant increase ( p = 0 . 0228 ) in the plasma creatinine concentration and a significant ( p = 0 . 0001 ) decrease in creatinine clearance was noted compared to controls .

column1: CY caused hemorrhagic cystitis in 40 % of rats , but it did not cause this complication when combined with 5 - FU and MTX .

column1: Compared with sham - operated controls , lesions significantly ( p < 0 . 25 ) blunted the early ( < 60 min ) free - field locomotor hypoactivity caused by nicotine ( 0 . 5 mg kg ( - 1 ) , i . m . ) , enhanced the later ( 60 - 120 min ) nicotine - induced hyperactivity , and raised spontaneous nocturnal activity .

column1: Lithium - associated cognitive and functional deficits reduced by a switch to divalproex sodium : a case series .

column1: BACKGROUND : Lithium remains a first - line treatment for the acute and maintenance treatment of bipolar disorder .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Lithium *chem remains a first - line treatment for the acute and maintenance treatment of bipolar disorder .

column1: Although much has been written about the management of the more common adverse effects of lithium , such as polyuria and tremor , more subtle lithium side effects such as cognitive deficits , loss of creativity , and functional impairments remain understudied .

column1: Both compounds are metabolised in the same way as 1 - bromo - 1 - chloro - 2 , 2 , 2 - trifluoroethane ( halothane ) to form reactive trifluoroacetyl halide intermediates , which have been implicated in the hepatotoxicity of halothane .

column2: INTERPRETATION : Repeated exposure of human beings to chem* HCFCs 123 and 124 *chem can result in serious liver injury in a large proportion of the exposed population .

column1: Endocrine screening in 1 , 022 men with erectile dysfunction : clinical significance and cost - effective strategy .

column1: PURPOSE : We reviewed the results of serum testosterone and prolactin determination in 1 , 022 patients referred because of erectile dysfunction and compared the data with history , results of physical examination , other etiological investigations and effects of endocrine therapy to refine the rules of cost - effective endocrine screening and to pinpoint actual responsibility for hormonal abnormalities .
column2: PURPOSE : We reviewed the results of serum chem* testosterone *chem and prolactin determination in 1 , 022 patients referred because of erectile dysfunction and compared the data with history , results of physical examination , other etiological investigations and effects of endocrine therapy to refine the rules of cost - effective endocrine screening and to pinpoint actual responsibility for hormonal abnormalities .

column1: MATERIALS AND METHODS : Testosterone and prolactin were determined by radioimmunoassay .
column2: MATERIALS AND METHODS : chem* Testosterone *chem and prolactin were determined by radioimmunoassay .

column1: Every patient was screened for testosterone and 451 were screened for prolactin on the basis of low sexual desire , gynecomastia or testosterone less than 4 ng . / ml .

column2: Main clinical criteria tested regarding efficiency in hormone determination were low sexual desire , small testes and gynecomastia .

column1: The prevalence of repeatedly low testosterone increased with age ( 4 % before age 50 years and 9 % 50 years or older ) .
column2: The prevalence of repeatedly low chem* testosterone *chem increased with age ( 4 % before age 50 years and 9 % 50 years or older ) .

column2: Two pituitary tumors were discovered after chem* testosterone *chem determination .

column1: Most of the other low testosterone levels seemed to result from nonorganic hypothalamic dysfunction because of normal serum luteinizing hormone and prolactin and to have only a small role in erectile dysfunction ( definite improvement in only 16 of 44 [ 36 % ] after androgen therapy , normal morning or nocturnal erections in 30 % and definite vasculogenic contributions in 42 % ) .
column2: Most of the other low chem* testosterone *chem levels seemed to result from nonorganic hypothalamic dysfunction because of normal serum luteinizing hormone and prolactin and to have only a small role in erectile dysfunction ( definite improvement in only 16 of 44 [ 36 % ] after androgen therapy , normal morning or nocturnal erections in 30 % and definite vasculogenic contributions in 42 % ) .

column2: Determining chem* testosterone *chem only in cases of low sexual desire or abnormal physical examination would have missed 40 % of the cases with low chem* testosterone *chem , including 37 % of those subsequently improved by androgen therapy .

column2: However , cost - effective screening strategies recommended so far missed 40 to 50 % of cases improved with endocrine therapy and the pituitary tumors .

column1: Extrapyramidal side effects with risperidone and haloperidol at comparable D2 receptor occupancy levels .

column1: Risperidone is an antipsychotic drug with high affinity at dopamine D2 and serotonin 5 - HT2 receptors .
column2: chem* Risperidone *chem is an antipsychotic drug with high affinity at chem* dopamine *chem D2 and chem* serotonin 5 - HT2 *chem receptors .

column1: Previous clinical studies have proposed that risperidone ' s pharmacologic profile may produce improved efficacy for negative psychotic symptoms and decreased propensity for extrapyramidal side effects ; features shared by so - called ' atypical ' neuroleptics .
column2: Previous clinical studies have proposed that chem* risperidone *chem ' s pharmacologic profile may produce improved efficacy for negative psychotic symptoms and decreased propensity for extrapyramidal side effects ; features shared by so - called ' atypical ' neuroleptics .

column1: To determine if routine risperidone treatment is associated with a unique degree of D2 receptor occupancy and pattern of clinical effects , we used [ 123I ] IBZM SPECT to determine D2 occupancy in subjects treated with routine clinical doses of risperidone ( n = 12 ) or haloperidol ( n = 7 ) .
column2: To determine if routine chem* risperidone *chem treatment is associated with a unique degree of D2 receptor occupancy and pattern of clinical effects , we used [ 123I ] IBZM SPECT to determine D2 occupancy in subjects treated with routine clinical doses of chem* risperidone *chem ( n = 12 ) or chem* haloperidol *chem ( n = 7 ) .

column1: Both risperidone and haloperidol produced D2 occupancy levels between approximately 60 and 90 % at standard clinical doses .
column2: Both chem* risperidone *chem and chem* haloperidol *chem produced D2 occupancy levels between approximately 60 and 90 % at standard clinical doses .

column1: There was no significant difference between occupancy levels obtained with haloperidol or risperidone .

column1: Drug - induced parkinsonism was observed in subjects treated with risperidone ( 42 % ) and haloperidol ( 29 % ) and was observed at occupancy levels above 60 % .
column2: Drug - induced parkinsonism was observed in subjects treated with chem* risperidone *chem ( 42 % ) and chem* haloperidol *chem ( 29 % ) and was observed at occupancy levels above 60 % .

column2: Based on these observations , it is concluded that 5 - HT2 blockade obtained with chem* risperidone *chem at D2 occupancy rates of 60 % and above does not appear to protect against the risk for extrapyramidal side effects .

column1: Combination chemotherapy with mitoxantrone , high - dose 5 - fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) and leucovorin ( MFL regimen ) had been reported as an effective and well tolerated regimen .

column1: From October 1993 to November 1995 , we treated 13 patients with previously chemotherapy - treated metastatic breast cancer by mitoxantrone , 12 mg / m2 , on day 1 and continuous infusion of 5 - FU , 3000 mg / m2 , together with leucovorin , 300 mg / m2 , for 48 h from day 1 to 2 .

column1: RESULTS : Nine of 30 patients receiving lidocaine experienced TNSs , 1 of 30 patients receiving prilocaine ( P = 0 . 03 ) had them , and none of 30 patients receiving bupivacaine had TNSs .

column1: Adverse effects of antipsychotics often lead to noncompliance .
column2: Adverse effects of antipsychotics often lead to noncompliance .

column2: The side effect profiles of the atypical antipsychotics are more advantageous than those of the conventional neuroleptics .

column1: Conventional agents are associated with unwanted central nervous system effects , including extrapyramidal symptoms ( EPS ) , tardive dyskinesia , sedation , and possible impairment of some cognitive measures , as well as cardiac effects , orthostatic hypotension , hepatic changes , anticholinergic side effects , sexual dysfunction , and weight gain .
column2: Conventional agents are associated with unwanted central nervous system effects , including extrapyramidal symptoms ( EPS ) , tardive dyskinesia , sedation , and possible impairment of some cognitive measures , as well as cardiac effects , orthostatic hypotension , hepatic changes , anticholinergic side effects , sexual dysfunction , and weight gain .

column1: The newer atypical agents have a lower risk of EPS , but are associated in varying degrees with sedation , cardiovascular effects , anticholinergic effects , weight gain , sexual dysfunction , hepatic effects , lowered seizure threshold ( primarily clozapine ) , and agranulocytosis ( clozapine only ) .

column1: A reproducible model for producing diffuse myocardial injury ( epinephrine infusion ) has been developed to study the cardioprotective effects of agents or maneuvers which might alter the evolution of acute myocardial infarction .
column2: A reproducible model for producing diffuse myocardial injury ( chem* epinephrine *chem infusion ) has been developed to study the cardioprotective effects of agents or maneuvers which might alter the evolution of acute myocardial infarction .

column1: Infusions of epinephrine ( 4 mug per kilogram per minute for 6 hours ) increased radiocalcium uptakes into intact myocardium and each of its subcellular components with the mitochondrial fraction showing the most consistent changes when compared to saline - infused control animals ( 4 , 957 vs . 827 counts per minute per gram of dried tissue or fraction ) .
column2: Infusions of chem* epinephrine *chem ( 4 mug per kilogram per minute for 6 hours ) increased chem* radiocalcium *chem uptakes into intact myocardium and each of its subcellular components with the mitochondrial fraction showing the most consistent changes when compared to saline - infused control animals ( 4 , 957 vs . 827 counts per minute per gram of dried tissue or fraction ) .

column1: Myocardial concentrations of calcium also increased significantly ( 12 . 0 vs . 5 . 0 mg . per 100 Gm . of fat - free dry weight ) .
column2: Myocardial concentrations of chem* calcium *chem also increased significantly ( 12 . 0 vs . 5 . 0 mg . per 100 Gm . of fat - free dry weight ) .

column1: Infusions of calcium chloride sufficient to raise serum calcium concentrations 2 mEq . per liter failed to increase calcium influx into the myocardial cell .
column2: Infusions of chem* calcium chloride *chem sufficient to raise serum chem* calcium *chem concentrations 2 mEq . per liter failed to increase chem* calcium *chem influx into the myocardial cell .

column1: Mitochondrial radiocalcium uptakes were significantly decreased in animals pretreated with acetylsalicylic acid or dipyridamole or when hydrocortisone was added to the epinephrine infusion ( 2 , 682 , 2 , 803 , and 3 , 424 counts per minute per gram of dried fraction , respectively ) .
column2: Mitochondrial chem* radiocalcium *chem uptakes were significantly decreased in animals pretreated with chem* acetylsalicylic acid *chem or chem* dipyridamole *chem or when chem* hydrocortisone *chem was added to the chem* epinephrine *chem infusion ( 2 , 682 , 2 , 803 , and 3 , 424 counts per minute per gram of dried fraction , respectively ) .

column1: Myocardial calcium concentrations also were decreased ( 11 . 2 , 8 . 3 , and 8 . 9 mg . per 100 Gm . of fat - free dry weight , respectively ) in the three treatment groups , being significantly decreased only in the last two .
column2: Myocardial chem* calcium *chem concentrations also were decreased ( 11 . 2 , 8 . 3 , and 8 . 9 mg . per 100 Gm . of fat - free dry weight , respectively ) in the three treatment groups , being significantly decreased only in the last two .

column1: Evidence of microscopic damage was graded as less severe in the three treatment groups .
column2: Evidence of microscopic damage was graded as less severe in the three treatment groups .

column1: Acetylsalicylic acid , dipyridamole , and hydrocortisone all appear to have cardioprotective effects when tested in this model .
column2: chem* Acetylsalicylic acid *chem , chem* dipyridamole *chem , and chem* hydrocortisone *chem all appear to have cardioprotective effects when tested in this model .

column1: Clinical and histopathologic examination of renal allografts treated with tacrolimus ( FK506 ) for at least one year .
column2: Clinical and histopathologic examination of renal allografts treated with chem* tacrolimus *chem ( chem* FK506 *chem ) for at least one year .

column1: BACKGROUND : We clinically and pathologically analyzed renal allografts from 1 9 renal transplant patients treated with tacrolimus ( FK506 ) for more than 1 year .
column2: BACKGROUND : We clinically and pathologically analyzed renal allografts from 1 9 renal transplant patients treated with chem* tacrolimus *chem ( chem* FK506 *chem ) for more than 1 year .

column1: METHODS : Twenty - six renal allograft biopsy specimens from 1 9 renal transplant patients who underwent transplantations between 1991 and 1993 were evaluated .
column2: METHODS : Twenty - six renal allograft biopsy specimens from 1 9 renal transplant patients who underwent transplantations between 1991 and 1993 were evaluated .

column1: Thirteen biopsies were performed from stable functioning renal allografts with informed consent ( nonepisode biopsy ) and the other 13 were from dysfunctional renal allografts with a clinical indication for biopsy ( episode biopsy ) .
column2: Thirteen biopsies were performed from stable functioning renal allografts with informed consent ( nonepisode biopsy ) and the other 13 were from dysfunctional renal allografts with a clinical indication for biopsy ( episode biopsy ) .

column1: RESULTS : The main pathologic diagnoses ( some overlap ) were acute rejection ( AR ; n = 4 ) , chronic rejection ( CR ; n = 5 ) , AR + CR ( n = 4 ) , recurrent IgA nephropathy ( n = 5 ) , normal findings ( n = 2 ) , minimal - type chronic FK506 nephropathy ( n = 9 ) , and mild - type FK506 nephropathy ( n = 11 ) .
column2: RESULTS : The main pathologic diagnoses ( some overlap ) were acute rejection ( AR ; n = 4 ) , chronic rejection ( CR ; n = 5 ) , AR + CR ( n = 4 ) , recurrent IgA nephropathy ( n = 5 ) , normal findings ( n = 2 ) , minimal - type chronic chem* FK506 *chem nephropathy ( n = 9 ) , and mild - type chem* FK506 *chem nephropathy ( n = 11 ) .

column1: Of the nonepisode biopsies , 7 and 4 biopsies showed minimal - type and mild - type chronic FK506 nephropathy , respectively .
column2: Of the nonepisode biopsies , 7 and 4 biopsies showed minimal - type and mild - type chronic chem* FK506 *chem nephropathy , respectively .

column1: Chronic FK506 nephropathy consisted of rough and foamy tubular vacuolization ( 5 biopsies ) , arteriolopathy ( angiodegeneration of the arteriolar wall ; 20 biopsies ) , focal segmental glomerulosclerosis ( 4 biopsies ) and the striped form of interstitial fibrosis ( 11 biopsies ) .
column2: Chronic chem* FK506 *chem nephropathy consisted of rough and foamy tubular vacuolization ( 5 biopsies ) , arteriolopathy ( angiodegeneration of the arteriolar wall ; 20 biopsies ) , focal segmental glomerulosclerosis ( 4 biopsies ) and the striped form of interstitial fibrosis ( 11 biopsies ) .

column1: The serum creatinine levels of patients in the mild - type chronic FK506 nephropathy group , which included 7 episode biopsies , were statistically higher than those in the minimum - type chronic FK506 - nephropathy group ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: The serum chem* creatinine *chem levels of patients in the mild - type chronic chem* FK506 *chem nephropathy group , which included 7 episode biopsies , were statistically higher than those in the minimum - type chronic chem* FK506 *chem - nephropathy group ( P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : This study demonstrates that chronic FK506 nephropathy consists primarily of arteriolopathy manifesting as insudative hyalinosis of the arteriolar wall , and suggests that mild - type chronic FK506 nephropathy is a condition which may lead to deterioration of renal allograft function .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : This study demonstrates that chronic chem* FK506 *chem nephropathy consists primarily of arteriolopathy manifesting as insudative hyalinosis of the arteriolar wall , and suggests that mild - type chronic chem* FK506 *chem nephropathy is a condition which may lead to deterioration of renal allograft function .

column1: Different lobular distributions of altered hepatocyte tight junctions in rat models of intrahepatic and extrahepatic cholestasis .
column2: Different lobular distributions of altered hepatocyte tight junctions in rat models of intrahepatic and extrahepatic cholestasis .

column1: Hepatocyte tight junctions ( TJs ) , the only intercellular barrier between the sinusoidal and the canalicular spaces , play a key role in bile formation .
column2: Hepatocyte tight junctions ( TJs ) , the only intercellular barrier between the sinusoidal and the canalicular spaces , play a key role in bile formation .

column1: Although hepatocyte TJs are impaired in cholestasis , attempts to localize the precise site of hepatocyte TJ damage by freeze - fracture electron microscopy have produced limited information .
column2: Although hepatocyte TJs are impaired in cholestasis , attempts to localize the precise site of hepatocyte TJ damage by freeze - fracture electron microscopy have produced limited information .

column1: Recently , several TJ - associated proteins like ZO - 1 and 7H6 have been identified and characterized .
column2: Recently , several TJ - associated proteins like ZO - 1 and 7H6 have been identified and characterized .

column1: Immunolocalization of 7H6 appears to closely correlate with paracellular permeability .
column2: Immunolocalization of 7H6 appears to closely correlate with paracellular permeability .

column1: We used rat models of intrahepatic cholestasis by ethinyl estradiol ( EE ) treatment and extrahepatic cholestasis by bile duct ligation ( BDL ) to precisely determine the site of TJ damage .
column2: We used rat models of intrahepatic cholestasis by chem* ethinyl estradiol *chem ( chem* EE *chem ) treatment and extrahepatic cholestasis by bile duct ligation ( BDL ) to precisely determine the site of TJ damage .

column1: Alterations in hepatocyte TJs were assessed by double - immunolabeling for 7H6 and ZO - 1 using a confocal laser scanning microscope .
column2: Alterations in hepatocyte TJs were assessed by double - immunolabeling for 7H6 and ZO - 1 using a confocal laser scanning microscope .

column1: In control rats , immunostaining for 7H6 and ZO - 1 colocalized to outline bile canaliculi in a continuous fashion .
column2: In control rats , immunostaining for 7H6 and ZO - 1 colocalized to outline bile canaliculi in a continuous fashion .

column1: In contrast , 7H6 and ZO - 1 immunostaining was more discontinuous , outlining the bile canaliculi after BDL .
column2: In contrast , 7H6 and ZO - 1 immunostaining was more discontinuous , outlining the bile canaliculi after BDL .

column1: Immunostaining for 7H6 , not ZO - 1 , decreased and predominantly appeared as discrete signals in the submembranous cytoplasm of periportal hepatocytes after BDL .
column2: Immunostaining for 7H6 , not ZO - 1 , decreased and predominantly appeared as discrete signals in the submembranous cytoplasm of periportal hepatocytes after BDL .

column1: After EE treatment , changes in immunostaining for 7H6 and ZO - 1 were similar to those seen in periportal hepatocytes after BDL , but distributed more diffusely throughout the lobule .
column2: After chem* EE *chem treatment , changes in immunostaining for 7H6 and ZO - 1 were similar to those seen in periportal hepatocytes after BDL , but distributed more diffusely throughout the lobule .

column1: This study is the first to demonstrate that impairment of hepatocyte TJs occurs heterogenously in the liver lobule after BDL and suggests that BDL and EE treatments produce different lobular distributions of increased paracellular permeability .
column2: This study is the first to demonstrate that impairment of hepatocyte TJs occurs heterogenously in the liver lobule after BDL and suggests that BDL and chem* EE *chem treatments produce different lobular distributions of increased paracellular permeability .

column1: Memory facilitation and stimulation of endogenous nerve growth factor synthesis by the acetylcholine releaser PG - 9 .
column2: Memory facilitation and stimulation of endogenous nerve growth factor synthesis by the chem* acetylcholine *chem releaser chem* PG - 9 *chem .

column1: The effects of PG - 9 ( 3alpha - tropyl 2 - ( p - bromophenyl ) propionate ) , the acetylcholine releaser , on memory processes and nerve growth factor ( NGF ) synthesis were evaluated .
column2: The effects of chem* PG - 9 *chem ( chem* 3alpha - tropyl 2 - ( p - bromophenyl ) propionate *chem ) , the chem* acetylcholine *chem releaser , on memory processes and nerve growth factor ( NGF ) synthesis were evaluated .

column1: In the mouse passive - avoidance test , PG - 9 ( 10 - 30 mg / kg , i . p . ) , administered 20 min before the training session , prevented amnesia induced by both the non selective antimuscarinic drug scopolamine and the M1 - selective antagonist S - ( - ) - ET - 126 .
column2: In the mouse passive - avoidance test , chem* PG - 9 *chem ( 10 - 30 mg / kg , i . p . ) , administered 20 min before the training session , prevented amnesia induced by both the non selective antimuscarinic drug chem* scopolamine *chem and the M1 - selective antagonist chem* S - ( - ) - ET - 126 *chem .

column1: In the same experimental conditions , PG - 9 ( 5 - 20 microg per mouse , i . c . v . ) was also able to prevent antimuscarine - induced amnesia , demonstrating a central localization of the activity .
column2: In the same experimental conditions , chem* PG - 9 *chem ( 5 - 20 microg per mouse , i . c . v . ) was also able to prevent antimuscarine - induced amnesia , demonstrating a central localization of the activity .

column1: At the highest effective doses , PG - 9 did not produce any collateral symptoms as revealed by the Irwin test , and it did not modify spontaneous motility and inspection activity , as revealed by the hole - board test .
column2: At the highest effective doses , chem* PG - 9 *chem did not produce any collateral symptoms as revealed by the Irwin test , and it did not modify spontaneous motility and inspection activity , as revealed by the hole - board test .

column1: PG - 9 was also able to increase the amount of NGF secreted in vitro by astrocytes in a dose - dependent manner .
column2: chem* PG - 9 *chem was also able to increase the amount of NGF secreted in vitro by astrocytes in a dose - dependent manner .

column1: The maximal NGF contents obtained by PG - 9 were 17 . 6 - fold of the control value .
column2: The maximal NGF contents obtained by chem* PG - 9 *chem were 17 . 6 - fold of the control value .

column1: During culture , no morphological changes were found at effective concentrations of PG - 9 .
column2: During culture , no morphological changes were found at effective concentrations of chem* PG - 9 *chem .

column1: The current work indicates the ability of PG - 9 to induce beneficial effects on cognitive processes and stimulate activity of NGF synthesis in astroglial cells .
column2: The current work indicates the ability of chem* PG - 9 *chem to induce beneficial effects on cognitive processes and stimulate activity of NGF synthesis in astroglial cells .

column1: Therefore , PG - 9 could represent a potential useful drug able to improve the function of impaired cognitive processes .
column2: Therefore , chem* PG - 9 *chem could represent a potential useful drug able to improve the function of impaired cognitive processes .

column1: Mechanisms of FK 506 - induced hypertension in the rat .
column2: Mechanisms of chem* FK 506 *chem - induced hypertension in the rat .

column1: - Tacrolimus ( FK 506 ) is a powerful , widely used immunosuppressant .
column2: - chem* Tacrolimus *chem ( chem* FK 506 *chem ) is a powerful , widely used immunosuppressant .

column1: The clinical utility of FK 506 is complicated by substantial hypertension and nephrotoxicity .
column2: The clinical utility of chem* FK 506 *chem is complicated by substantial hypertension and nephrotoxicity .

column1: To clarify the mechanisms of FK 506 - induced hypertension , we studied the chronic effects of FK 506 on the synthesis of endothelin - 1 ( ET - 1 ) , the expression of mRNA of ET - 1 and endothelin - converting enzyme - 1 ( ECE - 1 ) , the endothelial nitric oxide synthase ( eNOS ) activity , and the expression of mRNA of eNOS and C - type natriuretic peptide ( CNP ) in rat blood vessels .
column2: To clarify the mechanisms of chem* FK 506 *chem - induced hypertension , we studied the chronic effects of chem* FK 506 *chem on the synthesis of endothelin - 1 ( ET - 1 ) , the expression of mRNA of ET - 1 and endothelin - converting enzyme - 1 ( ECE - 1 ) , the endothelial chem* nitric oxide *chem synthase ( eNOS ) activity , and the expression of mRNA of eNOS and C - type natriuretic peptide ( CNP ) in rat blood vessels .

column1: In addition , the effect of the specific endothelin type A receptor antagonist FR 139317 on FK 506 - induced hypertension in rats was studied .
column2: In addition , the effect of the specific endothelin type A receptor antagonist chem* FR 139317 *chem on chem* FK 506 *chem - induced hypertension in rats was studied .

column1: FK 506 , 5 mg .
column2: chem* FK 506 *chem , 5 mg .

column1: kg - 1 .
column2: kg - 1 .

column1: d - 1 given for 4 weeks , elevated blood pressure from 102 + / - 13 to 152 + / - 15 mm Hg and increased the synthesis of ET - 1 and the levels of ET - 1 mRNA in the mesenteric artery ( 240 % and 230 % , respectively ) .
column2: d - 1 given for 4 weeks , elevated blood pressure from 102 + / - 13 to 152 + / - 15 mm Hg and increased the synthesis of ET - 1 and the levels of ET - 1 mRNA in the mesenteric artery ( 240 % and 230 % , respectively ) .

column1: Little change was observed in the expression of ECE - 1 mRNA and CNP mRNA .
column2: Little change was observed in the expression of ECE - 1 mRNA and CNP mRNA .

column1: FK 506 decreased eNOS activity and the levels of eNOS mRNA in the aorta ( 48 % and 55 % , respectively ) .
column2: chem* FK 506 *chem decreased eNOS activity and the levels of eNOS mRNA in the aorta ( 48 % and 55 % , respectively ) .

column1: The administration of FR 139317 ( 10 mg . kg - 1 . d - 1 ) prevented FK 506 - induced hypertension in rats .
column2: The administration of chem* FR 139317 *chem ( 10 mg . kg - 1 . d - 1 ) prevented chem* FK 506 *chem - induced hypertension in rats .

column1: These results indicate that FK 506 may increase blood pressure not only by increasing ET - 1 production but also by decreasing NO synthesis in the vasculature .
column2: These results indicate that chem* FK 506 *chem may increase blood pressure not only by increasing ET - 1 production but also by decreasing chem* NO *chem synthesis in the vasculature .
